Use it to pacify the heat.🔽After that, apply a sweet and cool-tasting medicine

analyzed: rab tu tsha la na'o //

original: mkhris pa rgyas pa dang / me dpal gyi nad kyi cho ga dang 'dra bar bsil bag tu gyis shig / mar dang spra tshil la sogs pa lhing nag tu bskol bskol bas bsregs te tshig na sman rtsub bag gis myur du skus shig / thal sman rnon po gsha' ras byug pa dang
analyzed: mkhris pa rgyas pa dang / me dpal gyi nad kyi cho ga dang 'dra bar bsil bag tu gyis shig / mar dang spra tshil la sogs pa lhing nag tu bskol bskol bas bsregs te tshig na sman rtsub bag gis myur du skus shig / thal sman rnon po gsha' ras byug pa dang
translated: Treat the spread of bile and the disease of fire-glory in a cool manner, as in the ritual for treating fever.🔽If burned by repeatedly boiling ghee, wax, etc., in a closed vessel, quickly apply a rough medicine.

original: me btsa' gdab pa'i cho ga bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: me btsa' gdab pa'i cho ga bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the ritual for applying sharp medicinal powders and moxibustion is complete.

original: // / sman dpyad yan @56b lag brgyad pa'i snying po bshad pa'i mdo'i gnas rdzogs te /
analyzed: // / sman dpyad yan @56b lag brgyad pa'i snying po bshad pa'i mdo'i gnas rdzogs te /
translated: The section on the Sūtra of the Essence of the Eight Branches of Medical Science is complete.

original: bshad pa 'di dag ni gsang ba dang 'dra bar sman dpyad kyi dmigs bshad pa rnams mdo tsam zhig bshad pas rtsing ngo //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dag ni gsang ba dang 'dra bar sman dpyad kyi dmigs bshad pa rnams mdo tsam zhig bshad pas rtsing ngo //
translated: These explanations are rough because they are merely a brief explanation of the observed medical treatments, as if they were secrets.

original: zhib tu rgyas par ni 'og nas bstan cing bshad do //
analyzed: zhib tu rgyas par ni 'og nas bstan cing bshad do //
translated: They will be taught and explained in detail below.

original: sman pa'i bdag po seng ge sbas pa zhes bya ba'i bu sman pa chen po pha khol zhes bya bas yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po mdzad pa las mdo'i gnas zhes bya ba le'u sum cu pa rdzogs te yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i gnas dang po'o /
analyzed: sman pa'i bdag po seng ge sbas pa zhes bya ba'i bu sman pa chen po pha khol zhes bya bas yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po mdzad pa las mdo'i gnas zhes bya ba le'u sum cu pa rdzogs te yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i gnas dang po'o /
translated: The great physician Pha Khol, son of the physician lord called Siṃhagupta, composed the Essence of the Eight Branches. The chapter called “The Topics of the Sutra” is complete. This is the first topic of the Essence of the Eight Branches.

original: // / sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po las lus kyi gnas zhes bya ba /
analyzed: // / sman dpyad yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po las lus kyi gnas zhes bya ba /
translated: From the Essence of the Eight Branches of Medical Science, the chapter called “The Topics of the Body”

original: byis pa rum du chags pa drug las le'u dang po bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa rum du chags pa drug las le'u dang po bshad par bya'o //
translated: From the six topics on the development of the fetus, the first chapter will be explained.

original: de la sngon gyi drang srong chen po rgyun shes kyi bu la sogs pas bshad pa na re thog ma sems can ji skad skye zhe na /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi drang srong chen po rgyun shes kyi bu la sogs pas bshad pa na re thog ma sems can ji skad skye zhe na /
translated: When the great sages of the past such as Ātreya explain, they say, “First, how are sentient beings born?”

original: dang po pha ma'i khu ba dang khrag rlung la sogs pa'i skyon med pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba nam mkha' la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po lnga shin du cha phra ba dbang po'i yul las 'das pa rnal 'byor gyi yul du gyur pa /
analyzed: dang po pha ma'i khu ba dang khrag rlung la sogs pa'i skyon med pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba nam mkha' la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po lnga shin du cha phra ba dbang po'i yul las 'das pa rnal 'byor gyi yul du gyur pa /
translated: First, the father's semen and the mother's blood are without faults such as wind and so on, the consciousness endowed with karma and afflictions, and the five extremely subtle great elements such as space that arise simultaneously with it, which are beyond the objects of the sense faculties and become the object of a yogi.

original: de dag skad cig mngal du tshogs shing 'dus pa ni rum du chags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag skad cig mngal du tshogs shing 'dus pa ni rum du chags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The gathering and coming together of those in the womb is called the formation in the womb.

original: dper na gtsub shing dang / gtan pa dang / spra ba dang / skyes bus rtsol ba'i lag pa dang / 'di dag tshogs pa las me 'byung ba bzhin no //🔽de ltar chags nas kha zas zos pa'i dangs ma 'am /
analyzed: dper na gtsub shing dang / gtan pa dang / spra ba dang / skyes bus rtsol ba'i lag pa dang / 'di dag tshogs pa las me 'byung ba bzhin no // de ltar chags nas kha zas zos pa'i dangs ma 'am /
translated: For example, it is like fire arising from the assembly of a kindling stick, a drill, dry wood, and the effort of a person's hand.

original: bcud kyis nur nur po dang mer mer po la sogs par rim gyis 'gyur zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcud kyis nur nur po dang mer mer po la sogs par rim gyis 'gyur zhing 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having formed in that way, the essence of food that is eaten or the nutritive essence gradually transforms and increases into the kalala, arbuda, and so on.

original: de la rnam par shes pa dbang po'i yul las 'das pa ma'i mngal du ji ltar 'jug tu rung zhe na de ni mngon sum gyi dpes bstan te /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa dbang po'i yul las 'das pa ma'i mngal du ji ltar 'jug tu rung zhe na de ni mngon sum gyi dpes bstan te /
translated: How can consciousness, which is beyond the sense faculties and objects, enter the mother's womb? This is taught by the example of direct perception.

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer me shel la phog pa'i dbang gis rtsva dang shing la sogs pa bsregs par snang yang /🔽shing yang me shel la reg par mi snang la me shel yang shing la reg par ma mthong mod kyang tshig par snang ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa mngal gyi nang du zhugs pa yang mi snang ba'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer me shel la phog pa'i dbang gis rtsva dang shing la sogs pa bsregs par snang yang / shing yang me shel la reg par mi snang la me shel yang shing la reg par ma mthong mod kyang tshig par snang ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa mngal gyi nang du zhugs pa yang mi snang ba'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Just as the rays of the sun striking a magnifying glass appear to burn grass, trees, and so on,🔽although the wood does not appear to touch the magnifying glass and the magnifying glass is not seen to touch the wood, they are seen to burn.

original: de la rnam @57a * //
analyzed: de la rnam @57a * //
translated: Likewise, consciousness entering the womb does so by way of not appearing.

original: par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu 'byung ba chen po lnga ni sems can skye ba'i rgyur gcig na /
analyzed: par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu 'byung ba chen po lnga ni sems can skye ba'i rgyur gcig na /
translated: If the consciousness and the five great elements that are its coemergent causes are the cause of the birth of a sentient being,

original: skye ba rnam pa du ma snang ba'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba rnam pa du ma snang ba'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why do the many different types of birth appear?

original: mthun pa'i dpes bstan te ji ltar spra tshil dang zangs ma la sogs pa'i rgyu gcig pas gzugs tha dad pa sna tshogs dga' mgur byar yod de /
analyzed: mthun pa'i dpes bstan te ji ltar spra tshil dang zangs ma la sogs pa'i rgyu gcig pas gzugs tha dad pa sna tshogs dga' mgur byar yod de /
translated: This is taught by way of a concordant example.🔽Just as various different forms are possible from a single cause, such as wax or copper,

original: cir yang snang ba dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gcig pa las kyang tha dad par snang du rung ngo //
analyzed: cir yang snang ba dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gcig pa las kyang tha dad par snang du rung ngo //
translated: so it is possible for different things to appear from a single nature, just as anything can appear.

original: de bas na pha'i khu chu'i shas che ba las ni skyes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bas na pha'i khu chu'i shas che ba las ni skyes par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, if the father’s semen is predominant, a son is born.

original: ma'i khrag gi shas che ba las ni bu mor 'ong ngo //
analyzed: ma'i khrag gi shas che ba las ni bu mor 'ong ngo //
translated: If the mother’s blood is predominant, a daughter is born.

original: cha mnyam pa las ni ma ning du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa las ni ma ning du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the two are equal, a neuter is born.

original: bu mtshe mar 'ong ba ni chags nas mer mer po'i skabs su rlung gis dum bur bcad pa las du mar gyur te /
analyzed: bu mtshe mar 'ong ba ni chags nas mer mer po'i skabs su rlung gis dum bur bcad pa las du mar gyur te /
translated: Twins occur when, after attachment, the kalala is divided by the wind and becomes many.

original: de yang pho mo la sogs par 'byung ba ni khu khrag gi shas che chung gong ma ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang pho mo la sogs par 'byung ba ni khu khrag gi shas che chung gong ma ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Also, the occurrence of male and female and so on should be understood in terms of the predominance of semen and blood as before.

original: pha ma'i khu khrag rlung la sogs pa'i skyon dang bcas pa las ni skye ba mi mthun pa sbrul dang byi ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dang / gzhan yang long ba dang / 'on pa dang / zha bo dang / grum po dang / theng po dang /
analyzed: pha ma'i khu khrag rlung la sogs pa'i skyon dang bcas pa las ni skye ba mi mthun pa sbrul dang byi ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dang / gzhan yang long ba dang / 'on pa dang / zha bo dang / grum po dang / theng po dang /
translated: A birth that is not in accordance with the norm occurs when the father's or mother's semen and blood are defective, or when the wind is defective.🔽Other defects are: blind, deaf, lame, paralyzed, crippled,

original: mi'u thung dang / lus mi sdug pa la sogs pa lus skyon dang bcas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mi'u thung dang / lus mi sdug pa la sogs pa lus skyon dang bcas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: dwarf, ugly, etc.

original: bud med kyi zla mtshan zla ba gcig la lan gsum 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bud med kyi zla mtshan zla ba gcig la lan gsum 'byung ngo //
translated: The menstrual period of a woman occurs three times a month.

original: de yang thog ma lo bcu gnyis lon pa nas te lo lnga bcu phan chad ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang thog ma lo bcu gnyis lon pa nas te lo lnga bcu phan chad ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, it occurs for the first time at the age of twelve, and does not occur after the age of fifty.

original: skyes bu gang lo bcu drug gam nyi shu yang lon /
analyzed: skyes bu gang lo bcu drug gam nyi shu yang lon /
translated: A man who is sixteen or twenty years old,

original: mngal gyi gnas kyang dag / khu ba dang khrag la yang nyes pa med /
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas kyang dag / khu ba dang khrag la yang nyes pa med /
translated: whose womb is pure, whose semen and blood are pure,

original: rlung la skyon med cing pha ma gnyis sems dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bu ni shin tu stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung la skyon med cing pha ma gnyis sems dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bu ni shin tu stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: whose wind is pure, whose parents are full of joy, will have a very strong child.

original: gong ma gnyis las lo nyung ba bcu dgu 'am lo bco lnga pa'i bu tsha ni nad mang ba dang / tshe thung ba dang / mngal zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong ma gnyis las lo nyung ba bcu dgu 'am lo bco lnga pa'i bu tsha ni nad mang ba dang / tshe thung ba dang / mngal zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The children of a father or mother who is less than nineteen or fifteen years old have many illnesses, have a short life, and are aborted.

original: pha ma'i khu ba dang / khrag rlung la sogs pa'i skyon gyis 'dres na ni sa bon gyi rus pa zhan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha ma'i khu ba dang / khrag rlung la sogs pa'i skyon gyis 'dres na ni sa bon gyi rus pa zhan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the semen and blood of the parents are mixed with faults of wind and so forth, the bones of the seed will be weak.

original: de yang myags pa dang / mdud pa can dang / rnag lta bu dang / zad byed dang / dri ma can dang lnga'o //
analyzed: de yang myags pa dang / mdud pa can dang / rnag lta bu dang / zad byed dang / dri ma can dang lnga'o //
translated: Further, there are five types: rotten, knotted, pus-like, wasting, and dirty.

original: lnga po de dag kyang rlung la sogs pa'i rang rang gi rtags dang mthun par 'byung ste /🔽@57b de yang rlung las gyur pa'i rtags ni khu ba rtsub pa dang / mdog sngo bsangs su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lnga po de dag kyang rlung la sogs pa'i rang rang gi rtags dang mthun par 'byung ste / @57b de yang rlung las gyur pa'i rtags ni khu ba rtsub pa dang / mdog sngo bsangs su 'byung ba'o //
translated: Those five also arise in accordance with the individual signs of wind and so forth.🔽The signs of those arising from wind are that the semen is rough and has a bluish color.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rtags ni shin tu sla ba dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / mdog ser skya la sogs par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rtags ni shin tu sla ba dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / mdog ser skya la sogs par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The signs of those arising from bile are that it is very thin, has a bad smell, and has a pale yellow color and so forth.

original: bad kan la sogs pa'i rtags ni shin tu dkar ba la sogs par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pa'i rtags ni shin tu dkar ba la sogs par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The signs of phlegm and so on are very white and so forth.

original: gzhan yang khrag las gyur pa'i mtshan ma ni ro myags lta bu'i dri mar snang ba'o //🔽bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa ni khu ba dang / khrag mdog dud pa ltar snang ba'o /
analyzed: gzhan yang khrag las gyur pa'i mtshan ma ni ro myags lta bu'i dri mar snang ba'o // bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa ni khu ba dang / khrag mdog dud pa ltar snang ba'o /
translated: Moreover, the sign of blood is a pus-like appearance.🔽The sign of phlegm and wind is a fluid that appears like smoke.

original: khrag dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i mtshan ma ni rnag lta bu'o //
analyzed: khrag dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i mtshan ma ni rnag lta bu'o //
translated: The sign of blood and bile is pus-like.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa las gyur pa ni shin tu rul ba'o //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa las gyur pa ni shin tu rul ba'o //
translated: The sign of wind and bile is very rotten.

original: nad gzhi 'dus pa las gyur pa ni dri ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: nad gzhi 'dus pa las gyur pa ni dri ma lta bu ste /
translated: The sign of a combination of the three humors is like dirt.

original: de dag las kyang 'dus pa las gyur pa dri ma lta bu ni gsor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag las kyang 'dus pa las gyur pa dri ma lta bu ni gsor mi rung ngo //
translated: Among them, the sign of a combination of the three humors, which is like dirt, is incurable.

original: lhag ma gso bar bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma gso bar bya ste /
translated: The remaining [signs] are curable.

original: rlung las gyur pa ni snum bag dang / dro ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva la sogs pas gso'o //
analyzed: rlung las gyur pa ni snum bag dang / dro ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva la sogs pas gso'o //
translated: The sign of wind is cured by oil, heat, sour, salty, and so on.

original: mkhris pa las gyur ba ni mngar ba dang / bsil ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba la sogs pas gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur ba ni mngar ba dang / bsil ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba la sogs pas gso bar bya'o //
translated: Those arising from bile should be treated with sweet, cool, sour, and astringent [medicines].

original: bad kan las gyur pa ni rtsub pa dang / rno ba la sogs pa sbyin no //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa ni rtsub pa dang / rno ba la sogs pa sbyin no //
translated: Those arising from phlegm should be treated with rough, sharp, and so forth.

original: khrag las gyur pa ni mkhris pa gso ba'i cho gas zhi bar nus mod kyi /
analyzed: khrag las gyur pa ni mkhris pa gso ba'i cho gas zhi bar nus mod kyi /
translated: Those arising from blood can be pacified by the methods for treating bile.

original: 'on kyang khrag las gyur pa'i myags pa ni da ta ka'i me tog dang / seng ldeng dang / bal po se'u dang / aar dzu na dang / 'di rnams mar dang tshul bzhin du bskol te btung ba 'am yang na aa sa na'i sde tshan cha ra dang bskol te 'thungs na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang khrag las gyur pa'i myags pa ni da ta ka'i me tog dang / seng ldeng dang / bal po se'u dang / aar dzu na dang / 'di rnams mar dang tshul bzhin du bskol te btung ba 'am yang na aa sa na'i sde tshan cha ra dang bskol te 'thungs na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, for blood-born leprosy, boil together datura flowers, karanja, pomegranate, and arjuna in ghee and drink it. Alternatively, boil the asafoetida group with chara and drink it. It will be pacified.

original: dud pa ltar snang ba'i nad la ni shing pa la sha bsregs pa'i thal ba dang / sru sru'i rtsa ba 'di gnyis mar dang tshul bzhin du bskol ba 'thungs na phan no //
analyzed: dud pa ltar snang ba'i nad la ni shing pa la sha bsregs pa'i thal ba dang / sru sru'i rtsa ba 'di gnyis mar dang tshul bzhin du bskol ba 'thungs na phan no //
translated: For the disease that appears like smoke, drink a mixture of the ashes of burnt palasha wood and the root of the two kinds of turmeric boiled in ghee. It will be beneficial.

original: rnag lta bu'i nad pa la ni pa ru sha ka dang / n+ya gro dha'i sde tshan mar dang tshul bzhin bskol ba 'thungs na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnag lta bu'i nad pa la ni pa ru sha ka dang / n+ya gro dha'i sde tshan mar dang tshul bzhin bskol ba 'thungs na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For those with a disease like pus, if they drink clarified butter and sesame oil boiled properly with the Nyagrodha group, it will be pacified.

original: khu ba zad pa'i nad la ni ro tsa ba'i sman dpyad bya'o //
analyzed: khu ba zad pa'i nad la ni ro tsa ba'i sman dpyad bya'o //
translated: For a disease of exhausted semen, one should perform the medical treatment of rotsa.

original: dri ma lta bu la ni dang po slon khrus kyis lus dag par byas la de nas shing kun dang / pu shel tse dang / kru trug tres dang / 'di rnams mar dang tshul bzhin du sbyar ba 'thungs na phan no //🔽bud med kyi zla @58a * //
analyzed: dri ma lta bu la ni dang po slon khrus kyis lus dag par byas la de nas shing kun dang / pu shel tse dang / kru trug tres dang / 'di rnams mar dang tshul bzhin du sbyar ba 'thungs na phan no // bud med kyi zla @58a * //
translated: For a disease like dirt, first one should cleanse the body with a bath, and then drink a mixture of Devadaru, Pushpel tse, and Kritruka properly boiled with butter. This is beneficial.

original: mtshan mdud pa can la ni sba tha dang / tsha ba gsum dang / dug mo yungs dang / 'di rnams chu dang bskol ba'i khu ba blud na phan no //
analyzed: mtshan mdud pa can la ni sba tha dang / tsha ba gsum dang / dug mo yungs dang / 'di rnams chu dang bskol ba'i khu ba blud na phan no //
translated: For a woman with a knot in her menstrual cycle, one should drink a decoction of Vacha, the three hot medicines, and Dhugmo yungs boiled with water. This is beneficial.

original: bud med kyi zla mtshan rnag dang myags pa lta bu la ni tsandan bskol ba'i khu ba 'thungs na phan no //
analyzed: bud med kyi zla mtshan rnag dang myags pa lta bu la ni tsandan bskol ba'i khu ba 'thungs na phan no //
translated: For a woman with menstrual discharge like pus and rotting, if she drinks a decoction of boiled sandalwood, it is beneficial.

original: gzhan yang zla mtshan gyi nad mo mtshan gso ba'i dpyad 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba dang / sman la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin du ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang zla mtshan gyi nad mo mtshan gso ba'i dpyad 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba dang / sman la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin du ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Furthermore, there are the medical treatments for curing the diseases of menstruation, the application of ointments, and so forth, as will be explained below.

original: skyes bu gang gi khu chu dkar ba dang / lci ba dang / snum pa dang / mngar ba dang / bska ba dang / mang ba dang / gzhan yang mdog sbrang rtsi lta bu dang / mar dang 'bru mar lta bu dang 'di dag ltar snang na bu bzang po skye ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gi khu chu dkar ba dang / lci ba dang / snum pa dang / mngar ba dang / bska ba dang / mang ba dang / gzhan yang mdog sbrang rtsi lta bu dang / mar dang 'bru mar lta bu dang 'di dag ltar snang na bu bzang po skye ba'i rtags so //
translated: If the man’s semen is white, heavy, oily, sweet, astringent, abundant, and also has the color of honey, ghee, or oil, these are signs of a good child being born.

original: bud med gang zla mtshan rgya skyegs kyi khu ba lta bu dang / ri bong gi khrag lta bu dang / nad med pa'i khrag dang / 'di lta bu yod na'ang bu bzang po skye ba'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: bud med gang zla mtshan rgya skyegs kyi khu ba lta bu dang / ri bong gi khrag lta bu dang / nad med pa'i khrag dang / 'di lta bu yod na'ang bu bzang po skye ba'i rkyen yin no //
translated: If the woman’s menstrual blood is like the juice of lac, like the blood of a rabbit, or like healthy blood, these are also conditions for a good child being born.

original: pha ma'i khu khrag skyon med cing chags pa'i sems dang bcas pas 'dod pa spyod na bu skye ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: pha ma'i khu khrag skyon med cing chags pa'i sems dang bcas pas 'dod pa spyod na bu skye ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: If the parents’ semen and blood are faultless and they engage in sexual intercourse with a passionate mind, this is the cause for a child being born.

original: thog mar skyes pa dang / bud med dge ba'i sman mar dang / 'bras bu'i sman mar gyis snum gyi cho ga byas la /
analyzed: thog mar skyes pa dang / bud med dge ba'i sman mar dang / 'bras bu'i sman mar gyis snum gyi cho ga byas la /
translated: First, the woman or man should be anointed with a medicinal oil of virtuous ghee and fruit ghee.

original: slon khrus kyis lus dag par byas te de'i 'og tu 'jam rtsi bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: slon khrus kyis lus dag par byas te de'i 'og tu 'jam rtsi bsten par bya'o //
translated: Then, having purified the body with a cleansing enema, one should apply the unctuous substance.

original: khyad par du skyes pa la ni 'o ma dang / mar dang / mngar ba dang / sman dzi wan ti dang / rgun 'bru'i sde tshan sbyar la sbyin no //
analyzed: khyad par du skyes pa la ni 'o ma dang / mar dang / mngar ba dang / sman dzi wan ti dang / rgun 'bru'i sde tshan sbyar la sbyin no //

original: de la ni lus phyi nang gnyi sa ka nas snum pa dang / bsil ba'i bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bsku ba dang / blugs pa'i gso ba sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la ni lus phyi nang gnyi sa ka nas snum pa dang / bsil ba'i bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bsku ba dang / blugs pa'i gso ba sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: then apply the treatment of oily, cooling food and drink, massage, and enema, both externally and internally.

original: de yang pu shel tse dang / padma dang / candan dang / shing 'o ma can gyi shun pa dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma mar dang lde gur byas pas ras la bskus te /
analyzed: de yang pu shel tse dang / padma dang / candan dang / shing 'o ma can gyi shun pa dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma mar dang lde gur byas pas ras la bskus te /
translated: For that, make a paste of pushel tse, lotus, sandalwood, and the bark of a milky tree, and smear it on a cloth.

original: ras bsgril la tham bu thabs su byas pas /
analyzed: ras bsgril la tham bu thabs su byas pas /
translated: Wrap the cloth and make a poultice.

original: mtshan gyi sgo nas btsangs la gzhag go //
analyzed: mtshan gyi sgo nas btsangs la gzhag go //

original: mar chu nang du lan brgya tsam mnyes pas lus bsku'o //
analyzed: mar chu nang du lan brgya tsam mnyes pas lus bsku'o //
translated: Massage the body with ghee that has been heated in water a hundred times.

original: yang na gong gi au shi ra la sogs pa'i phye ma chu dang sbyar ba'i nang du lus gzhug go //
analyzed: yang na gong gi au shi ra la sogs pa'i phye ma chu dang sbyar ba'i nang du lus gzhug go //
translated: Or, immerse the body in water mixed with the above powders of uśīra and so forth.

original: ka ra dkar po dang / sbrang rtsi dang / ku mu da dang / autpa la dang / padma ge sar sbyar ba'i lde gu sbyin no //
analyzed: ka ra dkar po dang / sbrang rtsi dang / ku mu da dang / autpa la dang / padma ge sar sbyar ba'i lde gu sbyin no //
translated: A paste of white sugar, honey, kumuda, utpala, and lotus filaments is given.

original: shri ka ta ka dang / ka she ru ka mar dang / 'o ma dang sbyar ba'i bza' ba sbyin no //
analyzed: shri ka ta ka dang / ka she ru ka mar dang / 'o ma dang sbyar ba'i bza' ba sbyin no //
translated: A food prepared with shrikata, kasheruka, ghee, and milk is given.

original: yang na pri yang ku dang / autpa la'i rtsa ba dang / au dumb'a ra gzhon nu 'di rnams phye mar byas te /🔽'o ma dang / btung ba 'am /
analyzed: yang na pri yang ku dang / autpa la'i rtsa ba dang / au dumb'a ra gzhon nu 'di rnams phye mar byas te / 'o ma dang / btung ba 'am /
translated: Alternatively, these are ground into a powder: priyangu, utpala root, and young udumbara.🔽This is given as a drink with milk

original: yang na 'o ma dang bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na 'o ma dang bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
translated: or as a drink boiled with milk.

original: yang na 'bras s'a lu'i rtsa ba dang / ka ko la dang / ba la rnam gnyis dang / shing mngar dang / bu ram shing 'di rnams chu dang 'o ma dang bskol la /
analyzed: yang na 'bras s'a lu'i rtsa ba dang / ka ko la dang / ba la rnam gnyis dang / shing mngar dang / bu ram shing 'di rnams chu dang 'o ma dang bskol la /
translated: Alternatively, the roots of rice, kakola, the two types of pala, sweet flag, and sugarcane are boiled with water and milk.

original: chu ni du'o ma lus pa dang / sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ras btab la sbyin no //
analyzed: chu ni du'o ma lus pa dang / sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ras btab la sbyin no //
translated: The water is drained, and the remaining liquid is mixed with honey and shakara.

original: yang na thang la gnas pa'i srog chags kyi sha bsil ba'i khu ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ras btab pa blud do //🔽gzhan @64a * //
analyzed: yang na thang la gnas pa'i srog chags kyi sha bsil ba'i khu ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ras btab pa blud do // gzhan @64a * //
translated: Alternatively, one should give her a drink of honey and meat broth cooled down.

original: slon khrus ma gtogs pa phyi ma khrag mkhris gso ba'i cho ga thams cad skabs 'dir sbyar ro //
analyzed: slon khrus ma gtogs pa phyi ma khrag mkhris gso ba'i cho ga thams cad skabs 'dir sbyar ro //

original: zla ba gsum gyi bar du khrag dbyung ba dgag pa'i gso ba byas la /
analyzed: zla ba gsum gyi bar du khrag dbyung ba dgag pa'i gso ba byas la /
translated: For three months, one should perform the treatment to stop bleeding.

original: bu legs par brtan par bya ba'i phyir bu gso ba la 'bad pa dang bcas par bya'o //
analyzed: bu legs par brtan par bya ba'i phyir bu gso ba la 'bad pa dang bcas par bya'o //
translated: In order to ensure the proper development of the fetus, one should exert oneself in the treatment of the fetus.

original: ci ste khrag dbyung ba la sogs pa'i gso ba ma byas na ni mngal du bu mi 'chags shing brtan por mi 'gyur bar sman dpyad bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste khrag dbyung ba la sogs pa'i gso ba ma byas na ni mngal du bu mi 'chags shing brtan por mi 'gyur bar sman dpyad bya'o //
translated: If one does not perform the treatment of bleeding and so forth, the fetus will not develop in the womb and will not be stable.

original: gal te bud med la be'u snabs kyi nad byung na de la ni phan pa'i sman bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te bud med la be'u snabs kyi nad byung na de la ni phan pa'i sman bsten par bya ste /
translated: If a woman develops a condition of beusnap, one should rely on beneficial medicine.

original: de yang bza' ba dang btung ba ni bsil ba'i bag gis lus kyi nang nas sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang bza' ba dang btung ba ni bsil ba'i bag gis lus kyi nang nas sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, the food and drink should be cool and applied internally.

original: sman yang kha ba dang bska ba'i rtsub chos bya'o //
analyzed: sman yang kha ba dang bska ba'i rtsub chos bya'o //
translated: The medicine should also be bitter and astringent.

original: gzhan yang smyung ba bya zhing gla sgang dang / pu shel tse dang / sle tres dang / aa ra lu dang / 'u su dang / byi tsher ba dang / bar pa ta dang / tsandan dang / bong nga dkar po dang 'di rnams chu dang bskol ba'i khu ba'i skom du blud do //
analyzed: gzhan yang smyung ba bya zhing gla sgang dang / pu shel tse dang / sle tres dang / aa ra lu dang / 'u su dang / byi tsher ba dang / bar pa ta dang / tsandan dang / bong nga dkar po dang 'di rnams chu dang bskol ba'i khu ba'i skom du blud do //
translated: Moreover, fasting should be done, and a drink should be given of a decoction boiled with gleng ga, pushhel tse, letre, aralu, ushu, byi tsher ba, bar pa ta, sandalwood, and white mussel.

original: zas su ni 'bru gsum po dang / ci tshe dang / khre dang / ci tshe rgod 'di dag gsum las g-yos su byas la sbyin no //
analyzed: zas su ni 'bru gsum po dang / ci tshe dang / khre dang / ci tshe rgod 'di dag gsum las g-yos su byas la sbyin no //
translated: For food, one should give gruel made from the three grains, wheat, barley, and oats.

original: yang na mon sran sde'u la sogs gang bu nas skyes pa'i sran ma'i rigs kyi au sha'i khu bcud dang gar ma'i zas lhan cig sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na mon sran sde'u la sogs gang bu nas skyes pa'i sran ma'i rigs kyi au sha'i khu bcud dang gar ma'i zas lhan cig sbyin no //
translated: Or, one should give the juice of uśīra and the food of garlic together with beans such as lentils.

original: sman dang zas de dag gis ma zhu ba'i be'u snabs kyi nad zhi bar gyur na gong ma bzhin du bsil ba dang / snum chos la sogs pa phyi nang gnyis ka nas bya'o //
analyzed: sman dang zas de dag gis ma zhu ba'i be'u snabs kyi nad zhi bar gyur na gong ma bzhin du bsil ba dang / snum chos la sogs pa phyi nang gnyis ka nas bya'o //
translated: If the disease of undigested food is cured by those medicines and foods, then as before, cooling, oily, and so forth should be done both externally and internally.

original: gal te byis pa zla ba ma tshang bar phyir 'phyil bar gyur na de'i tshe zug gzer drag po myong ste de ma thag tu zug gzer mi dran pa dang / mngal bde bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te byis pa zla ba ma tshang bar phyir 'phyil bar gyur na de'i tshe zug gzer drag po myong ste de ma thag tu zug gzer mi dran pa dang / mngal bde bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If the child is born prematurely, then at that time there is severe pain, which is immediately forgotten, and for the comfort of the womb,

original: chang bzang po legs par smin pa yog tshad bud med la sbyin no //
analyzed: chang bzang po legs par smin pa yog tshad bud med la sbyin no //
translated: good, well-ripened beer is given to the woman.

original: de nas rtsa ba chung du lnga bskol ba'i khu ba las gzhi blangs pa'i 'bras thug blud do //
analyzed: de nas rtsa ba chung du lnga bskol ba'i khu ba las gzhi blangs pa'i 'bras thug blud do //
translated: Then, gruel made from the five minor roots is given.

analyzed: gal te chang mi 'thung ba zhig yin na ni tsha ba rnam pa lnga dang sbyar ba'i thug pa sbyin no //
translated: If she does not drink beer, then a soup prepared with the five hot ingredients is given.

original: de nas bil ba la sogs pa'i rtsa ba chen po lnga bskol ba'i khu ba las gzhi blangs la gong gi 'bru gsum dang / til dang sbyar ba'i zan dron sbyin no //
analyzed: de nas bil ba la sogs pa'i rtsa ba chen po lnga bskol ba'i khu ba las gzhi blangs la gong gi 'bru gsum dang / til dang sbyar ba'i zan dron sbyin no //
translated: Then, gruel made from the five major roots, such as bilva, is given, along with the three grains mentioned above and sesame.

original: ci ste bu zla ba gcig lon pa na 'byil bar gyur na thug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga gong ma zhag gcig gi bar du sbyin no //
analyzed: ci ste bu zla ba gcig lon pa na 'byil bar gyur na thug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga gong ma zhag gcig gi bar du sbyin no //
translated: If the child is born after one month, then the above soup and so forth are given for one day.

original: de bzhin du @64b zla ba bzhi nas brgyad kyi bar du zla grangs dang zhag grangs re rer sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du @64b zla ba bzhi nas brgyad kyi bar du zla grangs dang zhag grangs re rer sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, the number of months and days should be increased from four to eight.

original: kha zas kyang yang bag tshod zin par bza' ste /
analyzed: kha zas kyang yang bag tshod zin par bza' ste /
translated: The diet should be light and taken in moderation.

original: de yang snum dang lan tshva med pa me'i drod skyed par byed pa'i sman na le sham la sogs pa tsha ba rnam ba lnga dang bcas pa byin na phan no //
analyzed: de yang snum dang lan tshva med pa me'i drod skyed par byed pa'i sman na le sham la sogs pa tsha ba rnam ba lnga dang bcas pa byin na phan no //
translated: If the patient is given a diet that is not oily or salty, but which contains the five hot substances such as ginger that stimulate the digestive heat, it will be beneficial.

original: gong du bstan pa'i zas dang sman la sogs pa'i cho ga bstan pa ni srog zungs bdun dang chu ser dang / rlung mkhris la sogs pa 'khrugs pa zhi zhing bskom pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i zas dang sman la sogs pa'i cho ga bstan pa ni srog zungs bdun dang chu ser dang / rlung mkhris la sogs pa 'khrugs pa zhi zhing bskom pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
translated: The above mentioned rules for diet, medicine, and so forth are taught to pacify the disturbance of the seven bodily constituents, lymph, wind, bile, and so forth, and to alleviate thirst.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu snum pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba dang / ni ru ha btang na stobs dang ldan pa dang / me'i drod skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu snum pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba dang / ni ru ha btang na stobs dang ldan pa dang / me'i drod skyed par byed do //
translated: After that, if the patient is given oily food and drink, and niruha enema, it will increase strength and digestive heat.

original: gzhan yang dzi ban ti'i sde tshan 'o ma dang sbyar la blud do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dzi ban ti'i sde tshan 'o ma dang sbyar la blud do //
translated: Moreover, the group of jivanti herbs should be given with milk.

original: gzhan yang khong pa'i nang du bu la nad kyang med /
analyzed: gzhan yang khong pa'i nang du bu la nad kyang med /
translated: Furthermore, there is no illness in the womb of the child.

original: nyams stobs dang ldan bzhin du mo mtshan nas khrag 'dzag ste bu 'phel zhing rgyas par ma nus pa yang yod de /
analyzed: nyams stobs dang ldan bzhin du mo mtshan nas khrag 'dzag ste bu 'phel zhing rgyas par ma nus pa yang yod de /
translated: Even though the mother is healthy, blood may flow from her vagina and the child is unable to grow and develop.

original: de 'phar ba 'am 'gul bar mi snang na de'i so na gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de 'phar ba 'am 'gul bar mi snang na de'i so na gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If it does not appear to move or stir, it is called “remaining in the teeth.”

original: de ltar na bu 'phel ma nus pa'i rgyus ma'i lto ba cher skye bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: de ltar na bu 'phel ma nus pa'i rgyus ma'i lto ba cher skye bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: In this way, because the child is unable to grow, the mother’s belly does not become large.

original: gzhan mas mya ngan smyung ba dang / rtsub pa la sogs pa'i rgyus rlung 'khrugs pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan mas mya ngan smyung ba dang / rtsub pa la sogs pa'i rgyus rlung 'khrugs pa 'am /
translated: Other mothers, due to grief, fasting, roughness, and so on, the vāyu becomes disturbed.

original: khrag mang po byung ba'i rgyus rlung 'khrugs pa'am /
analyzed: khrag mang po byung ba'i rgyus rlung 'khrugs pa'am /
translated: Due to the cause of much blood, the vāyu becomes disturbed.

original: de gnyis gang yang rung ba'i rgyus bu de rid cing skems par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de gnyis gang yang rung ba'i rgyus bu de rid cing skems par 'gyur la /
translated: Due to the cause of either of those two, the child becomes emaciated and dehydrated.

original: de'i ming ni go da ra zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i ming ni go da ra zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called “godara.”

original: nang gi bu'i 'gribs pa'i dbang gis sngar lto ba cher skyes na yang phyis 'grib par snang ste /
analyzed: nang gi bu'i 'gribs pa'i dbang gis sngar lto ba cher skyes na yang phyis 'grib par snang ste /
translated: Due to the power of the child’s emaciation, even if the belly was previously large, it later appears to shrink.

original: nang du 'gul ba yang yun ring po nas cung zhig 'gul pa yin no //
analyzed: nang du 'gul ba yang yun ring po nas cung zhig 'gul pa yin no //
translated: Even the internal movement is a slight movement after a long time.

original: de la so na gnas pa dang / nad go ta ra zhes bya ba 'di gnyis la ni nyams stobs skyed pa'i sman dang / rlung 'joms pa'i sman dang / mngar ba'i sman dang / mar dang / 'o ma dang / re'u btsas ma thag pa'i sha dang ;
analyzed: de la so na gnas pa dang / nad go ta ra zhes bya ba 'di gnyis la ni nyams stobs skyed pa'i sman dang / rlung 'joms pa'i sman dang / mngar ba'i sman dang / mar dang / 'o ma dang / re'u btsas ma thag pa'i sha dang ;
translated: In the case of those two, remaining as before and called disease, one should give medicine to increase strength, medicine to conquer wind, sweet medicine, butter, milk, and the flesh of a newly born kid.

original: 'di rnams legs par sbyar la ma la tshim tshad du sbyin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams legs par sbyar la ma la tshim tshad du sbyin no //
translated: Having well prepared these, give them in a suitable dose.

original: de'i 'og tu bzhon pa la bskyon te cung zhig bskul lo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bzhon pa la bskyon te cung zhig bskul lo //
translated: After that, one should mount [the patient] on a vehicle and drive a little.

original: khong pa na nang gi bu'i tshad sngon po zhes bya ba 'gul mi shes pa yod de /
analyzed: khong pa na nang gi bu'i tshad sngon po zhes bya ba 'gul mi shes pa yod de /
translated: Inside the body, there is an internal child called blue measure, which cannot move.🔽For that, there is the flesh of a she-bird, a goose, an ugra bird, a peacock,

original: de la ni bya she na dang / go bad tsha dang / aug kro sha dang / rma bya dang / @65a * //
analyzed: de la ni bya she na dang / go bad tsha dang / aug kro sha dang / rma bya dang / @65a * //
translated: and a swan.

original: 'di rnams kyi sha'i khu ba'i nang du mar mang po blugs pa'am yang na mon sran gre'u dang / la phug gi khu ba'i nang du mar mang po blugs la sbyin pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi sha'i khu ba'i nang du mar mang po blugs pa'am yang na mon sran gre'u dang / la phug gi khu ba'i nang du mar mang po blugs la sbyin pa 'am /
translated: In the juice of these meats, pour a lot of ghee, or else pour a lot of ghee in the juice of green gram and radish.

original: yang na bil ba gzhon nu dang / til dang / mon sran gre'u dang / phye dang 'di rnams chu dang 'o ma dang bskol ba'i thug pa blud do //
analyzed: yang na bil ba gzhon nu dang / til dang / mon sran gre'u dang / phye dang 'di rnams chu dang 'o ma dang bskol ba'i thug pa blud do //
translated: Or else, give a gruel of young bilva fruit, sesame, green gram, and flour, boiled in water and milk.

original: rked pa man chad til mar gyis bsku byug bya ste /
analyzed: rked pa man chad til mar gyis bsku byug bya ste /
translated: Anoint the area below the waist with sesame oil.

original: srog chags gzhon nu'i sha zos la /
analyzed: srog chags gzhon nu'i sha zos la /
translated: Eat the flesh of young animals.

original: de dang rgun chang dang lhan cig sbyin no //
analyzed: de dang rgun chang dang lhan cig sbyin no //
translated: Give that together with grape wine.

original: bud med sbrum ma la ni rtag tu 'byung bar 'ong ngo //
analyzed: bud med sbrum ma la ni rtag tu 'byung bar 'ong ngo //
translated: For a pregnant woman, it always comes.

original: zhes dga' ba'i sems skyed de /
analyzed: zhes dga' ba'i sems skyed de /
translated: Thus, generate a joyful mind.

original: de la kha zas la sogs pa mi mthun pa bsten pa'i dbang gis lus yongs su rdzogs na yang lo grangs su 'dug ste /
analyzed: de la kha zas la sogs pa mi mthun pa bsten pa'i dbang gis lus yongs su rdzogs na yang lo grangs su 'dug ste /
translated: If the body is fully developed due to relying on incompatible food and so forth, it stays for years.

original: shin tu dka' bas nyam thag sde mi 'byung ba yang yod /
analyzed: shin tu dka' bas nyam thag sde mi 'byung ba yang yod /
translated: Due to great difficulty, there is also no arising of the army of illness.

original: la la dag ni 'byung ba yang yod do //
analyzed: la la dag ni 'byung ba yang yod do //
translated: For some, it does arise.

original: bud med sbrum ma la 'ang rtug pa 'gags pa'i nad byung na de la ni snum chen po bzhi gang dang 'byor ba'i 'jam rtsi mas gtong na de ma thag 'byung ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: bud med sbrum ma la 'ang rtug pa 'gags pa'i nad byung na de la ni snum chen po bzhi gang dang 'byor ba'i 'jam rtsi mas gtong na de ma thag 'byung ba'i rigs so //
translated: If a pregnant woman has a condition where the feces are obstructed, if she inserts a suppository of the four great oils and whatever is available, it will immediately come out.

original: gal te nad gzhi 'khrugs pa'am ma sngon gyi las kyis ma bu gnyis ka 'chi ba yang yod do //
analyzed: gal te nad gzhi 'khrugs pa'am ma sngon gyi las kyis ma bu gnyis ka 'chi ba yang yod do //
translated: If the condition is disturbed or if the mother and child both die due to past karma, there are also such cases.

original: de'i rtags ni lto ba'i nang grang ba dang / rengs pa dang / sbo ba dang / nad tshabs che ba dang / nang gi mi 'gul ba dang / mgo 'khor ba dang / skom dang che ba dang / dbugs nyam thag par 'byin pa dang /
analyzed: de'i rtags ni lto ba'i nang grang ba dang / rengs pa dang / sbo ba dang / nad tshabs che ba dang / nang gi mi 'gul ba dang / mgo 'khor ba dang / skom dang che ba dang / dbugs nyam thag par 'byin pa dang /
translated: The signs of that are: cold in the abdomen, stiffness, swelling, severe illness, lack of movement inside, dizziness, thirst, and heavy breathing.

original: lus dub pa dang / gnas la sogs pa la mi dga' ba dang / rtabs mig tu blta ba dang / rtags de dag dang ldan zhing bu phyir skye ba'i mtshan ma mi snang na nges par bu nang du shi ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: lus dub pa dang / gnas la sogs pa la mi dga' ba dang / rtabs mig tu blta ba dang / rtags de dag dang ldan zhing bu phyir skye ba'i mtshan ma mi snang na nges par bu nang du shi ba'i rtags so //
translated: Weakness of the body, dislike of staying in one place, and staring eyes - if she has these signs and there are no signs of giving birth to a child, it is definitely a sign that the child has died inside.

original: gal te bu nang du shi ste mthon na chu dron pos mngal gyi sgo khrus bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bu nang du shi ste mthon na chu dron pos mngal gyi sgo khrus bya'o //
translated: If the child dies inside and is not delivered, the door of the womb should be washed with warm water.

original: phabs dang bu ram dang lan tshva lhan cig sbyar ba'i lde gus mo mtshan gyi nang du bsku zhing de nas mu dza ra'i phye ma dang / mar sbyar ba'i lde gus mo mtshan gyi nang du yang dang yang phul zhing dgang bar byas na nang nas dbyung ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: phabs dang bu ram dang lan tshva lhan cig sbyar ba'i lde gus mo mtshan gyi nang du bsku zhing de nas mu dza ra'i phye ma dang / mar sbyar ba'i lde gus mo mtshan gyi nang du yang dang yang phul zhing dgang bar byas na nang nas dbyung ba'i rigs so //
translated: The inside of the vagina should be anointed with a paste of yeast, molasses, and salt, and then the inside of the vagina should be repeatedly filled and expanded with a paste of Muzi ra powder and ghee.

original: thabs de dag gis ma byung na srid srung gi rig byed kyi sngags kyis btab la dbyung ngo //
analyzed: thabs de dag gis ma byung na srid srung gi rig byed kyi sngags kyis btab la dbyung ngo //
translated: If it does not come out by those means, it should be delivered with the mantra of the Rig Veda of the protector of existence.

original: des kyang ma thon na rnal 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom mo //
analyzed: des kyang ma thon na rnal 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom mo //
translated: If it does not come out by that, the yogic concentration should be meditated.

translated: one should use the three myrobalan fruits, talas, goat’s horn, padmarāga, and sugar.

original: zla ba lnga pa la bab pa'i tshe na ni bri ha ti rnam gnyis dang / tang bal dang / shing 'o ma can gyi myu gu dang / shun pa dang / mar dang de rnams sbyar ro //
analyzed: zla ba lnga pa la bab pa'i tshe na ni bri ha ti rnam gnyis dang / tang bal dang / shing 'o ma can gyi myu gu dang / shun pa dang / mar dang de rnams sbyar ro //
translated: In the fifth month, one should use the two types of bhrṅgarāja, cotton, sprouts of milky trees, bark, and ghee.

original: zla ba drug pa la bab pa'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: zla ba drug pa la bab pa'i tshe na ni /
translated: In the sixth month,

original: krishna parni dang / pa la dang / na le sham dkar po dang / gze ma dang / sle tres dang de rnams sbyar ro //
analyzed: krishna parni dang / pa la dang / na le sham dkar po dang / gze ma dang / sle tres dang de rnams sbyar ro //
translated: Krishnaparni, pala, white nalika, cumin, and long pepper.

original: zla ba bdun pa la bab pa'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: zla ba bdun pa la bab pa'i tshe na ni /
translated: In the seventh month,

original: sman shing ka tra ka dang / padma'i rtsa ba dang ; rgun 'brum dang / ka she ru dang / shing mngar dang / ka ra dkar po dang de rnams sbyar ro //
analyzed: sman shing ka tra ka dang / padma'i rtsa ba dang ; rgun 'brum dang / ka she ru dang / shing mngar dang / ka ra dkar po dang de rnams sbyar ro //
translated: katraka, lotus root, grapes, kaseru, sweet flag, and white sugar.

original: de ltar zla grangs dang sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bdun po kun la 'o ma dang sbyar la btang ste de ltar zla ba bdun gyi bar du khrag 'dzag pa bsrung ba'i phyir gong ma'i sbyor ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zla grangs dang sbyar ba'i sbyor ba bdun po kun la 'o ma dang sbyar la btang ste de ltar zla ba bdun gyi bar du khrag 'dzag pa bsrung ba'i phyir gong ma'i sbyor ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, all seven preparations are to be taken with milk. This is taught as the previous preparation for protecting bleeding for seven months.🔽In the eighth month,

original: @67b zla ba brgyad pa la bab pa'i tshe na ka pid tha bil ba dang / bri ha ti dang / bu ram shing dang / kanda ka ri dang / 'di rnams kyi rtsa ba 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol la blud do //
analyzed: @67b zla ba brgyad pa la bab pa'i tshe na ka pid tha bil ba dang / bri ha ti dang / bu ram shing dang / kanda ka ri dang / 'di rnams kyi rtsa ba 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol la blud do //
translated: kapitha, bilva, sugarcane, and kandali roots, boiled with milk, are to be given.

original: zla ba dgu ba la bab pa'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: zla ba dgu ba la bab pa'i tshe na ni /
translated: In the ninth month,

original: thal tres dang / aa nan ta dang / pa yas sya dang / shing mngar rnams 'o ma dang sbyar la gtang ngo //
analyzed: thal tres dang / aa nan ta dang / pa yas sya dang / shing mngar rnams 'o ma dang sbyar la gtang ngo //
translated: One should give it mixed with milk.

original: zla ba bcu pa la bab pa'i tshe na pa yas sya dang sbyar ba'i 'o ma blud do //
analyzed: zla ba bcu pa la bab pa'i tshe na pa yas sya dang sbyar ba'i 'o ma blud do //
translated: In the tenth month, one should give milk mixed with payasyā.

original: yang na shing mngar dang bca' sga dang thang shing rnams 'o ma dang sbyar la sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na shing mngar dang bca' sga dang thang shing rnams 'o ma dang sbyar la sbyin no //
translated: Or one should give it mixed with milk and madhuka, vacā, and devadāru.

original: yang na bud med kyi zla mtshan zla ba re re 'byung ba las gal te ma byung na de ni rlung gis khrag bsgongs pa yin pa las /
analyzed: yang na bud med kyi zla mtshan zla ba re re 'byung ba las gal te ma byung na de ni rlung gis khrag bsgongs pa yin pa las /
translated: If a woman's menstrual period occurs every month and does not occur, that is blood stasis caused by wind.

original: 'dir mngal chags pa'i mtshan nyid la mngon par mi mkhas pa dag ni bu 'chags pa yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'dir mngal chags pa'i mtshan nyid la mngon par mi mkhas pa dag ni bu 'chags pa yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: Here, those who are not skilled in the characteristics of conception say, A child is conceived.

original: de yang sman tsha ba dang dro ba dang / rno ba zos pa las khrag bsgongs pa nyi tshe phyir byung ba na /
analyzed: de yang sman tsha ba dang dro ba dang / rno ba zos pa las khrag bsgongs pa nyi tshe phyir byung ba na /
translated: Moreover, when a little blood is expelled from eating hot, warm, and sharp medicines,

original: mi blun po la la dag byis pa 'byung pos zos pa yin no zhes smra mod kyi /
analyzed: mi blun po la la dag byis pa 'byung pos zos pa yin no zhes smra mod kyi /
translated: some fools say, A child is eaten by a ghost.

original: lus can mngon sum du ma gyur te med do //
analyzed: lus can mngon sum du ma gyur te med do //
translated: But it is not the case that the body is not present.

original: ci ste 'byung po za ba yod na yang gzi brjid dam mdangs tsam 'phrog gi lus mngon sum du chud gson par snang ba ni mi srid do //
analyzed: ci ste 'byung po za ba yod na yang gzi brjid dam mdangs tsam 'phrog gi lus mngon sum du chud gson par snang ba ni mi srid do //
translated: Even if there is a demon that eats people, it can only steal their luster or vitality. It is impossible for it to be seen devouring the body.

original: de bas na khrag ma byung ba la bu chags par 'dzin pa ni 'byung pos ma zos bzhin du zos pa'i rtogs pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na khrag ma byung ba la bu chags par 'dzin pa ni 'byung pos ma zos bzhin du zos pa'i rtogs pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when blood does not appear, one should avoid the idea that one is pregnant, as if one were being devoured by a demon even though one is not.

original: lus kyi gnas las le'u gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas las le'u gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the second chapter on the body.

original: // / byis pa rum du chags pa'i rkang lag gi bye brag bstan pa'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / byis pa rum du chags pa'i rkang lag gi bye brag bstan pa'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the chapter on the teaching of the specific limbs of the fetus in the womb will be explained.

original: de la lus zhes bya ba 'di ni mdor bsdu na yan lag drug tu 'dus te de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lus zhes bya ba 'di ni mdor bsdu na yan lag drug tu 'dus te de yang gang zhe na /
translated: In brief, this so-called body is included in six limbs. What are they?

original: mgo bo dang dpung pa gnyis dang / brla gnyis dang / khong pa dang drug go //
analyzed: mgo bo dang dpung pa gnyis dang / brla gnyis dang / khong pa dang drug go //
translated: The head, the two shoulders, the two thighs, and the torso - these are the six.

original: drug po de dag gi nying lag tu gtogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug po de dag gi nying lag tu gtogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the secondary limbs included in those six?

original: mgo bo'i nying lag ni mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mgo bo'i nying lag ni mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The secondary limbs of the head are the eyes, ears, and so forth.

original: khong pa'i nying lag ni snying dang lte ba la sogs pa'o ;🔽/ dpung pa gnyis kyi nying lag ni gru mo dang lag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khong pa'i nying lag ni snying dang lte ba la sogs pa'o ; / dpung pa gnyis kyi nying lag ni gru mo dang lag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The secondary members of the trunk are the heart, navel, and so on.🔽The secondary members of the two shoulders are the elbows, hands, and so on.

original: brla gnyis kyi nying lag ni rkang pa gnyis dang pus mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brla gnyis kyi nying lag ni rkang pa gnyis dang pus mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The secondary members of the two thighs are the two legs, knees, and so on.

original: yang sems can gyi lus la 'byung ba chen po lnga tshang bar yod de /
analyzed: yang sems can gyi lus la 'byung ba chen po lnga tshang bar yod de /
translated: Moreover, the bodies of sentient beings are complete with five great elements.

original: de gang zhe na nam mkha' dang / rlung dang / me @68a * //
analyzed: de gang zhe na nam mkha' dang / rlung dang / me @68a * //
translated: What are they? They are space, wind, fire,

original: dang ; chu dang / sa dang lnga'o //
analyzed: dang ; chu dang / sa dang lnga'o //
translated: water, and earth, the five.

original: lnga po de dag gi yon tan dang / sgra dang / reg pa dang / gzugs dang / ro dang dri 'di dag go rims bzhin du yon tan du bltas te /
analyzed: lnga po de dag gi yon tan dang / sgra dang / reg pa dang / gzugs dang / ro dang dri 'di dag go rims bzhin du yon tan du bltas te /
translated: The qualities of those five are sound, touch, form, taste, and smell, which are to be regarded as the qualities in order.

original: de yang ji lta zhe na rim pa bzhin du yon tan 'og ma re re che ste /
analyzed: de yang ji lta zhe na rim pa bzhin du yon tan 'og ma re re che ste /
translated: How is that? The qualities of each lower one are greater.

original: de la nam mkha'i yon tan ni sgra'o //🔽rlung gi yon tan ni sgra dang reg bya'o //
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i yon tan ni sgra'o // rlung gi yon tan ni sgra dang reg bya'o //
translated: The quality of space is sound.🔽The quality of wind is sound and touch.

original: me'i yon tan ni sgra dang reg bya dang gzugs so //
analyzed: me'i yon tan ni sgra dang reg bya dang gzugs so //
translated: The quality of fire is sound, touch, and form.

original: chu'i yon tan ni sgra dang / reg bya dang / gzugs dang ro 'o //
analyzed: chu'i yon tan ni sgra dang / reg bya dang / gzugs dang ro 'o //
translated: The qualities of water are sound, touch, form, and taste.

original: sa'i yon tan ni sgra dang / reg bya dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / dri ste lnga char dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sa'i yon tan ni sgra dang / reg bya dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / dri ste lnga char dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The qualities of earth are sound, touch, form, taste, and smell.

original: de yang lus can rnams kyi rna ba'i dbang po gang yin pa de las 'byung ba chen po nam mkha' gnas pa'i yon tan gyi sgra thos pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang lus can rnams kyi rna ba'i dbang po gang yin pa de las 'byung ba chen po nam mkha' gnas pa'i yon tan gyi sgra thos pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the sound that arises from the ear faculty of embodied beings is the quality of space that abides in the great elements.

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of sound is emptiness.

original: lus la rlung gnas pas ni lus kyi dbang pos reg pa tshor bar byed pa'i yon tan dang dbugs gyen du 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus la rlung gnas pas ni lus kyi dbang pos reg pa tshor bar byed pa'i yon tan dang dbugs gyen du 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: Since wind abides in the body, the quality of touch is felt by the body faculty and the breath moves upward.

original: me'i khams lus la gnas pas ni mig gi dbang pos mthong ba dang gzugs kyi yon tan dang smin pa'o //
analyzed: me'i khams lus la gnas pas ni mig gi dbang pos mthong ba dang gzugs kyi yon tan dang smin pa'o //
translated: Since the fire element abides in the body, the eye faculty sees and the quality of form ripens.

original: chu'i khams lus la gnas pas ni lce'i dbang po dang / ro'i yon tan dang gsher ba'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams lus la gnas pas ni lce'i dbang po dang / ro'i yon tan dang gsher ba'o //
translated: Since the water element abides in the body, the tongue faculty tastes and the quality of taste is moist.

original: sa'i khams lus la yod pas ni sna'i dbang po dang / dri'i yon tan dang / rus pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams lus la yod pas ni sna'i dbang po dang / dri'i yon tan dang / rus pa'o //
translated: The earth element in the body is the nose faculty, the quality of smell, and the bones.

original: gzhan yang lus la 'jam pa thams cad ni ma las skyes pa yin te de yang khrag dang / sha dang / rkang dang / gzhang dang / snying dang / pho ba dang / mngal gyi gnas dang / mcher pa dang / mchin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang lus la 'jam pa thams cad ni ma las skyes pa yin te de yang khrag dang / sha dang / rkang dang / gzhang dang / snying dang / pho ba dang / mngal gyi gnas dang / mcher pa dang / mchin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, all that is soft in the body is born from the mother, and that is blood, flesh, sinews, intestines, heart, stomach, womb, spleen, liver, and so on.

original: gang lus kyi sra ba thams cad ni pha las skyes te /
analyzed: gang lus kyi sra ba thams cad ni pha las skyes te /
translated: Whatever is hard in the body is born from the father.

original: khu chu dang / chu ba dang / rus pa dang / skran dang / sen mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khu chu dang / chu ba dang / rus pa dang / skran dang / sen mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is semen, the spinal cord, bones, teeth, nails, and so on.

original: de la yid gang la mos pa bzhin du mi dang / rta dang / glang po che la sogs pa 'gro ba drug tu skye ba sna tshogs len par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yid gang la mos pa bzhin du mi dang / rta dang / glang po che la sogs pa 'gro ba drug tu skye ba sna tshogs len par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, the mind takes up various rebirths in the six realms, such as human, horse, elephant, and so on, according to its inclination.

original: zas gang la dga' ba ma bkag cing zos pa las ni tshe ring ba dang / nad med pa dang / snying stobs dang / gzi byin dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas gang la dga' ba ma bkag cing zos pa las ni tshe ring ba dang / nad med pa dang / snying stobs dang / gzi byin dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By eating whatever food one likes without restriction, one will have a long life, good health, courage, and splendor.

original: de la kha zas kyi dangs ma las lus skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de la kha zas kyi dangs ma las lus skyes pa yin te /
translated: The body is produced from the best part of food.

original: 'phel zhing rgyas pa yang bcud las @68b gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phel zhing rgyas pa yang bcud las @68b gyur pa yin no //
translated: It grows and develops from the best part of food.

original: bcud kyis bskyed pa'i mi ni lo bdun yang chung bar lta'o //
analyzed: bcud kyis bskyed pa'i mi ni lo bdun yang chung bar lta'o //
translated: A person who is produced from the best part of food is considered young at 700 years.

original: snying stobs can gyi rang bzhin gyi mi ni lus ngag yid gsum dag pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod par lta ba dang / dkar po'i chos sbyin pa la sogs pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: snying stobs can gyi rang bzhin gyi mi ni lus ngag yid gsum dag pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod par lta ba dang / dkar po'i chos sbyin pa la sogs pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: A person who is of the nature of sattva has a pure body, speech, and mind, believes in a life after death, and delights in virtuous practices such as generosity.

original: rdul gyi rang bzhin gyi mi ni mang du smra ba dang / nga rgyal che ba dang / khro bag can dang / tshul 'chos byed pa dang / phrag dog can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdul gyi rang bzhin gyi mi ni mang du smra ba dang / nga rgyal che ba dang / khro bag can dang / tshul 'chos byed pa dang / phrag dog can la sogs pa'o //
translated: A person who is of the nature of rajas speaks much, is very proud, is angry and fickle, is deceitful, is jealous, and so on.

original: mun pa can gyi rang bzhin gyi mi ni gnyid che ba dang / le lo che ba dang / 'jigs skyen pa dang / rmongs pa dang / sems gdung ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: mun pa can gyi rang bzhin gyi mi ni gnyid che ba dang / le lo che ba dang / 'jigs skyen pa dang / rmongs pa dang / sems gdung ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: A person who is of the nature of tamas is very sleepy, very lazy, fearful, confused, and has a troubled mind, and so on.

original: / de yan chad sems can rnams kyi lus kyi rang bzhin bstan zin to //
analyzed: / de yan chad sems can rnams kyi lus kyi rang bzhin bstan zin to //
translated: Up to this point, the nature of the bodies of sentient beings has been explained.

original: da ni lus kyi tshad bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni lus kyi tshad bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the dimensions of the body will be explained.

original: lus la pags pa rim pa bdun yod de /
analyzed: lus la pags pa rim pa bdun yod de /
translated: The body has seven layers of skin.🔽Just as cream forms on the surface of boiled milk, the seven bodily constituents, blood, etc.,🔽are fully ripened by their own heat and each produces a layer of skin.

original: dper na 'o ma bskol ba las spris ma chags pa bzhin du khrag la sogs pa lus kyi khams bdun po yang rang rang gi drod kyis yongs su smin pa las pags pa rim pa re re skye ste de dag kyang bad kan dang rgyus pas g-yogs par
analyzed: dper na 'o ma bskol ba las spris ma chags pa bzhin du khrag la sogs pa lus kyi khams bdun po yang rang rang gi drod kyis yongs su smin pa las pags pa rim pa re re skye ste de dag kyang bad kan dang rgyus pas g-yogs par
translated: These are covered by phlegm and sinew.

original: gnas so // khams bdun po de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas so // khams bdun po de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven constituents?

original: khrag dang / bad kan dang / pho ba dang / mkhris pa dang / long ka dang / rlung dang / gcin dang / bdun po de dag rlung dang bcas par lus kyi snying por blta ste dper na shing gi snying po bzhin no //
analyzed: khrag dang / bad kan dang / pho ba dang / mkhris pa dang / long ka dang / rlung dang / gcin dang / bdun po de dag rlung dang bcas par lus kyi snying por blta ste dper na shing gi snying po bzhin no //
translated: Blood, phlegm, stomach, bile, intestines, wind, and urine. These seven, together with the winds, are considered the core of the body, like the core of a tree.🔽Between the intestines and bile of a woman is the womb.

original: bud med kyi long ka dang mkhris pa'i bar na mngal gyi gnas yod de brgyad du bshad de /
analyzed: bud med kyi long ka dang mkhris pa'i bar na mngal gyi gnas yod de brgyad du bshad de /
translated: Thus, the body is explained to have eight parts.

original: khong pa'i nang gi yan lag gzhan yang snying dang / glo ba dang / mcher pa dang / mchin pa dang / aan da ka dang / mkhal ma dang / lte ba dang / dran pa dang / lgang pa'o //
analyzed: khong pa'i nang gi yan lag gzhan yang snying dang / glo ba dang / mcher pa dang / mchin pa dang / aan da ka dang / mkhal ma dang / lte ba dang / dran pa dang / lgang pa'o //
translated: The other internal organs are the heart, lungs, spleen, liver, kidneys, bladder, stomach, intestines, rectum, and anus.

original: srog gi gnas bcu zhes bya ba ni mgo bo dang / lce'i tshor ba'i gnas dang / mkhris pa dang / khrag dang / snying dang / lte ba dang / chu so dang / khu chu dang / mdangs dang / bshang ba'i lam dang bcu po de dag go //
analyzed: srog gi gnas bcu zhes bya ba ni mgo bo dang / lce'i tshor ba'i gnas dang / mkhris pa dang / khrag dang / snying dang / lte ba dang / chu so dang / khu chu dang / mdangs dang / bshang ba'i lam dang bcu po de dag go //
translated: The ten abodes of life are the head, the abode of the tongue faculty, bile, blood, heart, navel, bladder, semen, luster, and the anus.🔽The body is pervaded by a network of sixteen major channels, which are like the spokes of a wheel.

original: lus la chu ba chen po bcu drug gis dra ba ltar khyab pa yod de de yang gang zhe na lgang pa gnyis la chu ba chen po gnyis gnyis /
analyzed: lus la chu ba chen po bcu drug gis dra ba ltar khyab pa yod de de yang gang zhe na lgang pa gnyis la chu ba chen po gnyis gnyis /
translated: There are two major channels in each of the two testicles,

original: lag pa gnyis la chu ba chen po gnyis gnyis /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis la chu ba chen po gnyis gnyis /
translated: two in each of the two arms,

original: mgrin pa'i phyogs nas bzhi bzhi ste bcu drug go //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i phyogs nas bzhi bzhi ste bcu drug go //
translated: and four in the neck, making sixteen.

original: @69a * // lus la chu ba chen po drug yod de /
analyzed: @69a * // lus la chu ba chen po drug yod de /
translated: The body has six major channels.

original: mgrin pa dang / lag pa gnyis dang / rkang pa gnyis dang / pho mtshan gyi chu ba ste drug po des spu gshibs pa ltar byas pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa dang / lag pa gnyis dang / rkang pa gnyis dang / pho mtshan gyi chu ba ste drug po des spu gshibs pa ltar byas pa'o //
translated: The six are the throat, the two arms, the two legs, and the penis.

original: lus la rgyus pa bdun yod de /
analyzed: lus la rgyus pa bdun yod de /
translated: There are seven ligaments in the body.

original: mgo bo la lnga dang / lce dang pho mtshan la re re ste de dag la mtshon gyi las mi bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: mgo bo la lnga dang / lce dang pho mtshan la re re ste de dag la mtshon gyi las mi bya bar bshad do //
translated: There are five on the head, one on the tongue, and one on the penis. It is explained that one should not perform the function of a weapon on these.

original: thag pa lta bu'i sha chen po bzhi yod de /
analyzed: thag pa lta bu'i sha chen po bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four large pieces of flesh like ropes.

original: mdun rgyab nas gnyis gnyis te bzhis 'dzin thag tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: mdun rgyab nas gnyis gnyis te bzhis 'dzin thag tu byas pa'o //
translated: There are two in the front and two in the back, which act as binding ropes.

original: rus pa'i tshogs 'dus pa bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: rus pa'i tshogs 'dus pa bcu bzhi ste /
translated: There are fourteen collections of bones.

original: long mo gnyis dang / pus mo gnyis dang / brla brag gnyis dang / mkhrig ma gnyis dang / mchan khung gnyis dang / gru mo gnyis dang / mgo bo dang / mjug to ste bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: long mo gnyis dang / pus mo gnyis dang / brla brag gnyis dang / mkhrig ma gnyis dang / mchan khung gnyis dang / gru mo gnyis dang / mgo bo dang / mjug to ste bcu bzhi'o //
translated: There are two ankles, two knees, two thighs, two wrists, two armpits, two elbows, the head, and the jaw.

original: lus la gnad kyi tshigs chen po bco brgyad yod de gang zhe na mgo bo la lnga dang / mjug to gcig dang / long mo gnyis dang / pus mo gnyis dang / brla brag gnyis dang / mkhrig ma gnyis dang / mchan khung gnyis dang /
analyzed: lus la gnad kyi tshigs chen po bco brgyad yod de gang zhe na mgo bo la lnga dang / mjug to gcig dang / long mo gnyis dang / pus mo gnyis dang / brla brag gnyis dang / mkhrig ma gnyis dang / mchan khung gnyis dang /
