original: de yang dper na shing rta'i lte ba rtsibs kyis bskor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang dper na shing rta'i lte ba rtsibs kyis bskor ba bzhin no //
translated: They are like the spokes of a chariot wheel.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar mtsho chen po las yur chu kun tu drangs nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar mtsho chen po las yur chu kun tu drangs nas /
translated: Moreover, just as canals are drawn from a great lake,

original: sa bon 'dres pa dang 'dra bar lte ba las gyen du bcu /
analyzed: sa bon 'dres pa dang 'dra bar lte ba las gyen du bcu /
translated: from the navel, ten [channels] extend upward,

original: thur du bcu /
analyzed: thur du bcu /
translated: ten downward,

original: g-yas g-yos su gnyis gnyis su gyes nas de'i rgyun srang phyi rol gyi bu ga dgur 'byung ste /
analyzed: g-yas g-yos su gnyis gnyis su gyes nas de'i rgyun srang phyi rol gyi bu ga dgur 'byung ste /
translated: and two to the right and left, and their current emerges through the nine external orifices.

original: de yang gang zhe na sna'i bu ga gnyis dang / mig gnyis dang / rna ba gnyis dang / kha'i bu ga dang / bshang ba'i sgo dang / gcin gyi sgo dang dgu'o //
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na sna'i bu ga gnyis dang / mig gnyis dang / rna ba gnyis dang / kha'i bu ga dang / bshang ba'i sgo dang / gcin gyi sgo dang dgu'o //
translated: What are they? The two nostrils, the two eyes, the two ears, the mouth orifice, the anus, and the urethra, making nine.

original: bud med la gsum gyis che ste /
analyzed: bud med la gsum gyis che ste /
translated: In women, there are three more:

original: nu ma gnyis dang zla mtshan 'byung ba'i bu ga ste bcu gnyis po de dag tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nu ma gnyis dang zla mtshan 'byung ba'i bu ga ste bcu gnyis po de dag tu 'byung ngo //
translated: the two breasts and the orifice for menstruation. These twelve are the orifices.

original: srog gi rlung la sogs pa rgyu ba'i rtsa'i rgyun bcu gsum khong pa'i nang du rgyu ba yod do //
analyzed: srog gi rlung la sogs pa rgyu ba'i rtsa'i rgyun bcu gsum khong pa'i nang du rgyu ba yod do //
translated: There are thirteen continuous channels through which the life-force wind and so forth flow within the body.

original: de yang srog ces bya ba ni rlung rgyu ba'i rgyun srang dang / de bzhin du dangs ma la sogs pa lus kyi khams bdun rgyu ba'i rgyun srang dang @71a * //
analyzed: de yang srog ces bya ba ni rlung rgyu ba'i rgyun srang dang / de bzhin du dangs ma la sogs pa lus kyi khams bdun rgyu ba'i rgyun srang dang @71a * //
translated: Similarly, there are channels through which the seven bodily constituents such as the pure essence move.🔽There are channels through which the three types of feces, urine, and phlegm move.🔽There are channels through which bile moves.🔽There are channels through which the four types of blood move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of pus move.

original: dri ma rnam gsum gcin dang sla rtsa dang rdul 'byung ba'i rgyun srang dang chu 'byung ba'i rgyun srang dang bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: dri ma rnam gsum gcin dang sla rtsa dang rdul 'byung ba'i rgyun srang dang chu 'byung ba'i rgyun srang dang bcu gsum mo //
translated: There are channels through which the four types of lymph move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of sweat move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of grease move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of oil move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of fluid move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of heat move.

original: kha zas la sogs pa mi mthun pa bsten pa'i rgyus gong ma de dag na'ang 'khrugs par byas pa las ni lus kyi nad skyed par byed la /
analyzed: kha zas la sogs pa mi mthun pa bsten pa'i rgyus gong ma de dag na'ang 'khrugs par byas pa las ni lus kyi nad skyed par byed la /
translated: There are channels through which the four types of solid food move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of drink move.

original: mthun pa bsten pa las ni nad med pa dang bde ba skyed par byed do /
analyzed: mthun pa bsten pa las ni nad med pa dang bde ba skyed par byed do /
translated: There are channels through which the four types of medicine move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of nectar move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of feces move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of urine move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of phlegm move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of bile move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of pus move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of lymph move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of sweat move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of grease move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of oil move.

original: rgyun srang ngam sbubs de dag gi mdog kyang srog zungs la sogs pa rang rang gi mdog ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: rgyun srang ngam sbubs de dag gi mdog kyang srog zungs la sogs pa rang rang gi mdog ltar snang ngo //
translated: There are channels through which the four types of fluid move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of heat move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of solid food move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of drink move.

original: dbyibs kyi bye brag kyang kha cig ni zlum /🔽kha cig ni sbom /🔽kha cig ni phra /
analyzed: dbyibs kyi bye brag kyang kha cig ni zlum / kha cig ni sbom / kha cig ni phra /
translated: There are channels through which the four types of medicine move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of nectar move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of feces move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of urine move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of phlegm move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of bile move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of pus move.

original: kha cig ni ring ngo //
analyzed: kha cig ni ring ngo //
translated: There are channels through which the four types of lymph move.🔽There are channels through which the four types of sweat move.

original: rgyun srang de dag gi rang bzhin yang shing gi lo ma'i rtsa ba bzhin du sna tshogs su 'phro bar blta'o //
analyzed: rgyun srang de dag gi rang bzhin yang shing gi lo ma'i rtsa ba bzhin du sna tshogs su 'phro bar blta'o //
translated: The nature of these channels is to branch out in various ways, like the roots of a tree leaf.

original: gzhan yang kha zas mi mthun pa bsten pa las kyang rgyun srang de dag 'khrugs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang kha zas mi mthun pa bsten pa las kyang rgyun srang de dag 'khrugs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, these channels are disturbed by the consumption of incompatible food.

original: de yang rlung dang rtsub bag lhan cig bsten pa dang / mkhris pa dang tsha ba'i zas lhan cig bsten pa dang / bad kan dang / snum bag lhan cig bsten pas rang rang gi rgyun srang 'khrugs par byed do //
analyzed: de yang rlung dang rtsub bag lhan cig bsten pa dang / mkhris pa dang tsha ba'i zas lhan cig bsten pa dang / bad kan dang / snum bag lhan cig bsten pas rang rang gi rgyun srang 'khrugs par byed do //
translated: This means that the consumption of wind and rough food together, the consumption of bile and hot food together, and the consumption of phlegm and oily food together disturbs their respective channels.

original: yang na lus ngag yid gsum gyi spyod lam nad gzhi dang mi mthun pa lhan cig spyad pa las kyang tshul de ltar blta'o //
analyzed: yang na lus ngag yid gsum gyi spyod lam nad gzhi dang mi mthun pa lhan cig spyad pa las kyang tshul de ltar blta'o //
translated: Or, one should understand that this is also the case when one engages in physical, verbal, and mental conduct that is incompatible with one’s illness.

original: lus kyi khams bdun po rang rang dang mi mthun pa'i kha zas dang spyod lam bsten pa las rang rang gi rgyun srang 'khrugs pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi khams bdun po rang rang dang mi mthun pa'i kha zas dang spyod lam bsten pa las rang rang gi rgyun srang 'khrugs pa yin no //
translated: The seven bodily constituents are disturbed in their respective channels by the consumption of food and the engagement in conduct that is incompatible with them.

original: de ltar kha zas dang spyod lam gyi mthun pa bsten pas so sor rgyun srang 'khrugs pa'i mtshan ma ni gcin sri zhing 'gags pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar kha zas dang spyod lam gyi mthun pa bsten pas so sor rgyun srang 'khrugs pa'i mtshan ma ni gcin sri zhing 'gags pa'am /
translated: Thus, by relying on the harmony of diet and conduct, the signs of the disturbance of the individual channels are:

original: yang na snyi zhing mang du zag pa'am /
analyzed: yang na snyi zhing mang du zag pa'am /
translated: obstructed or blocked urine,🔽or else, thin and frequent urination,🔽or frequent and excessive diarrhea.

original: phyi sa yang dang yang ni 'khru zhing mang du 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang de ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi sa yang dang yang ni 'khru zhing mang du 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang de ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: yang na rtsa mdud 'chas pa dang / rang rang gi lam spangs nas gzhan nas 'byung ba yang 'khrugs pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: yang na rtsa mdud 'chas pa dang / rang rang gi lam spangs nas gzhan nas 'byung ba yang 'khrugs pa'i rtags so //
translated: Or, the formation of knots in the channels and the occurrence of [impurities] from other than the individual paths are also signs of disturbance.🔽Just as many subtle cavities in a lotus root are pervaded by wind, moisture, and so forth, the channels mentioned above pervade the entire body with subtle cavities.

original: ji ltar padma'i rtsa ba'i sbubs phra mo mang po rlung dang rlan la sogs pa 'gro bzhin du gong du smos pa'i rgyun srang ni sbubs phra mo lus thams cad du khyab par 'gro ba la de dag las kyang dangs ma la sogs pa khyab par 'gro ste
analyzed: ji ltar padma'i rtsa ba'i sbubs phra mo mang po rlung dang rlan la sogs pa 'gro bzhin du gong du smos pa'i rgyun srang ni sbubs phra mo lus thams cad du khyab par 'gro ba la de dag las kyang dangs ma la sogs pa khyab par 'gro ste
translated: From them, the refined elements and so forth pervade [the body],

original: / des lus 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / des lus 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and thereby the body grows and expands.

original: gal te rgyun srang de dag zug rngus rdol bar gyur na de'i rtags ni nges par 'chi ba'am /
analyzed: gal te rgyun srang de dag zug rngus rdol bar gyur na de'i rtags ni nges par 'chi ba'am /
translated: If the channels are torn by pain, the signs are certain death or

original: yang na dran pa nyams pa dang / @71b lus 'dar ba dang / lto sbo ba dang / skyug pa dang / lus tsha ba skyes pa dang / glal ba dang / gzer ba dang / bshang gci 'gags pa dang / mtshan ma de dag snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na dran pa nyams pa dang / @71b lus 'dar ba dang / lto sbo ba dang / skyug pa dang / lus tsha ba skyes pa dang / glal ba dang / gzer ba dang / bshang gci 'gags pa dang / mtshan ma de dag snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: loss of memory, trembling of the body, distension of the abdomen, vomiting, fever, yawning, pain, obstruction of feces and urine, and the appearance of those signs.

original: ci ste rtags de dag dang ldan na de'i 'tsho ba ni the tshom dang bcas pa yin pas sman pas gso ba'i las brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste rtags de dag dang ldan na de'i 'tsho ba ni the tshom dang bcas pa yin pas sman pas gso ba'i las brtsam par bya ste /
translated: If one has those signs, then life is doubtful, so the physician should begin treatment.

original: de yang ma byas na ni nges par 'chi ba yin pas de la ni 'bad pa dang bcas par mtshon gyi las bya ste rma gsar pa gso ba'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ma byas na ni nges par 'chi ba yin pas de la ni 'bad pa dang bcas par mtshon gyi las bya ste rma gsar pa gso ba'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o //
translated: If that is not done, then death is certain, so with effort one should perform the operation with a scalpel, as in the procedure for healing a new wound.

original: de la kha zas 'ju bar byed pa ni mkhris pa 'ju bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la kha zas 'ju bar byed pa ni mkhris pa 'ju bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Therein, the digestive agent is the bile, which digests food.

original: des ji ltar 'ju ba ni mdo'i gnas su blta'o //
analyzed: des ji ltar 'ju ba ni mdo'i gnas su blta'o //
translated: How it digests should be understood from the section on sutra.

original: drang srong rgyun shes kyi bu na re nad gzhi gsum dang lus zungs bdun dang dri ma gnyis dang 'di rnams kyi drod kyis kha zas 'ju bar byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: drang srong rgyun shes kyi bu na re nad gzhi gsum dang lus zungs bdun dang dri ma gnyis dang 'di rnams kyi drod kyis kha zas 'ju bar byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Ṛṣi Kapila says: “The three humors, the seven bodily constituents, the two impurities, and the heat of these are what digest food.”

original: kha zas de yang rlung dang mkhris pa gnyis kyis pho ba'i nang du 'ju bar byed do //
analyzed: kha zas de yang rlung dang mkhris pa gnyis kyis pho ba'i nang du 'ju bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, that food is digested in the stomach by the two humors of wind and bile.

original: drang srong thang la 'bar na re pho ba ni mkhris pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de yang de nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: drang srong thang la 'bar na re pho ba ni mkhris pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de yang de nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The Ṛṣi Udbhaṭa says: “The stomach is called the ‘receptacle of bile.’ That is it.”

original: pho ba de ma zhu ba'i gnas la brten te /
analyzed: pho ba de ma zhu ba'i gnas la brten te /
translated: That stomach is the basis of undigested food.

original: de nas tshe dang stobs dang / gzi mdangs dang / 'byung ba chen po lnga'i me dang / khams bdun po 'phel zhing rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang stobs dang / gzi mdangs dang / 'byung ba chen po lnga'i me dang / khams bdun po 'phel zhing rgyas par byed do //
translated: Then it increases and expands life, strength, radiance, the five great elements, and the seven bodily constituents.

original: gal te zas 'ju ba'i lam pho ba'i nang gi me'i stobs chung na ni /
analyzed: gal te zas 'ju ba'i lam pho ba'i nang gi me'i stobs chung na ni /
translated: If the power of the fire in the stomach, the path for digesting food, is weak,

original: dper na sgo gtan bcug na rgyu 'drul byar med pa dang 'dra bar rgyu ba bkag ste mi 'ju ba yin la ci ste mkhris pa'i me'i stobs che na ni ma zhu ba'i zas 'dren cing smin la 'ju bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na sgo gtan bcug na rgyu 'drul byar med pa dang 'dra bar rgyu ba bkag ste mi 'ju ba yin la ci ste mkhris pa'i me'i stobs che na ni ma zhu ba'i zas 'dren cing smin la 'ju bar byed do //
translated: If the power of the bile fire is strong, it draws up undigested food, ripens it, and digests it.

original: yang na zas zos na pho ba'i gnas su 'gro ste /
analyzed: yang na zas zos na pho ba'i gnas su 'gro ste /
translated: Or, if one eats food, it goes to the stomach.

original: de'i me drod kyis 'ju ma nus na 'og tu thal byung du ma zhu bar 'khru ba yang yod do //
analyzed: de'i me drod kyis 'ju ma nus na 'og tu thal byung du ma zhu bar 'khru ba yang yod do //
translated: If the heat of the fire there cannot digest it, it will be drawn down and undigested, causing diarrhea.

original: mkhris pa 'ju byed dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung stobs chung ba la pho ba'i nyam chung zhing na bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhris pa 'ju byed dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung stobs chung ba la pho ba'i nyam chung zhing na bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the wind that abides together with the digestive bile is weak, the stomach will be weak and sick.

original: de dag stobs mnyam pa ni lus 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag stobs mnyam pa ni lus 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are equal in strength, the body will grow and develop.

original: de la gnas skabs dang po kha zas zos pa'i dus su srog ces bya ba'i rlung gis nang du mid cing 'og tu 'phul bar byed do //
analyzed: de la gnas skabs dang po kha zas zos pa'i dus su srog ces bya ba'i rlung gis nang du mid cing 'og tu 'phul bar byed do //
translated: In the first stage, at the time of eating food, the wind called life force swallows it and pushes it down.

original: de nas pho ba'i nang du phyin pa dang / skom dang 'dres pas rkyang rkyang po byas te 'dug pa dang / de'i 'og tu mkhris pa 'ju byed de me dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung gis @72a * //
analyzed: de nas pho ba'i nang du phyin pa dang / skom dang 'dres pas rkyang rkyang po byas te 'dug pa dang / de'i 'og tu mkhris pa 'ju byed de me dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung gis @72a * //
translated: Then, the bile, which is the digestive agent, is activated by the wind that abides together with the fire.

original: stobs can du byas nas 'og tu 'dren te 'ju zhing tshos par bya ba ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi mes snod la 'bras 'tshod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: stobs can du byas nas 'og tu 'dren te 'ju zhing tshos par bya ba ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi mes snod la 'bras 'tshod pa bzhin no //
translated: It draws the food downward and digests and cooks it, just as food is cooked in a pot by an external fire.

original: gnas skabs gnyis pa la ro rnam drug gang zos kyang rung khong pa'i mes 'ju bar byed pa na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gnyis pa la ro rnam drug gang zos kyang rung khong pa'i mes 'ju bar byed pa na /
translated: In the second stage, the fire of the stomach digests whatever food of the six tastes is eaten.

original: ro dang po dbu ba can bad kan du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ro dang po dbu ba can bad kan du 'gyur ro ;
translated: The first taste, which is frothy, becomes phlegm.

original: / de ltar rim gyis 'ju ba na /
analyzed: / de ltar rim gyis 'ju ba na /
translated: In this way, the food is gradually digested.

original: skyur mor 'gyur te mkhris par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyur mor 'gyur te mkhris par 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes sour and becomes bile.

original: de dag kyang gang nas 'byung zhing gang du 'ju zhe na ma zhu ba'i gnas nas byung zhing zhu ba'i gnas su phyin pa na khong pa'i mes smin cing tshos par byed do //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang nas 'byung zhing gang du 'ju zhe na ma zhu ba'i gnas nas byung zhing zhu ba'i gnas su phyin pa na khong pa'i mes smin cing tshos par byed do //
translated: From where do they arise and where are they digested? They arise from the place of undigested food and, having reached the place of digested food, are ripened and cooked by the fire of the stomach.

original: 'ju ba'i gnas skabs na rlung gi bdag nyid du phyin pa na gong bur 'gyur zhing ro tsha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ju ba'i gnas skabs na rlung gi bdag nyid du phyin pa na gong bur 'gyur zhing ro tsha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the food reaches the stage of being digested, it becomes a lump and its taste becomes hot.

original: de nas 'byung ba chen po lnga'i zas kyi dangs ma'i yon tan so so dang mthun pas nam mkha' la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga lus la yod par rang rang gi khams su 'jug cing rgyas la 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas 'byung ba chen po lnga'i zas kyi dangs ma'i yon tan so so dang mthun pas nam mkha' la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga lus la yod par rang rang gi khams su 'jug cing rgyas la 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Then, the five great elements’ pure essence of food, in accordance with its individual qualities, enters the five great elements such as space and so on, and it increases and expands in the body.

original: de ltar kha zas 'ju ba'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de ltar kha zas 'ju ba'i 'og tu /
translated: Thus, after the food is digested,

original: dangs ma dang tshigs ma gnyis su 'gyur te /🔽de yang tshigs ma las gang dang ba dang sla ba ni gcin du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dangs ma dang tshigs ma gnyis su 'gyur te / de yang tshigs ma las gang dang ba dang sla ba ni gcin du 'gyur la /
translated: it becomes both pure essence and waste.🔽Moreover, the pure essence that is clear and light becomes urine,

original: gang ska zhing tshigs ma las phyi sar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang ska zhing tshigs ma las phyi sar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the pure essence that is heavy and solid becomes feces.

original: dangs ma las ni rang gi mes 'ju bar byas nas lus zungs rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dangs ma las ni rang gi mes 'ju bar byas nas lus zungs rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: The pure essence is digested by one’s own fire and becomes the seven bodily constituents.

original: dangs ma rang gi drod kyis smin par byas pa las khrag tu 'gyur ba nas sha dang tshil dang / rus pa dang / rkang dang / khu chu'i bar du rim gyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dangs ma rang gi drod kyis smin par byas pa las khrag tu 'gyur ba nas sha dang tshil dang / rus pa dang / rkang dang / khu chu'i bar du rim gyis 'gyur ro //
translated: The pure essence is ripened by its own heat, and from that blood develops, and from that flesh, fat, bones, marrow, and semen develop in sequence.🔽

original: de la dangs ma la sogs pa lus zungs bdun po re re la yang dangs ma dang snyigs ma gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: de la dangs ma la sogs pa lus zungs bdun po re re la yang dangs ma dang snyigs ma gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The seven constituents of the body, beginning with the nutritive essence, are each divided into pure and impure parts.

original: dangs ma'i dangs ma las ni khrag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dangs ma'i dangs ma las ni khrag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From the pure part of the nutritive essence, blood is formed.

original: dangs ma'i snyigs ma las ni bad kan du 'gyur ro //🔽khrag gi dangs ma las ni shar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dangs ma'i snyigs ma las ni bad kan du 'gyur ro // khrag gi dangs ma las ni shar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the impure part of the nutritive essence, phlegm is formed.🔽From the pure part of the blood, flesh is formed.

original: snyigs ma las ni mkhris par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyigs ma las ni mkhris par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the impure part of the blood, bile is formed.

original: sha'i dangs ma las ni tshil du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha'i dangs ma las ni tshil du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the pure part of the flesh, fat is formed.

original: snyigs ma las ni rngu ma dang / rna spabs dang / ba spu'i dri ma rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyigs ma las ni rngu ma dang / rna spabs dang / ba spu'i dri ma rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: From the impure part of the flesh, the impurities of the intestines, earwax, and body hair are formed.

original: tshil gyi dangs ma las ni rus par 'gyur ro //🔽snyigs ma las ni dbu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshil gyi dangs ma las ni rus par 'gyur ro // snyigs ma las ni dbu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the pure part of the fat, bones are formed.🔽From the impure part of the fat, nasal mucus is formed.

original: rus pa'i dangs ma las ni rkang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rus pa'i dangs ma las ni rkang du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the pure part of the bones, marrow is formed.

original: snyigs ma las ni skra dang sen mor 'gyur ro //🔽rkang gi dangs ma las ni khu chur 'gyur ro //🔽snyigs ma @72b las ni pags pa snum par 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: snyigs ma las ni skra dang sen mor 'gyur ro // rkang gi dangs ma las ni khu chur 'gyur ro // snyigs ma @72b las ni pags pa snum par 'dug pa yin no //
translated: The dregs become hair and nails.🔽The essence of the feet becomes semen.🔽The dregs become the oily skin.

original: khu chu'i dangs ma las ni bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu chu'i dangs ma las ni bur 'gyur ro //
translated: The essence of semen becomes urine.

original: snyigs ma las ni lus kyi gzi mdangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyigs ma las ni lus kyi gzi mdangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The dregs become the body’s luster.

original: de ltar lus zungs bdun yang dangs ma dang snyigs ma gnyis su blta ste /
analyzed: de ltar lus zungs bdun yang dangs ma dang snyigs ma gnyis su blta ste /
translated: Thus, the seven bodily constituents are also seen as two: essence and dregs.

original: de ltar gcig la gcig rgyun mi 'chad par bcud kyis bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gcig la gcig rgyun mi 'chad par bcud kyis bskyed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, they are continuously produced by the nutritive essence.

original: de yang slob dpon kha cig na re nyin zhag gcig gis zas 'ju ba'i rim pa dangs ma nas khu chu'i bar du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yang slob dpon kha cig na re nyin zhag gcig gis zas 'ju ba'i rim pa dangs ma nas khu chu'i bar du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some masters say that the process of digesting food in a single day produces the nutritive essence up to semen.

original: yang kha cig na re nyin zhag drug gis khu chu'i bar du 'gyur ro zhes smra'o //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re nyin zhag drug gis khu chu'i bar du 'gyur ro zhes smra'o //
translated: Others say that it takes six days to produce semen.

original: yang sman pa gzhan dag na re zla ba gcig gis khu chu'i bar du rim pas gzod 'gyur zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang sman pa gzhan dag na re zla ba gcig gis khu chu'i bar du rim pas gzod 'gyur zhes zer ro //
translated: Other physicians say that it takes a month for the process to produce semen.

original: de yang zas zos pas dangs ma bskyed de khams gong ma zas lta bus 'og ma rim pas brtas par byed do //
analyzed: de yang zas zos pas dangs ma bskyed de khams gong ma zas lta bus 'og ma rim pas brtas par byed do //
translated: Moreover, by eating food, the pure essence is generated, and the upper elements are nourished by the food-like lower elements in sequence.

original: 'khor lo bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par zas zos pa'i rgyus 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhin du rgyun mi 'chad par zas zos pa'i rgyus 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is like a wheel, and it occurs continuously by the cause of eating food.

original: de la ro tsa bar byed pa'i zas zho dang 'o ma dang bcud la sogs pas 'phral khu chu 'phel bar snang ste /
analyzed: de la ro tsa bar byed pa'i zas zho dang 'o ma dang bcud la sogs pas 'phral khu chu 'phel bar snang ste /
translated: In this regard, food that acts as an aphrodisiac, such as yogurt, milk, and essence, appears to increase semen immediately.

original: ji ltar dug zos pa las gnyen po'i sman gyis 'phral bzlog par snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dug zos pa las gnyen po'i sman gyis 'phral bzlog par snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the case of eating poison, which is immediately averted by a medicinal antidote.

original: de bas na phal cher ni ro tsa ba'i kha zas dang sman gyis rang gi 'bras bu 'phral ston par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na phal cher ni ro tsa ba'i kha zas dang sman gyis rang gi 'bras bu 'phral ston par mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is seen that for the most part, the food and medicine of an aphrodisiac immediately demonstrate their effect.

original: zas kyi dangs ma'i rgyun yin pa de'i khyab byed ces bya ba'i rlung des lus thams cad du skad cig ma gcig la dus gcig tu khyab cing son par byed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: zas kyi dangs ma'i rgyun yin pa de'i khyab byed ces bya ba'i rlung des lus thams cad du skad cig ma gcig la dus gcig tu khyab cing son par byed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: The function of that wind called the pervader is to pervade and reach the entire body in a single instant and at the same time.

original: gal te dangs ma la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyun ma rungs par gyur pa las bcud dang de 'phul bar byed pa'i rlung dang bcas pa'i las yang gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dangs ma la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyun ma rungs par gyur pa las bcud dang de 'phul bar byed pa'i rlung dang bcas pa'i las yang gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If the flow of the nutritive essence and so forth is disturbed, the function of the wind that expels the nutritive essence and so forth is impaired.

original: dper na nam mkha' la chur bab pa na rlung gis 'bab tu mi ster ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la chur bab pa na rlung gis 'bab tu mi ster ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, when rain falls in the sky, the wind does not allow it to fall.

original: de bas na 'jug pa'i rgyun bcud dang bcas pa 'gag cing ma rungs par gyur pa las nad gzhi gsum yang 'khrugs shing mi bde ba skyed do //
analyzed: de bas na 'jug pa'i rgyun bcud dang bcas pa 'gag cing ma rungs par gyur pa las nad gzhi gsum yang 'khrugs shing mi bde ba skyed do //
translated: Therefore, when the flow of the nutritive essence is blocked and disturbed, the three humors are also disturbed and give rise to discomfort.

original: de las khams bdun gyi me'i drod dang / 'byung ba lnga'i me drod dang / nang grol gyi me drod gsum las kha zas 'ju bar byed pa ni nang grol me drod mchog tu bshad de /
analyzed: de las khams bdun gyi me'i drod dang / 'byung ba lnga'i me drod dang / nang grol gyi me drod gsum las kha zas 'ju bar byed pa ni nang grol me drod mchog tu bshad de /
translated: From that, among the three kinds of heat—the heat of the fire of the seven constituents, the heat of the fire of the five elements, and the heat of the fire of the inner organs—the heat of the fire of the inner organs is explained as supreme for digesting food.

original: de stobs dang ldan na ni 'byung ba dang khams bdun gyi me drod skyed pa yin la de nang grol gyi me drod dmas  na ni 'byung ba @73a * //
analyzed: de stobs dang ldan na ni 'byung ba dang khams bdun gyi me drod skyed pa yin la de nang grol gyi me drod dmas  na ni 'byung ba @73a * //
translated: If that is strong, it generates the heat of the fire of the elements and the seven constituents. If the heat of the fire of the inner organs is weak, the heat of the fire of the elements and the seven constituents is also weak.

original: chen po lnga dang khams bdun gyi me drod kyang 'bri zhing 'phel bar mi nus so //
analyzed: chen po lnga dang khams bdun gyi me drod kyang 'bri zhing 'phel bar mi nus so //
translated: The five great elements and the seven constituents of the body cannot increase or decrease the heat of the fire.

original: de bas na nang grol gyi drod yod na tshe dang stobs la sogs pa yod pas de'i phyir lus kyi me drod smin par byed pa gang yin pa de la legs par sbyar ba'i kha zas kyi bud shing rab tu phan pas bsrung shing bskyang ba la 'bad
analyzed: de bas na nang grol gyi drod yod na tshe dang stobs la sogs pa yod pas de'i phyir lus kyi me drod smin par byed pa gang yin pa de la legs par sbyar ba'i kha zas kyi bud shing rab tu phan pas bsrung shing bskyang ba la 'bad
translated: Therefore, if there is heat in the internal organs, there is life, strength, and so forth. Thus, one should strive to protect and maintain the heat of the body's fire, which is the fuel for properly prepared food.

original: par bya'o // de la me dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung der rang rang gi gnas na 'dug pa ni me'i drod kyang snyoms pa yin no //
analyzed: par bya'o // de la me dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung der rang rang gi gnas na 'dug pa ni me'i drod kyang snyoms pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, the wind that abides with the fire, when located in its own place, balances the heat of the fire.

original: gal te lam gzhan du song na ni me'i drod mi bzad pa yin no //🔽me dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung des mkhris pa cher sbar na ni me'i drod rno ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lam gzhan du song na ni me'i drod mi bzad pa yin no // me dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung des mkhris pa cher sbar na ni me'i drod rno ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it goes to another path, the heat of the fire becomes unbearable.🔽If the wind that abides with the fire greatly increases bile, the heat of the fire becomes too sharp.

original: rlung des bad kan la phog na ni me'i drod nyam chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung des bad kan la phog na ni me'i drod nyam chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that wind strikes phlegm, the heat of the fire becomes weak.

original: de ltar me'i drod mnyam pa dang / mi bzad pa dang / rno ches pa dang / nyam chung ba rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar me'i drod mnyam pa dang / mi bzad pa dang / rno ches pa dang / nyam chung ba rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the heat of the fire becomes of four types: equal, unbearable, very sharp, and weak.

original: de yang zan ran par zos pa legs par 'ju ba ni me'i drod mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang zan ran par zos pa legs par 'ju ba ni me'i drod mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one eats the right amount of food and it digests well, this is called “equal heat of the fire.”

original: me'i drod mi bzad pa zhes bya ba ni mang du zos kyang myur du 'ju pa dang / nyung du zos kyang yun ring po nas gzod 'ju'o //
analyzed: me'i drod mi bzad pa zhes bya ba ni mang du zos kyang myur du 'ju pa dang / nyung du zos kyang yun ring po nas gzod 'ju'o //
translated: “Unbearable heat of the fire” means that when one eats a lot, it digests quickly, and when one eats little, it digests after a long time.

original: zas lci ba la sogs pa zos kyang myur du 'ju ba ni rno ches pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zas lci ba la sogs pa zos kyang myur du 'ju ba ni rno ches pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one eats heavy food and so on, and it digests quickly, this is called “very sharp heat of the fire.”

original: me'i drod nyam chung ba zhes bya ba ni zas yang ba zos na yang yun ring po nas 'ju la khyad par du kha skam pa dang / nang du krug zer ba dang / rgyu ma 'khrugs pa dang / lto sbo ba dang / lus lci ba'o //
analyzed: me'i drod nyam chung ba zhes bya ba ni zas yang ba zos na yang yun ring po nas 'ju la khyad par du kha skam pa dang / nang du krug zer ba dang / rgyu ma 'khrugs pa dang / lto sbo ba dang / lus lci ba'o //
translated: “Weak heat of the fire” means that when one eats light food, it digests after a long time, and in particular, one’s mouth becomes dry, one’s stomach rumbles, one’s intestines are disturbed, one’s stomach swells, and one’s body feels heavy.

original: lus kyi me drod tshabs cher nyams na ni sman dpyad byas kyang mi 'tsho'o //
analyzed: lus kyi me drod tshabs cher nyams na ni sman dpyad byas kyang mi 'tsho'o //
translated: If the heat of the fire in the body is greatly diminished, one will not live even if one undergoes medical treatment.

original: gal te me'i drod la skyon med na ni yun ring du 'tsho ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te me'i drod la skyon med na ni yun ring du 'tsho ba yin no //
translated: If the heat of the fire is not impaired, life is prolonged.

original: nad kyi rtsa ba ni me'i drod nyams pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: nad kyi rtsa ba ni me'i drod nyams pa las 'byung ste /
translated: The root of sickness comes from the impairment of the heat of the fire.

original: me'i drod nyams na lus kyi rgyun thams cad 'gags bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me'i drod nyams na lus kyi rgyun thams cad 'gags bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the heat of the fire is impaired, the continuity of the body is interrupted.

original: skyes bu'i lus kyi stobs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i lus kyi stobs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The strength of the human body is of three kinds:

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang / dus kyis skyes pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang / dus kyis skyes pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
translated: innate, acquired through time, and acquired through practice.

original: de la snying stobs kyi rang bzhin lus las byung ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la snying stobs kyi rang bzhin lus las byung ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The strength that arises from the nature of sattva in the body is called the innate strength.

original: na tshod kyi bye brag byis pa dang / lang tsho la sogs pa'i stobs dang dus kyi bre brag dgun la sogs pa las byung ba'i stobs gnyis ka la dus kyi stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: na tshod kyi bye brag byis pa dang / lang tsho la sogs pa'i stobs dang dus kyi bre brag dgun la sogs pa las byung ba'i stobs gnyis ka la dus kyi stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The strength that arises from the differences in age, such as childhood and youth, and the strength that arises from the differences in time, such as winter, are both called the strength of time.

original: sbo gsum gyi spyod pa dang / zas sna tshogs dang / bcud kyis len pa dang / ro tsa ba'i cho ga bstan pa las byung ba ni sbyor ba'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbo gsum gyi spyod pa dang / zas sna tshogs dang / bcud kyis len pa dang / ro tsa ba'i cho ga bstan pa las byung ba ni sbyor ba'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of application is the practice of the three evacuations, eating various foods, taking elixirs, and the ritual of anointing.

original: yul @73b gang dgon dung chu nyung shing chung ba'i yul ni nad nyung ba yin no //
analyzed: yul @73b gang dgon dung chu nyung shing chung ba'i yul ni nad nyung ba yin no //
translated: The place where there is little water and little wood has little disease.

original: yul gang shing dang chu mang ba'i gnas de ni nad mang du skyed do //
analyzed: yul gang shing dang chu mang ba'i gnas de ni nad mang du skyed do //
translated: The place where there is much wood and much water produces much disease.

original: de gnyis mnyam pa ni ran pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis mnyam pa ni ran pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the two in balance are moderate.

original: de la sems can gyi lus la rkang snyim pa gang dang / tshil snyim pa do dang / zhag snyim pa gsum dang / gcin snyim pa bzhi dang / mkhris pa snyim pa lnga dang / bad kan snyim pa drug dang / phyi sa snyim pa bdun dang /
analyzed: de la sems can gyi lus la rkang snyim pa gang dang / tshil snyim pa do dang / zhag snyim pa gsum dang / gcin snyim pa bzhi dang / mkhris pa snyim pa lnga dang / bad kan snyim pa drug dang / phyi sa snyim pa bdun dang /
translated: In that regard, in the body of sentient beings, there is one se of urine, two se of bile, three se of fat, four se of feces, five se of phlegm, six se of lymph, seven se of marrow, and eight se of blood.

original: khrag snyim pa brgyad dang / dangs ma snyim pa dgu dang / chu ser snyim pa bcu dang / dangs ma khyor ba gang dang / lha ba khyor ba gang dang / khu chu khyor ba gang yod do zhes slob dpon dag 'chad do //
analyzed: khrag snyim pa brgyad dang / dangs ma snyim pa dgu dang / chu ser snyim pa bcu dang / dangs ma khyor ba gang dang / lha ba khyor ba gang dang / khu chu khyor ba gang yod do zhes slob dpon dag 'chad do //
translated: The teachers explain that a human embryo has eight full measures of blood, nine full measures of nutritive essence, ten full measures of lymph, one full ladle of nutritive essence, one full ladle of semen, and one full ladle of ovum.

original: bud med la ni khyad par du 'o ma snyim pa do dang khrag snyim pa bzhis mang ba yod do //
analyzed: bud med la ni khyad par du 'o ma snyim pa do dang khrag snyim pa bzhis mang ba yod do //
translated: Women have two additional full measures of milk and four additional full measures of blood.

original: snyim pa'i tshad ni srang gnyis la khyor gang /
analyzed: snyim pa'i tshad ni srang gnyis la khyor gang /
translated: A ladle is two ounces.

original: srang bzhi la snyim pa gang ngo //
analyzed: srang bzhi la snyim pa gang ngo //
translated: A full measure is four ounces.

original: gong du smos pa'i tshad bstan pa de dag gis nad med pa tha mal par 'dug pa la bshad kyis khams ma snyoms pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i tshad bstan pa de dag gis nad med pa tha mal par 'dug pa la bshad kyis khams ma snyoms pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The above measurements are explained for a healthy, ordinary person, not for someone with an imbalance of elements.

original: de la pha ma gnyis kyi khu ba dang / khrag dang / bud med sbrum pa'i gnas skabs dang / bza' ba dang / spyod lam dang / mngal gyi gnas de dag skyon dang bcas pas bu'i lus la nad kyi rang bzhin bdun du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la pha ma gnyis kyi khu ba dang / khrag dang / bud med sbrum pa'i gnas skabs dang / bza' ba dang / spyod lam dang / mngal gyi gnas de dag skyon dang bcas pas bu'i lus la nad kyi rang bzhin bdun du 'gyur te /
translated: The seven types of illness in the body of the child are due to the semen and blood of the two parents, the condition of the woman’s womb, diet, behavior, and the condition of the womb itself being defective.

original: rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang ldan pa dang / rlung dang bad kan dang ldan pa dang / mkhris pa dang bad kan dang ldan pa dang / de gsum 'dus pa dang bdun no //
analyzed: rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang ldan pa dang / rlung dang bad kan dang ldan pa dang / mkhris pa dang bad kan dang ldan pa dang / de gsum 'dus pa dang bdun no //
translated: The seven are wind, bile, phlegm, wind and bile together, wind and phlegm together, bile and phlegm together, and all three together.

original: gong ma'i khu ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su cung zhig che chung du gyur zhing mi mthun pa bsten pas rang bzhin bdun po de yang shas che chung du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gong ma'i khu ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su cung zhig che chung du gyur zhing mi mthun pa bsten pas rang bzhin bdun po de yang shas che chung du gyur pa yin no //
translated: In the above conditions of semen and so forth, the seven natures become slightly larger or smaller, and by relying on what is incompatible, those seven natures become greater or smaller.

original: de la thog mar rlung gi mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: de la thog mar rlung gi mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: Among those, first the characteristics of wind will be explained.

original: rlung zhes bya ba 'di ni nad kyi gzhi kun gyi nang na mthu che ba yin te /
analyzed: rlung zhes bya ba 'di ni nad kyi gzhi kun gyi nang na mthu che ba yin te /
translated: This so-called wind is the most powerful of all the bases of illness.

original: lus thams cad du khyab pa dang / myur du byed pa dang / stobs che ba dang / nad gzhi gzhan rnams 'khrug par byed pa dang / sla rtsal sogs pa 'byin par byed pa dang / rang dbang du gyur ba dang / nad mang po'i gzhi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: lus thams cad du khyab pa dang / myur du byed pa dang / stobs che ba dang / nad gzhi gzhan rnams 'khrug par byed pa dang / sla rtsal sogs pa 'byin par byed pa dang / rang dbang du gyur ba dang / nad mang po'i gzhi byed pa yin te /
translated: It pervades the entire body, it acts quickly, it is powerful, it disturbs other diseases, it produces strength, it is independent, and it is the basis of many diseases.

original: nad thams cad kyi nang na rlung 'di stobs che zhing khyad par du gyur pa yin no //🔽des na pha ma'i khu khrag rlung shas che ba las bu yang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rlung gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: nad thams cad kyi nang na rlung 'di stobs che zhing khyad par du gyur pa yin no // des na pha ma'i khu khrag rlung shas che ba las bu yang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rlung gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Among all diseases, this wind is powerful and special.
Therefore, a child whose parents’ semen and blood are dominated by wind will have the characteristics of wind for as long as he lives.

original: lus skra rdul gyis g-yogs pa ltar snang ba dang / lus ser ga bye ba dang / dro ba 'dod cing grang ba la zhe sdang ba dang / gzhan yang mos pa mi brtan pa dang / dran pa mi brtan pa dang / blo mi brtan pa dang /
analyzed: lus skra rdul gyis g-yogs pa ltar snang ba dang / lus ser ga bye ba dang / dro ba 'dod cing grang ba la zhe sdang ba dang / gzhan yang mos pa mi brtan pa dang / dran pa mi brtan pa dang / blo mi brtan pa dang /
translated: His body appears as if covered with dust, his body itches, he desires warmth and hates cold, and he also has unstable interest, unstable memory, and unstable understanding.

original: spyod pa mi brtan pa dang / mdza' ba mi brtan pa dang / lta ba mi brtan pa dang / 'gro ba mi brtan pa dang / smra ba mang ba dang / bad kan chung ba dang / nor nyung ba dang / tshe thung ba dang /
analyzed: spyod pa mi brtan pa dang / mdza' ba mi brtan pa dang / lta ba mi brtan pa dang / 'gro ba mi brtan pa dang / smra ba mang ba dang / bad kan chung ba dang / nor nyung ba dang / tshe thung ba dang /
translated: unstable behavior, unstable friends, unstable views, unstable movements, much talking, little phlegm, little wealth, short life,

original: gnyid chung ba dang / smra ba'i dus su brjed ngas pa dang / tshig lkugs pa dang / chad par lta ba 'am /
analyzed: gnyid chung ba dang / smra ba'i dus su brjed ngas pa dang / tshig lkugs pa dang / chad par lta ba 'am /
translated: little sleep, forgetfulness when speaking, stammering, nihilistic views,

original: mang du za ba dang / 'gying zhing 'gro ba dang / glu la dga' ba dang / bzhad gad la dga' ba dang / ri dgas gsod pa la dga' ba dang / 'thab mo la dga' ba dang / de bzhin du mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang /
analyzed: mang du za ba dang / 'gying zhing 'gro ba dang / glu la dga' ba dang / bzhad gad la dga' ba dang / ri dgas gsod pa la dga' ba dang / 'thab mo la dga' ba dang / de bzhin du mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang /
translated: eating much, walking with a swagger, liking songs, liking jokes, liking to kill deer, liking to fight, and likewise liking sweet, sour,

original: lan tshva dang / dro ba 'dod pa dang / lus skem shing rid pa dang / 'gro ba'i tshe tshigs las sgra 'byung ba dang / mi brtan pa dang / dbang po yul las rgyal mi nus pa dang / dam pa'i spyod pa dang mi ldan pa dang /
analyzed: lan tshva dang / dro ba 'dod pa dang / lus skem shing rid pa dang / 'gro ba'i tshe tshigs las sgra 'byung ba dang / mi brtan pa dang / dbang po yul las rgyal mi nus pa dang / dam pa'i spyod pa dang mi ldan pa dang /
translated: “The signs of a person of the wind constituent are that they are thin and emaciated, that they make a cracking sound when they move, that they are unstable, that they are unable to control their senses, that they are not endowed with the conduct of the holy,

original: skyes bu de la bud med mi 'chags pa dang / bu mang po mi skye ba dang / rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi mi'i mig rtsub pa dang / rdul gyis gang ba ltar snang ba dang / zum pa dang / mi mdzes pa dang /
analyzed: skyes bu de la bud med mi 'chags pa dang / bu mang po mi skye ba dang / rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi mi'i mig rtsub pa dang / rdul gyis gang ba ltar snang ba dang / zum pa dang / mi mdzes pa dang /
translated: that women do not approach them, that they do not have many children, that the eyes of a person of the nature of wind are rough, that they appear to be filled with dust, that they are squinting, and that they are unattractive.

original: mi shi ba'i mig lta bu dang / mig bye bzhin du gnyid log pa dang / shing gi steng dang / ri'i rtse mo la 'dzeg pa dang / nam mkha' la 'phur ba rmi ba dang / longs spyod chung ba dang / ser sna che ba dang /
analyzed: mi shi ba'i mig lta bu dang / mig bye bzhin du gnyid log pa dang / shing gi steng dang / ri'i rtse mo la 'dzeg pa dang / nam mkha' la 'phur ba rmi ba dang / longs spyod chung ba dang / ser sna che ba dang /
translated: “The signs of a person of the fire constituent are that their eyes are like the eyes of a dead person, that they sleep with their eyes closed, that they dream of climbing trees and mountain peaks, of flying in the sky, of having few enjoyments, of being very stingy,🔽and of being very angry.

original: khengs pa dang / rku ba dang / byin snying zlum pa dang / gzhan yang 'di dag gi spyod pa gzugs dang / sgra'i rang bzhin mthun na yang /
analyzed: khengs pa dang / rku ba dang / byin snying zlum pa dang / gzhan yang 'di dag gi spyod pa gzugs dang / sgra'i rang bzhin mthun na yang /
translated: Moreover, if their behavior and their physical appearance and voice are similar to those of these animals,

original: rlung gi bdag nyid can gyi mi yin te /
analyzed: rlung gi bdag nyid can gyi mi yin te /
translated: they are human beings whose nature is wind.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: khyi dang / wa dang / rnga mo dang / bya rgod dang / byi ba dang / khva dang / de rnams dang ldan pa'i mi ni rlung gi rtags su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: khyi dang / wa dang / rnga mo dang / bya rgod dang / byi ba dang / khva dang / de rnams dang ldan pa'i mi ni rlung gi rtags su shes par bya'o //
translated: They are humans who have the characteristics of dogs, foxes, camels, vultures, mice, and crows.🔽The characteristics of humans whose nature is bile were explained by the sage Tāmralomā.

original: de la mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi'i mtshan nyid drang srong thang la 'bar gyis bshad pa mkhris pa nyid me yin pa 'am /
analyzed: de la mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi'i mtshan nyid drang srong thang la 'bar gyis bshad pa mkhris pa nyid me yin pa 'am /
translated: Bile is fire,

original: yang na me las mkhris pa 'byung ba 'am /
analyzed: yang na me las mkhris pa 'byung ba 'am /
translated: or bile arises from fire,

original: yang na khrag gi snyigs ma dag yin pas na mkhris pa'o //
analyzed: yang na khrag gi snyigs ma dag yin pas na mkhris pa'o //
translated: or it is the dregs of blood, so it is bile.

original: de la mkhris pa'i rang bzhin ni shin tu bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / mdog ser skyar 'dug pa dang / drod che ba dang / lag pa dang / @74b rkang pa dang / gdong dmar ba dang / dpa' ba dang / nga rgyal che ba dang /
analyzed: de la mkhris pa'i rang bzhin ni shin tu bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / mdog ser skyar 'dug pa dang / drod che ba dang / lag pa dang / @74b rkang pa dang / gdong dmar ba dang / dpa' ba dang / nga rgyal che ba dang /
translated: The nature of bile is to be very hungry and thirsty, to have a yellowish complexion, to be very hot, to have red hands, feet, and face, to be brave, to have great pride,

original: mig ser ba dang / skra dang ba spu nyung ba dang / skra ser skyar 'dug pa dang / phreng ba la dga' ba dang / byug pa la dga' ba dang / rgyan la dga' ba dang / spyod lam bzang ba dang / gtsang sbra che ba dang /
analyzed: mig ser ba dang / skra dang ba spu nyung ba dang / skra ser skyar 'dug pa dang / phreng ba la dga' ba dang / byug pa la dga' ba dang / rgyan la dga' ba dang / spyod lam bzang ba dang / gtsang sbra che ba dang /
translated: to have yellow eyes, to have little hair and body hair, to have yellowish hair, to like garlands, to like ointments, to like ornaments, to have good conduct, to be very clean,

original: g-yog 'khor la snying brtse ba dang / phyug pa dang / bab chol byed pa dang / blo stobs dang ldan pa dang / skyabs su 'ongs na dgra yang skyob pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / tshigs mtshams kyi sha 'jam pa dang / bud med la mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: g-yog 'khor la snying brtse ba dang / phyug pa dang / bab chol byed pa dang / blo stobs dang ldan pa dang / skyabs su 'ongs na dgra yang skyob pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / tshigs mtshams kyi sha 'jam pa dang / bud med la mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: to have compassion for one's retinue, to be wealthy, to be generous, to be intelligent, to protect even enemies who come for refuge, to be clever, to have smooth joints, and to delight in women.

original: khu chu nyung zhing 'dod pa chung ba dang / gnyer ma myur du skye ba dang / skra dkar myur du skye ba dang / mthong ba nyams mi gsal ba dang / mngar ba dang / bska ba dang / kha ba dang / grang ba'i zas la dga' ba dang /🔽tshad pa la zhe sdang ba dang / rngul che ba dang / dri mnam pa dang / bshang gci mang ba dang / khro ba dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba la phrag dog pa dang / gzhan yang rmi lam gyi nang du dong ka'i me tog dang /
analyzed: khu chu nyung zhing 'dod pa chung ba dang / gnyer ma myur du skye ba dang / skra dkar myur du skye ba dang / mthong ba nyams mi gsal ba dang / mngar ba dang / bska ba dang / kha ba dang / grang ba'i zas la dga' ba dang / tshad pa la zhe sdang ba dang / rngul che ba dang / dri mnam pa dang / bshang gci mang ba dang / khro ba dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba la phrag dog pa dang / gzhan yang rmi lam gyi nang du dong ka'i me tog dang /
translated: They have little semen and little desire, wrinkles appear quickly, their hair turns white quickly, their vision declines and becomes unclear, and they like sweet, astringent, sour, and cold food.🔽They hate heat, sweat a lot, have a bad smell, have a lot of feces and urine, are angry, are jealous of food and drink, and in dreams they see blue lotuses, palasha flowers, and places burned by fire, falling stars, lightning, and the sun and fire.

original: shing pa la sha'i me tog dang / phyogs mes tshig pa mthong ba dang / skar mda' ltung ba dang / glog 'gyu ba dang / nyi ma dang me mthong ba rmi ba dang / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi ni mig phra ba dang /
analyzed: shing pa la sha'i me tog dang / phyogs mes tshig pa mthong ba dang / skar mda' ltung ba dang / glog 'gyu ba dang / nyi ma dang me mthong ba rmi ba dang / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi ni mig phra ba dang /
translated: A person of a bile nature has fine eyes,

original: ser ba dang / g-yo zhing 'gul ba dang / rdzi ma srab cing nyung ba dang / grang ba la dga' ba dang / chang 'thung ba dang / khros pa'i dus su mig dmar por gyur pa dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor sngo ba dang dmar bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: ser ba dang / g-yo zhing 'gul ba dang / rdzi ma srab cing nyung ba dang / grang ba la dga' ba dang / chang 'thung ba dang / khros pa'i dus su mig dmar por gyur pa dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor sngo ba dang dmar bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: and hail, and trembling, and thin and few eyelashes, and delight in cold, and drinking alcohol, and eyes become red when angry, and seeing the sun's orb blue and red.

original: tshe ni ran par 'tsho ba yin la /
analyzed: tshe ni ran par 'tsho ba yin la /
translated: Life is moderate,

original: stobs kyang ran par yod de /
analyzed: stobs kyang ran par yod de /
translated: and strength is moderate.

original: shin tu mkhas pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu mkhas pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa yin no //
translated: One is very wise and fearful of suffering.

original: gzhan yang stag dang / dred dang / spre'u dang / byi la dang / gnod sbyin dang / 'di rnams kyi gzugs dang / skad dang / spyod pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan na mkhris pa can gyi rtags yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang stag dang / dred dang / spre'u dang / byi la dang / gnod sbyin dang / 'di rnams kyi gzugs dang / skad dang / spyod pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan na mkhris pa can gyi rtags yin no //
translated: Moreover, if one has the characteristics of form, voice, and behavior of a tiger, bear, monkey, cat, or yaksha, it is a sign of a person with bile.

original: de la bad kan ni chu'i rang bzhin can gyi rtags yin te /
analyzed: de la bad kan ni chu'i rang bzhin can gyi rtags yin te /
translated: Here, phlegm is a sign of the nature of water.

original: rus pa'i tshigs mi mngon pa dang / snum pa dang / tshigs 'brel ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / @75a * //
analyzed: rus pa'i tshigs mi mngon pa dang / snum pa dang / tshigs 'brel ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / @75a * //
translated: The joints of the bones are not visible, the body is shiny, the joints are connected, there is hunger, thirst, afflictions, suffering,🔽and heat. These are the characteristics of phlegm.

original: tshad pa dang / 'di rnams bzod pa dang / gzhan yang blo dang ldan pa dang / snying stobs che ba dang / dam bcas pa brtan pa dang / gzhan du khre dang / d'ur ba dang / 'dam bu'i myu gu dang / mtshon dang /
analyzed: tshad pa dang / 'di rnams bzod pa dang / gzhan yang blo dang ldan pa dang / snying stobs che ba dang / dam bcas pa brtan pa dang / gzhan du khre dang / d'ur ba dang / 'dam bu'i myu gu dang / mtshon dang /
translated: The intelligent, the courageous, the firm in their promises, the ones who do not change, the ones who are like sugarcane, bamboo, lotus shoots, weapons,

original: gi wang dang / padma dang / gser dang / de dag gi mdog gang yang rung bar snang ba ni bad kan gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gi wang dang / padma dang / gser dang / de dag gi mdog gang yang rung bar snang ba ni bad kan gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: camphor, lotus, and gold, and those who appear any of those colors have a phlegm nature.🔽The arms hang down, the chest is full and expansive, the forehead is broad, the hair is thick and dark, the body is rough, the body is even, all the limbs are well-proportioned,

original: lag ngar gnyis la 'phyang ba dang / brang rgyas shing yangs pa dang / dpral ba'i dbyes che ba dang / skra mthug cing mdog sngo ba dang / lus rtsub pa dang / lus sha snyoms pa dang / yan lag thams cad legs par 'byes pa dang /
analyzed: lag ngar gnyis la 'phyang ba dang / brang rgyas shing yangs pa dang / dpral ba'i dbyes che ba dang / skra mthug cing mdog sngo ba dang / lus rtsub pa dang / lus sha snyoms pa dang / yan lag thams cad legs par 'byes pa dang /
translated: and the body is well-developed.

original: lus mdzes pa dang / mdangs dang ldan pa dang / 'dod chags spyod pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du bcud dang / khu chu dang / bu tsha mang ba dang / g-yog 'khor mang ba dang / chos la dga' ba dang /
analyzed: lus mdzes pa dang / mdangs dang ldan pa dang / 'dod chags spyod pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin du bcud dang / khu chu dang / bu tsha mang ba dang / g-yog 'khor mang ba dang / chos la dga' ba dang /
translated: a beautiful body, a radiant complexion, the ability to enjoy sex, and likewise, to have a lot of vitality, semen, children, and attendants, to delight in the Dharma,

original: tshig 'jam por smra ba dang / dgra lta bu gnod par byed pa la sems la dam du 'dzin cing 'phral mi smra ba dang / glang po che'i mchog ra ro ba lta bu'i 'gros su 'gro ba dang / 'brug gi sgra dang / rgya mtsho chen po dang /
analyzed: tshig 'jam por smra ba dang / dgra lta bu gnod par byed pa la sems la dam du 'dzin cing 'phral mi smra ba dang / glang po che'i mchog ra ro ba lta bu'i 'gros su 'gro ba dang / 'brug gi sgra dang / rgya mtsho chen po dang /
translated: to speak gently, to hold grudges in one’s mind and not speak immediately to those who harm one like enemies, to walk with the gait of an intoxicated supreme elephant, to have the sound of thunder, the great ocean,

original: rdza rda dang / seng ge'i skad lta bu yod pa dang / dran pa dang / bya ba la mngon par brtson pa dang / dul ba dang / byis pa'i gnas su yang shas chung ngu ngu  ba dang / lto 'dun chung ba dang /
analyzed: rdza rda dang / seng ge'i skad lta bu yod pa dang / dran pa dang / bya ba la mngon par brtson pa dang / dul ba dang / byis pa'i gnas su yang shas chung ngu ngu  ba dang / lto 'dun chung ba dang /
translated: a conch, and a lion’s roar, to have mindfulness and to be diligent in one’s actions, to be disciplined, to cry very little even in childhood, to have little desire for food,

original: zas kha ba dang / bska ba dang / tsha ba dang / dro ba dang / rtsub pa dang / nyung du zos kyang stobs dang ldan pa dang / gzhan yang mig yangs shing snum la dkyus ring ba dang / gsal ba dang / shin tu dkar ba dang /
analyzed: zas kha ba dang / bska ba dang / tsha ba dang / dro ba dang / rtsub pa dang / nyung du zos kyang stobs dang ldan pa dang / gzhan yang mig yangs shing snum la dkyus ring ba dang / gsal ba dang / shin tu dkar ba dang /
translated: Their eyes are large, shiny, and long; they are clear, very white,

original: rdzi ma gnag cing mthug pa dang / skad gsang chung ba dang / spro ring ba dang / bza' btung nyung du za zhing 'thung ba dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / tshe ring ba dang / nor mang ba dang / thag ring po la blo 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: rdzi ma gnag cing mthug pa dang / skad gsang chung ba dang / spro ring ba dang / bza' btung nyung du za zhing 'thung ba dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / tshe ring ba dang / nor mang ba dang / thag ring po la blo 'jug pa dang /
translated: and their eyelashes are thick and dark. Their voices are soft, they are patient, they eat and drink little, they have few desires, they live long, they are wealthy, their minds are far-reaching,

original: sbyin gtong che ba dang / dad pa che ba dang / blo zab pa dang / mthong ba che ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / ngang tshul bzang ba dang / gnyid che ba dang / las kyi mtha' ring ba dang / byas pa gzo ba dang /
analyzed: sbyin gtong che ba dang / dad pa che ba dang / blo zab pa dang / mthong ba che ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / ngang tshul bzang ba dang / gnyid che ba dang / las kyi mtha' ring ba dang / byas pa gzo ba dang /
translated: they are generous, they have great faith, they are wise, they have great vision, they are patient, they are well-mannered, they sleep a lot, they work hard, and they are grateful.

original: bsam pa drang ba dang / mkhas pa dang / gzugs bzang ba @75b dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / bla ma la gus pa dang / snying nye ba dang / mdza' ba brtan pa dang / rtag tu glo ba dang / rmi lam gyi nang na me tog padma dang /
analyzed: bsam pa drang ba dang / mkhas pa dang / gzugs bzang ba @75b dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / bla ma la gus pa dang / snying nye ba dang / mdza' ba brtan pa dang / rtag tu glo ba dang / rmi lam gyi nang na me tog padma dang /
translated: They are upright, learned, have a good physique, are conscientious, respect their gurus, are affectionate, have stable love, are always kind, and in their dreams see lotuses,

original: nam mkha' la bya mang po phreng ba ltar brgyus pa 'phur ba dang / mtsho dang sprin mthong ba dang / tshangs pa dang / drag po dang / dbang po dang / chu lha dang / nam mkha' lding dang / ngang pa dang / glang po che'i mchog dang /
analyzed: nam mkha' la bya mang po phreng ba ltar brgyus pa 'phur ba dang / mtsho dang sprin mthong ba dang / tshangs pa dang / drag po dang / dbang po dang / chu lha dang / nam mkha' lding dang / ngang pa dang / glang po che'i mchog dang /
translated: many birds flying in the sky in a line, lakes, and clouds, and they see Brahmā, Rudra, Indra, Varuṇa, Garuḍa, geese, the best of elephants,

original: seng ge dang / rta dang / khyu mchog dang / de rnams dang 'dra bar mthong na bad kan gyi rang bzhin can du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: seng ge dang / rta dang / khyu mchog dang / de rnams dang 'dra bar mthong na bad kan gyi rang bzhin can du shes par bya'o //
translated: lions, horses, and bulls. If they see things like these, they should be known to have a phlegm-dominant nature.

original: rlung dang mkhris par ldan pa dang / rlung dang bad kan du ldan pa dang / mkhris pa dang bad kan du ldan pa dang / 'dus pa dang bzhi po de dag gi rang bzhin yang gong ma so so'i rtags bstan pa las 'dir yang rjes su dpags te shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris par ldan pa dang / rlung dang bad kan du ldan pa dang / mkhris pa dang bad kan du ldan pa dang / 'dus pa dang bzhi po de dag gi rang bzhin yang gong ma so so'i rtags bstan pa las 'dir yang rjes su dpags te shes par bya'o //
translated: The natures of the combinations of wind and bile, wind and phlegm, bile and phlegm, and the combination of all three should be inferred from the signs of each one taught above.

original: de la snying stobs kyi rang bzhin ni bad kan gyi yon tan dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de la snying stobs kyi rang bzhin ni bad kan gyi yon tan dang 'dra ste /
translated: The nature of sattva is similar to the qualities of phlegm:

original: gtsang sbra che ba dang / yod par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtsang sbra che ba dang / yod par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: great purity, the view of existence, and so on.

original: rdul gyi rang bzhin ni mkhris pa'i yon tan dang 'dra ste mang du smra ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdul gyi rang bzhin ni mkhris pa'i yon tan dang 'dra ste mang du smra ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of rajas is similar to the qualities of bile: much speech, and so on.

original: mun pa'i rang bzhin ni rlung gi yon tan dang 'dra ste 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mun pa'i rang bzhin ni rlung gi yon tan dang 'dra ste 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of tamas is similar to the qualities of wind: fear, and so on.

original: ldan pa dang 'dus pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan yang gong ma dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro ;
analyzed: ldan pa dang 'dus pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan yang gong ma dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro ;
translated: The qualities of the natures of the combinations and the combination of all three should be applied in order as above.

original: / de la na tshod kyi bye brag gsum du blta ste /
analyzed: / de la na tshod kyi bye brag gsum du blta ste /
translated: There are three types of age to be seen:

original: byis pa dang / bar ma dang / rgan pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa dang / bar ma dang / rgan pa'o //
translated: the child, the adult, the aged.

original: de la lo bcu drug gi bar du ni byis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la lo bcu drug gi bar du ni byis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The child is the one up to sixteen years of age.

original: de las lo bdun cu'i bar du ni bar ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las lo bdun cu'i bar du ni bar ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The adult is the one from sixteen to seventy years of age.

original: lus dang / dbang po dang / gzi brjid la sogs pa 'phel zhing rgyas pa'i dus so //
analyzed: lus dang / dbang po dang / gzi brjid la sogs pa 'phel zhing rgyas pa'i dus so //
translated: This is the period of the development and growth of the body, the faculties, strength, etc.

original: de phan chad ni rgan po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de phan chad ni rgan po zhes bya ste /
translated: The aged is the one beyond that.

original: lus zungs la sogs pa zang zin pa'i dus so //
analyzed: lus zungs la sogs pa zang zin pa'i dus so //
translated: This is the period of the decline of the body, etc.

original: skyes bu gang gi lus khru phyed dang bzhi pa'i tshad du yod pa ni tshe ring ba la sogs pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gi lus khru phyed dang bzhi pa'i tshad du yod pa ni tshe ring ba la sogs pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: The person whose body is four cubits long is the basis for long life, etc.

original: gzhan yang lus la smad par bya ba'i dngos po brgyad yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus la smad par bya ba'i dngos po brgyad yod de /
translated: Moreover, there are eight things that are despised in the body.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: lus la ba spu mang ba dang / yang na med pa dang / ba spu dkar ba dang / yang na gnag pa dang / sbom pa dang / ring ches pa dang / gnas ma yin par spu skyes pa dang / rtsub pa dang / de rnams dang ldan na tshe thung ba dang mi bde ba skyed de /
analyzed: lus la ba spu mang ba dang / yang na med pa dang / ba spu dkar ba dang / yang na gnag pa dang / sbom pa dang / ring ches pa dang / gnas ma yin par spu skyes pa dang / rtsub pa dang / de rnams dang ldan na tshe thung ba dang mi bde ba skyed de /
translated: The body has much hair, or none at all; the hair is white, or black; it is thick, or too long; it grows in inappropriate places, or is rough. If one has these, it produces a short life and unhappiness.

original: skyes bu gang gi skra snum pa dang / 'jam @76a * //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gi skra snum pa dang / 'jam @76a * //
translated: The hair of a person is oily, soft,

original: pa dang / phra zhing re re nas skyes pa dang / brtan pa dang / de dag ni skra'i yon tan dam pa yin no //
analyzed: pa dang / phra zhing re re nas skyes pa dang / brtan pa dang / de dag ni skra'i yon tan dam pa yin no //
translated: fine, grows singly, and is firm. These are the excellent qualities of hair.

original: dpral ba'i yon tan ni skra mtshams kyi phyogs mtho zhing mur 'gram gnyis dma' ba dang zla ba phyed pa lta bu ni rab tu bzang ngo //
analyzed: dpral ba'i yon tan ni skra mtshams kyi phyogs mtho zhing mur 'gram gnyis dma' ba dang zla ba phyed pa lta bu ni rab tu bzang ngo //
translated: The excellent qualities of the forehead are that the hairline is high, the temples are low, and it is like a half-moon.

original: skyes bu'i rna ba'i yon tan ni zheng chung la dkyus ring ba dang / mthon dman legs par 'byes shing shas rgyas pa dang / rna ba'i rgyab phyogs mtho ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rna ba'i yon tan ni zheng chung la dkyus ring ba dang / mthon dman legs par 'byes shing shas rgyas pa dang / rna ba'i rgyab phyogs mtho ba'o //
translated: The excellent qualities of a person's ears are that they are narrow and long, well-divided in height and width, and the back of the ears is high.

original: mig gi yon tan ni dkar nag 'byes shing gsal ba dang / rdzi ma bar ma chad cing stug pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi yon tan ni dkar nag 'byes shing gsal ba dang / rdzi ma bar ma chad cing stug pa'o //
translated: The good qualities of the eyes are that they are clear, with the white and black parts distinct, and that the eyelashes are not sparse but thick.

original: sna'i yon tan ni sna gzang mtho ba dang / dbugs cher 'byung ba dang / mtho dman med cing rgyas pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: sna'i yon tan ni sna gzang mtho ba dang / dbugs cher 'byung ba dang / mtho dman med cing rgyas pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The good qualities of the nose are that the nostrils are not prominent, the breath is strong, and the nose is not flat but full.

original: mchu'i yon tan ni mi 'phyang ba dang dmar ba'o //
analyzed: mchu'i yon tan ni mi 'phyang ba dang dmar ba'o //
translated: The good qualities of the lips are that they are not pendulous and are red.

original: 'gram pa'i yon tan ni 'gram pa yangs shing mdzes pa dang / kha yangs pa dang / so thags bzang ba dang / mdog snum la 'tshor ba dang / 'jam pa dang / dkar ba dang mnyam pa'o //

analyzed: khrag legs par gnas shing rgyu na ni srog kyang legs par gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: de lta bas na gnad la ma phog na ni mtshon du mas bsnun kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur zhing /

original: gnad la phog na ni nges par 'chi bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gnad la phog na ni nges par 'chi bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: tshabs chung du bsnun kyang zha ba la sogs par @81a * //

analyzed: gnad du mtshon gyis bsnun par yang ma zad de /

analyzed: lus kyi gnas las gnad kyi bye brag bstan pa'i le'u bzhi pa rdzogs so /

analyzed: // / de nas lus kyis 'gyur ba'i bye brag las 'chi ltas brtag pa'i le'u bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: de la mi'i gnad rnams la nad kyis phog pa las phyi rol du 'chi ba'i mtshan ma snang ba yin te /

analyzed: de bas na 'og tu 'byung ba 'di dag gis rtogs par bya'o //
