translated: The vessel falls and breaks without being thrown from the hand, etc.

original: skyes bu gang gi lus shin tu nyam chung zhing nad kyis gzir ba yin pa las glo bur du sos pa ltar byed pa dang / yang na nad zug gzer dang bcas pas nyam thag na 'chi rtags su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gi lus shin tu nyam chung zhing nad kyis gzir ba yin pa las glo bur du sos pa ltar byed pa dang / yang na nad zug gzer dang bcas pas nyam thag na 'chi rtags su rig par bya'o //
translated: If a person who is very weak and afflicted with disease suddenly acts as if he were well, or if he is tormented by the pain of disease, one should understand that this is a sign of death.

original: nye du rnams kyis nad pa'i sos shi'i bye brag dris kyang sman pas smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: nye du rnams kyis nad pa'i sos shi'i bye brag dris kyang sman pas smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: Even if relatives ask the physician about the specific condition of the patient, he should not speak.

original: 'chi rtags dang ldan bzhin du gso ba'i dpyad kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi rtags dang ldan bzhin du gso ba'i dpyad kyang mi bya'o //
translated: Even if he has the signs of death, he should not perform a treatment.

original: gshin rje'i pho nya dang sha za la sogs pa nad pa'i drung du bsten nas nad pa'i srog 'phrog par bya ba'i phyir sman gyi mthu stobs dang nus pa zad cing chud gson par byed de de bas na de ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i pho nya dang sha za la sogs pa nad pa'i drung du bsten nas nad pa'i srog 'phrog par bya ba'i phyir sman gyi mthu stobs dang nus pa zad cing chud gson par byed de de bas na de ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: The messengers of the Lord of Death, the flesh-eaters, and so forth, will be present near the sick person in order to take away his life. They will exhaust, waste away, and dissipate the power, strength, and efficacy of the medicine. Therefore, it should be abandoned.

original: de la tshe'i rig byed 'di dag thams cad bdag gis rang bzor byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la tshe'i rig byed 'di dag thams cad bdag gis rang bzor byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In this regard, all of these medical treatises were not composed by me.

original: sngon gyi rig byed la mkhas pa'i sman pa rnams kyis gsungs pa'i lung bstan te bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi rig byed la mkhas pa'i sman pa rnams kyis gsungs pa'i lung bstan te bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are the teachings and explanations given by the physicians of the past who were skilled in the treatises.

original: de bas na 'chi rtags kyi mtshan nyid la brtson pa dang bcas pas mkhas par bya ba dang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'chi rtags kyi mtshan nyid la brtson pa dang bcas pas mkhas par bya ba dang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should be diligent and become skilled and knowledgeable in the characteristics of the signs of death.

original: yang na na ba dang mi na ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas shing bye brag phyed na sman pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: yang na na ba dang mi na ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas shing bye brag phyed na sman pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: Or, if one is skilled and discerning in the characteristics of the sick and the healthy, one will be counted among the physicians.

original: de la sman pa zhes bya ba ni nad mi 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / nad gso ba la mkhas pa ni brug rdu 'byin pa zhes bya'o //🔽@89a * // mdor na na ba dang mi na ba'i bye brag la mkhas pa dang / nad pa la 'chi ltas med cing tshe yod par shes la de gso ba 'am /
analyzed: de la sman pa zhes bya ba ni nad mi 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / nad gso ba la mkhas pa ni brug rdu 'byin pa zhes bya'o // @89a * // mdor na na ba dang mi na ba'i bye brag la mkhas pa dang / nad pa la 'chi ltas med cing tshe yod par shes la de gso ba 'am /
translated: The so-called physician is skilled in preventing disease and skilled in curing disease, which is called “extracting the dart.”

original: srung ba la mkhas pa ni tshe'i rig byed kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: srung ba la mkhas pa ni tshe'i rig byed kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: In brief, the result of the science of life is the skill in distinguishing the sick from the healthy, knowing that the sick have signs of death and have a life span, and curing them or protecting them.

original: de la 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni srog dang bral ba yin la 'chi ba de ni sngon gyi drang srong mkhas pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rnam pa bzhir shes te /
analyzed: de la 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni srog dang bral ba yin la 'chi ba de ni sngon gyi drang srong mkhas pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis rnam pa bzhir shes te /
translated: Death is the loss of life, and that death is known by the wise sages of the past to be of four types.

original: de yang tshe zad nas shi ba dang / bsod nams zad nas shi ba dang / de gnyis ka zad nas shi ba dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba dang bzhi'i tshul du shes nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang tshe zad nas shi ba dang / bsod nams zad nas shi ba dang / de gnyis ka zad nas shi ba dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba dang bzhi'i tshul du shes nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is taught by knowing it as four modes: death from the exhaustion of life, death from the exhaustion of merit, death from the exhaustion of both, and untimely death.

original: lus kyi gnas las lus mdog dang tshul spyod las 'chi ltas 'byung ba'i le'u ste lnga pa'o /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas las lus mdog dang tshul spyod las 'chi ltas 'byung ba'i le'u ste lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifth chapter, the chapter on the signs of death arising from the body's condition, body color, and behavior.

original: // / de nas bang chen la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dge ba las 'chi ltas brtag pa'i le'u drug pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas bang chen la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dge ba las 'chi ltas brtag pa'i le'u drug pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Chapter Six: Examination of the signs of death based on the auspicious signs of messengers and so forth.

original: sman pa'i gan du nad pa'i pho nya sbron du 'ongs pa na ya mtshan can rab tu byung ba dang / bram ze la sogs pa rigs bzhi po nad pa rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i 'phrin pa 'ongs na ni las grub pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: sman pa'i gan du nad pa'i pho nya sbron du 'ongs pa na ya mtshan can rab tu byung ba dang / bram ze la sogs pa rigs bzhi po nad pa rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i 'phrin pa 'ongs na ni las grub pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: When a messenger of a patient comes to the physician, if a messenger of the same caste as the patient, such as an ascetic, a brahmin, or one of the four castes, comes, it is a sign of success in the treatment.

original: gal te ya mtshan can la sogs pa gong ma'i rigs las 'chol ba 'am /
analyzed: gal te ya mtshan can la sogs pa gong ma'i rigs las 'chol ba 'am /
translated: If a messenger from a higher caste than the ascetic and so forth is sent,

original: gzhan pa'i pho nya byung na ni gso ba'i las mi 'grub pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i pho nya byung na ni gso ba'i las mi 'grub pa'i rtags so //
translated: or if a messenger from another person comes, it is a sign of failure in the treatment.

original: ci ste rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i 'phrin pa 'ongs na yang 'og nas 'byung ba'i mtshan ma 'di dag ltar snang na gso ba'i 'bras bu med par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste rang gi rigs dang mthun pa'i 'phrin pa 'ongs na yang 'og nas 'byung ba'i mtshan ma 'di dag ltar snang na gso ba'i 'bras bu med par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If a messenger of one’s own class arrives, but the following signs appear, one should understand that there will be no result of healing.

original: de la sman pa 'bod du 'ongs pa'i tshe pho nya de yang shin tu dman pa'i tshig tu smra ba dang / pho nya 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang / shin tu rings thabs su smra ba dang / sngangs bag can dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: de la sman pa 'bod du 'ongs pa'i tshe pho nya de yang shin tu dman pa'i tshig tu smra ba dang / pho nya 'jigs pa dang bcas pa dang / shin tu rings thabs su smra ba dang / sngangs bag can dang bcas pa dang /
translated: When the messenger arrives to summon the physician, if the messenger speaks in extremely low words, if the messenger is fearful, if he speaks in a very hurried manner, if he is frightened,

original: tshig rtsub bag tu smra ba dang / bkra mi shis par smra ba dang / pho nya lag na mtshon cha thogs pa dang / dbyug pa thogs pa dang / g-yon can dang / mgo bregs pa dang / skra'i la ba can dang / dge mtshan med pa'i ming dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: tshig rtsub bag tu smra ba dang / bkra mi shis par smra ba dang / pho nya lag na mtshon cha thogs pa dang / dbyug pa thogs pa dang / g-yon can dang / mgo bregs pa dang / skra'i la ba can dang / dge mtshan med pa'i ming dang ldan pa dang /
translated: if he speaks harsh words in a low voice, if he speaks inauspiciously, if the messenger holds a weapon in his hand, if he holds a club, if he is deceitful, if he is shaven-headed, if he wears a cloth of hair, if he has an inauspicious name,

original: las ngan pa can dang / gos dri ma can dang / bud med 'phrin par 'ongs pa dang / mi mang po pho nyar 'ongs pa dang / 'phrin pa nad kyis btab pa dang / lus mi sdug pa dang / me tog gi phreng ba dmar pos lus brgyan pa @89b 'am ;
analyzed: las ngan pa can dang / gos dri ma can dang / bud med 'phrin par 'ongs pa dang / mi mang po pho nyar 'ongs pa dang / 'phrin pa nad kyis btab pa dang / lus mi sdug pa dang / me tog gi phreng ba dmar pos lus brgyan pa @89b 'am ;
translated: a messenger who is evil, who wears dirty clothes, who is a woman, who is a messenger for many people, who is sick, who has an ugly body, who is adorned with a red flower garland,

original: li khri la sogs pa'i byug pas skud pa dang / 'bru mar gyis lus skud pa dang / 'dam gyis skud pa dang / gos rnying pa gyon pa dang / mdog nyams pa'i gos gyon pa dang / chus 'drul ba'i gos gyon pa dang / gos gcig pa dang /
analyzed: li khri la sogs pa'i byug pas skud pa dang / 'bru mar gyis lus skud pa dang / 'dam gyis skud pa dang / gos rnying pa gyon pa dang / mdog nyams pa'i gos gyon pa dang / chus 'drul ba'i gos gyon pa dang / gos gcig pa dang /
translated: who is smeared with red dye, who is smeared with oil, who is smeared with mud, who wears old clothes, who wears faded clothes, who wears clothes that are ruined by water, who wears only one garment,

original: pho nya de bong bu dang / rnga mo dang ; ma he zhon te 'ongs pa dang / pho nya de rdo mkhan dang / shing mkhan dang / gong ma'i skyon gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa'i 'phrin pa rgyang ring po nas sman pa la 'bod na sman pa nad pa'i gan du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: pho nya de bong bu dang / rnga mo dang ; ma he zhon te 'ongs pa dang / pho nya de rdo mkhan dang / shing mkhan dang / gong ma'i skyon gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa'i 'phrin pa rgyang ring po nas sman pa la 'bod na sman pa nad pa'i gan du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: or who has come riding on a donkey, camel, or buffalo; or if the messenger is a stone-cutter, a wood-cutter, or has any of the king’s faults, then the physician should not go to the patient, even if the messenger calls from a distance.

original: sman pa bdag nyid dge mtshan ma yin pa'i bsam pa byed pa'am /🔽dge mtshan ma yin pa'i tshig smra ba'i dus su 'phrin pa 'ongs pa dang / sman pa gcer bur 'dug pa dang / rtsva gcod cing 'dug pa dang / rdo 'bugs shing 'dug pa dang / pha ma'i ched du sbyin sreg dang / mchod sbyin byed pa dang /
analyzed: sman pa bdag nyid dge mtshan ma yin pa'i bsam pa byed pa'am / dge mtshan ma yin pa'i tshig smra ba'i dus su 'phrin pa 'ongs pa dang / sman pa gcer bur 'dug pa dang / rtsva gcod cing 'dug pa dang / rdo 'bugs shing 'dug pa dang / pha ma'i ched du sbyin sreg dang / mchod sbyin byed pa dang /
translated: If a messenger arrives when the physician is thinking or saying something inauspicious,🔽or when the physician is naked, or when he is cutting grass, or when he is breaking stones, or when he is performing a fire offering or a sacrifice for his parents,

original: sa la nyal zhing 'dug pa dang ; skra bshig pa dang / mar skud cing 'dug pa dang / sman pa mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don cing du ba'i dus dang / sman pa smyung ba byed cing 'dug pa dang / mdor na sman pa'i spyod lam gong ma gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa'i skabs su 'phrin pa 'ongs na nad pa de nges par 'chi ba yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: sa la nyal zhing 'dug pa dang ; skra bshig pa dang / mar skud cing 'dug pa dang / sman pa mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don cing du ba'i dus dang / sman pa smyung ba byed cing 'dug pa dang / mdor na sman pa'i spyod lam gong ma gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa'i skabs su 'phrin pa 'ongs na nad pa de nges par 'chi ba yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: or when he is lying on the ground, or when he has disheveled hair, or when he is smearing himself with butter, or when the physician is grieving and lamenting, or when the physician is fasting, or in short, at any time when the physician is engaged in any of the above activities, if a messenger arrives, one should understand that the patient will certainly die.

original: nad pa'i nad gzhi dang / dus dang / pho nya dang / sman pa dang / phyogs su ldan par tshogs pa las ltas su bya ba ni /
analyzed: nad pa'i nad gzhi dang / dus dang / pho nya dang / sman pa dang / phyogs su ldan par tshogs pa las ltas su bya ba ni /
translated: The omens are to be known from the combination of the patient’s illness, the time, the messenger, the physician, and the direction.

original: nad pa bad kan gyi gzhi yang yod la /
analyzed: nad pa bad kan gyi gzhi yang yod la /
translated: If the patient has a basis in phlegm,

original: sman pa dang 'phrin pa gnyis kyang chu 'gram du snga dro phrad pa dang / nad pa mkhris pa'i gzhi yang yod la me 'am tsha ba'i phyogs su sman pa dang pho nya nyi ma byed la phrad pa dang / nad pa rlung nad gyi gzhi yang yod la /
analyzed: sman pa dang 'phrin pa gnyis kyang chu 'gram du snga dro phrad pa dang / nad pa mkhris pa'i gzhi yang yod la me 'am tsha ba'i phyogs su sman pa dang pho nya nyi ma byed la phrad pa dang / nad pa rlung nad gyi gzhi yang yod la /
translated: and the physician and messenger meet in the morning on the bank of a river, and the patient has a basis in bile, and the physician and messenger meet at noon in a place of fire or heat, and the patient has a basis in wind,

original: ngam grog dang g-yang sa lta bur sman pa dang pho nya phyi dro phrad par gyur na de ni gso ba'i yul las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: ngam grog dang g-yang sa lta bur sman pa dang pho nya phyi dro phrad par gyur na de ni gso ba'i yul las 'das pa yin no //
translated: and the physician and messenger meet in the evening in a place such as a ravine or a cliff, then that is beyond the realm of healing.

original: gzhan yang sman pa'i drung du pho nya 'ongs pa'i tshe 'di dag ltar snang na yang 'chi ba'i mtshan mar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sman pa'i drung du pho nya 'ongs pa'i tshe 'di dag ltar snang na yang 'chi ba'i mtshan mar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, when the messenger comes to the physician, if these things appear, they are also omens of death.

original: de yang lte ba lag pas nom pa dang / de bzhin du sna dang / kha dang / skra dang / ba spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / pho mtshan dang / rgyab dang / nu ma dang / mgrin pa dang / lto ba dang /
analyzed: de yang lte ba lag pas nom pa dang / de bzhin du sna dang / kha dang / skra dang / ba spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / pho mtshan dang / rgyab dang / nu ma dang / mgrin pa dang / lto ba dang /
translated: nose, mouth, hair, body hair, nails, teeth, genitals, back, breasts, throat, belly,

original: mthe'u chung @90a * //
analyzed: mthe'u chung @90a * //
translated: and the little finger

original: dang ; 'di dag la nom pa dang / nyug pa dang / reg par snang ba dang / gzhan lag pa nas ras bal thogs pa dang / de bzhin du phub ma dang / zha nye nag po dang / rus pa dang / rtsva dang /
analyzed: dang ; 'di dag la nom pa dang / nyug pa dang / reg par snang ba dang / gzhan lag pa nas ras bal thogs pa dang / de bzhin du phub ma dang / zha nye nag po dang / rus pa dang / rtsva dang /
translated: appear to be touched, rubbed, and felt, and others hold cotton, wool, black lead, bones, grass,🔽pestles, stones, brooms, mills, pieces of cloth, ashes, charcoal, cloth fringes,

original: gtun brdung dang / rdo dang / phyags ma dang / zhib ma dang / gos kyi dum bu dang / thal ba dang / sol ba dang / ras kyi kha tshar dang / gzigs ma dang / thag pa dang / gtun dang / srang dang /
analyzed: gtun brdung dang / rdo dang / phyags ma dang / zhib ma dang / gos kyi dum bu dang / thal ba dang / sol ba dang / ras kyi kha tshar dang / gzigs ma dang / thag pa dang / gtun dang / srang dang /
translated: mirrors, ropes, pestles, scales,🔽and so on in their hands.

original: zhags pa dang / 'di dag lag tu thogs te 'ongs pa dang / gzhan yang snod chag pa dang / nyams pa la sogs pa lag tu thogs pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: zhags pa dang / 'di dag lag tu thogs te 'ongs pa dang / gzhan yang snod chag pa dang / nyams pa la sogs pa lag tu thogs pa'ang rung ste /
translated: or any other broken or damaged vessel,

original: mtshan ma de dag sman pa'i mig sngar snang na nad pa nges par 'chi ba'i rtags so //🔽gzhan yang nyin zhag gi bye brag la sogs pa las pho nya'i mtshan ma bstan pa ni 'phrin pa sman pa'i gan du mtshan phyed na 'ongs pa dang / de bzhin du nyi ma phyed dang / tho rangs dang / dgongs dang / gnam stong dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma de dag sman pa'i mig sngar snang na nad pa nges par 'chi ba'i rtags so // gzhan yang nyin zhag gi bye brag la sogs pa las pho nya'i mtshan ma bstan pa ni 'phrin pa sman pa'i gan du mtshan phyed na 'ongs pa dang / de bzhin du nyi ma phyed dang / tho rangs dang / dgongs dang / gnam stong dang /
translated: if these signs appear before the physician, it is a sign that the patient will certainly die.🔽Furthermore, the signs of the messenger based on the specific day and so forth are as follows: If the messenger arrives at midnight,🔽at noon,🔽at dawn,🔽at dusk,🔽at the end of the month,🔽at the time of Rāhu,🔽at the time of Ketu rising,🔽at the time of the moon being eclipsed,

original: gzhan yang tshes drug dang / tshes bzhi dang / tshes dgu dang / sgra gcan dang / mjug rings shar ba'i dus dang / nye zla gzas zin pa'i dus dang / skar ma bra nye dang / smin drug dang / skag dang / chu stod dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshes drug dang / tshes bzhi dang / tshes dgu dang / sgra gcan dang / mjug rings shar ba'i dus dang / nye zla gzas zin pa'i dus dang / skar ma bra nye dang / smin drug dang / skag dang / chu stod dang /
translated: at the time of the stars Puṣya, Aśvinī, Mṛgaśirā, Ārdrā, Punarvasu, Puṣya, Āśleṣā, Maghā, Pūrvāṣāḍhā, Uttarāṣāḍhā, Śravaṇa, Śatabhiṣā, Pūrvaproṣṭapadī, Uttaraproṣṭapadī, Revatī, Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Kṛttikā, Rohiṇī, Mṛgaśirā, Ārdrā, Punarvasu, Puṣya, Āśleṣā, Maghā, Pūrvāṣāḍhā, Uttarāṣāḍhā, Śravaṇa, Śatabhiṣā, Pūrvaproṣṭapadī, Uttaraproṣṭapadī, Revatī, Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Kṛttikā, Rohiṇī, Mṛgaśirā, Ārdrā, Punarvasu, Puṣya, Āśleṣā, Maghā, Pūrvāṣāḍhā, Uttarāṣāḍhā, Śravaṇa, Śatabhiṣā, Pūrvaproṣṭapadī, Uttaraproṣṭapadī, Revatī, Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Kṛttikā, Rohiṇī, Mṛgaśirā, Ārdrā, Punarvasu, Puṣya, Āśleṣā, Maghā, Pūrvāṣāḍhā, Uttarāṣāḍhā, Śravaṇa, Śatabhiṣā, Pūrvaproṣṭapadī, Uttaraproṣṭapadī, Revatī, Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Kṛttikā, Rohiṇī, Mṛ

original: gre dang / khrums stod dang / snrubs dang / skar ma de rnams dbang ba'i nyin zhag la pho nya 'ongs te nad pa'i don du shog shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis 'gugs par byed na yang mi dge ba'i rtags te /
analyzed: gre dang / khrums stod dang / snrubs dang / skar ma de rnams dbang ba'i nyin zhag la pho nya 'ongs te nad pa'i don du shog shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis 'gugs par byed na yang mi dge ba'i rtags te /
translated: If a messenger arrives on a day ruled by the nakṣatras Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Maghā, Mūla, or Puṣya, and invites the physician to treat a patient, this is a sign of nonvirtue.

original: sman pas bgrod par bya ba'i gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: sman pas bgrod par bya ba'i gnas ma yin no //
translated: This is not a place the physician should visit.

original: sman pa nad pa'i gan du chas pa'i tshe lam kar 'di dag mthong ba 'am thos pa ni mi 'grub pa'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: sman pa nad pa'i gan du chas pa'i tshe lam kar 'di dag mthong ba 'am thos pa ni mi 'grub pa'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: When the physician sets out to see the patient, if he sees or hears these things on the way, they are signs of failure:

original: dbang po ma tshang ba'i mi dang / mi ro 'am mi ro'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa mthong ba dang / thag pa la sogs pa chad pa dang / gos la sogs pa tshig pa dang / snod chag pa la sogs pa'i sgra thos pa dang /
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang ba'i mi dang / mi ro 'am mi ro'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa mthong ba dang / thag pa la sogs pa chad pa dang / gos la sogs pa tshig pa dang / snod chag pa la sogs pa'i sgra thos pa dang /
translated: seeing a person with incomplete faculties, a human corpse, or a corpse adorned with ornaments; hearing the sound of a rope breaking, clothes burning, or a pot breaking;

original: mi ro dri mi zhim pa 'am /
analyzed: mi ro dri mi zhim pa 'am /
translated: or smelling the foul odor of a corpse.

original: reg pa yang shas cher rtsub pa dang / gzhan yang de dag 'dra ba'i mi dge ba'i mtshan ma mthong ngam thos na mi dge ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: reg pa yang shas cher rtsub pa dang / gzhan yang de dag 'dra ba'i mi dge ba'i mtshan ma mthong ngam thos na mi dge ba'i rtags so //
translated: If one sees or hears such inauspicious signs, it is a sign of non-virtue.

original: gzhan yang lam du ha ha zhes bya ba'i sgra dang / gcig la gcig brdeg pa dang / 'thab pa'i @90b sgra dang / lhung ba'i sgra dang / sbrid pa'i sgra dang / 'di lta bu mthong ba dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / mtshon cha chag pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang lam du ha ha zhes bya ba'i sgra dang / gcig la gcig brdeg pa dang / 'thab pa'i @90b sgra dang / lhung ba'i sgra dang / sbrid pa'i sgra dang / 'di lta bu mthong ba dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / mtshon cha chag pa dang /
translated: Moreover, if one hears the sound of ha ha on the road, the sound of striking each other, fighting, falling, sneezing, or sees such things, or if one's clothes, parasol, or weapons break,

original: sdug bsngal dag mthong ba dang / gzhan yang mchod pa'i rten dang / rgyal mtshan dang / snod gang yang chu'i nang du nub pa mthong ba dang / bsad pa dang ; dbug pa dang / bsreg pa la sogs pa'i sgra drag po thos pa dang /🔽sman pa lam du 'gro ba'i tshe thal ba 'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dag mthong ba dang / gzhan yang mchod pa'i rten dang / rgyal mtshan dang / snod gang yang chu'i nang du nub pa mthong ba dang / bsad pa dang ; dbug pa dang / bsreg pa la sogs pa'i sgra drag po thos pa dang / sman pa lam du 'gro ba'i tshe thal ba 'am /
translated: sees suffering, or sees any offering shrine, banner, or vessel submerged in water, hears loud sounds of killing, stabbing, burning, etc.,🔽or if a doctor on the road is covered in ashes,🔽dust,

original: rdul gyis g-yogs pa'am /
analyzed: rdul gyis g-yogs pa'am /
translated: covered with dust,🔽🔽

original: byi la dang / srog chags go da dang / sram dang spre'u rnams kyis lam bcad pa dang / gang na nyi ma rgyu ba'i phyogs su nad pa gnas pa der 'gro ba dang / sha za ba'i gcan gzan gung la sogs pa dang / bya rgod la sogs pa'i sgra mi bzad pa thos pa dang /
analyzed: byi la dang / srog chags go da dang / sram dang spre'u rnams kyis lam bcad pa dang / gang na nyi ma rgyu ba'i phyogs su nad pa gnas pa der 'gro ba dang / sha za ba'i gcan gzan gung la sogs pa dang / bya rgod la sogs pa'i sgra mi bzad pa thos pa dang /
translated: and of vultures, etc.

original: 'di lta bu mthong ba dang / thos pa yang nges par 'chi ba'i rtags su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu mthong ba dang / thos pa yang nges par 'chi ba'i rtags su rig par bya'o //
translated: Seeing and hearing such things should be known as signs of certain death.

original: gzhan 'di dag mthong na yang mtshan ma ngan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan 'di dag mthong na yang mtshan ma ngan pa ste /
translated: If one sees these other things, they are also bad omens:

original: 'bru nag po dang / bu ram dang / dar ba dang / lan tshva dang / btung ba dang / pags pa dang / yungs kar dang / zhag dang / 'bru mar dang / rtsva dang / 'dam dang / bud shing dang / ma ning dang /
analyzed: 'bru nag po dang / bu ram dang / dar ba dang / lan tshva dang / btung ba dang / pags pa dang / yungs kar dang / zhag dang / 'bru mar dang / rtsva dang / 'dam dang / bud shing dang / ma ning dang /
translated: black grains, molasses, cotton, salt, drinks, skin, white mustard seed, oil, sesame oil, grass, mud, firewood, and eunuchs.

original: rigs ngan pa dang / rgya dang / rnyi dang / slon pa dang / bshad ba dang / rnag dang / de la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ngan pa mthong ba dang / snying po med pa dang / 'khrig pa spyod pa dang // gzhan yang gang 'phrin pa ras bal thogs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gang yang rung ba 'dir mthong na yang mtshan ma ngan par blta'o //
analyzed: rigs ngan pa dang / rgya dang / rnyi dang / slon pa dang / bshad ba dang / rnag dang / de la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ngan pa mthong ba dang / snying po med pa dang / 'khrig pa spyod pa dang // gzhan yang gang 'phrin pa ras bal thogs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gang yang rung ba 'dir mthong na yang mtshan ma ngan par blta'o //
translated: the low caste, the trap, the snare, the prison, the execution, the pus, and so on.🔽If one sees a sign of this kind, it is an inauspicious sign.

original: sman pa dgra dang phrad pa dang / mal dang / stan dang / khyogs kha sbub tu mthong ba dang / de bzhin du snod la sogs pa bsbub  tu mthong na thams cad 'bras bu med pa yin no //
analyzed: sman pa dgra dang phrad pa dang / mal dang / stan dang / khyogs kha sbub tu mthong ba dang / de bzhin du snod la sogs pa bsbub  tu mthong na thams cad 'bras bu med pa yin no //
translated: If one sees a doctor, an enemy, a bed, a seat, a litter turned upside down, or a vessel turned upside down, all is without result.

original: sman pa lam du 'gro ba'i tse pho'i ming dang ldan pa bya ngang pa dang / sreg pa dang / lco ga la sogs pa g-yon logs na gnas pa dang / mo'i ming dang ldan pa ri dags dang lco ga mo la sogs pa g-yas logs na gnas pa dang /
analyzed: sman pa lam du 'gro ba'i tse pho'i ming dang ldan pa bya ngang pa dang / sreg pa dang / lco ga la sogs pa g-yon logs na gnas pa dang / mo'i ming dang ldan pa ri dags dang lco ga mo la sogs pa g-yas logs na gnas pa dang /
translated: The physician, the name of the place on the road, the goose, the partridge, the peacock, and so forth, which have male names, are on the left; the deer, the peahen, and so forth, which have female names, are on the right.

original: bya dang ri dags la sogs pa g-yon nas g-yas su 'gro na dge ba'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: bya dang ri dags la sogs pa g-yon nas g-yas su 'gro na dge ba'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: If the birds and deer, etc., go from left to right, it is a sign of virtue.

original: khyi dang wa gnyis ni g-yas nas g-yon du 'gro na shis pa'i mtshan ma'o //🔽ri dags gnyis la sogs pa zung du mi them pa'i gsum dang / @91a * //
analyzed: khyi dang wa gnyis ni g-yas nas g-yon du 'gro na shis pa'i mtshan ma'o // ri dags gnyis la sogs pa zung du mi them pa'i gsum dang / @91a * //
translated: If the dog and the fox go from right to left, it is a sign of good fortune.

original: lnga la sogs pa mthong na bkra shis pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: lnga la sogs pa mthong na bkra shis pa'i rtags so //
translated: If one sees two deer, etc., in pairs, three, five, and so forth, it is a sign of good fortune.

original: bya tsa sha dang / bya rgod dang / ba ra dva tsa dang / rma bya dang / ne'u le dang / ra dang 'di rnams g-yas g-yon gang na gnas na rtag tu shis pa yin no //
analyzed: bya tsa sha dang / bya rgod dang / ba ra dva tsa dang / rma bya dang / ne'u le dang / ra dang 'di rnams g-yas g-yon gang na gnas na rtag tu shis pa yin no //
translated: The chakora bird, the vulture, the babhruka, the peacock, the mongoose, and the goat—if any of these are on the right or the left, it is always auspicious.

original: 'ug pa dang / byi la dang / sbrul dang / 'di rnams g-yas g-yon gang na gnas na yang mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: 'ug pa dang / byi la dang / sbrul dang / 'di rnams g-yas g-yon gang na gnas na yang mi dge ba yin no //
translated: owls, cats, snakes, and so forth, are inauspicious whether they are on the right or the left.

original: khu byug dang / go da dang / sbrul dang / ri bong dang / dzi ba ka rnams kyi ming thos pa ni dge ba yin la mthong ba ni ma rungs par bshad do //
analyzed: khu byug dang / go da dang / sbrul dang / ri bong dang / dzi ba ka rnams kyi ming thos pa ni dge ba yin la mthong ba ni ma rungs par bshad do //
translated: The names of the cuckoo, the peacock, the snake, the rabbit, and the jīvaka are auspicious, but it is explained that seeing them is inauspicious.

original: de bzhin du dred  dang / spre'u'i ming thos pa ni shis la mthong ba ni mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dred  dang / spre'u'i ming thos pa ni shis la mthong ba ni mi dge ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, the names of the bear and the monkey are auspicious, but seeing them is inauspicious.

original: sman pa'i 'phral ba la dbang po'i gzhu babs pa ni mi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: sman pa'i 'phral ba la dbang po'i gzhu babs pa ni mi dge ba yin la /
translated: If the bow of the god of love is placed on the forehead of a physician, it is inauspicious.

original: mthong ba ni bkra shis pa'i mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba ni bkra shis pa'i mtshan ma yin no //
translated: But if it is seen, it is a sign of good fortune.

original: snod gang mes gang bar mthong na ni bzang ba yin la /
analyzed: snod gang mes gang bar mthong na ni bzang ba yin la /
translated: If one sees a vessel filled with fire, it is good.

original: de nyid chag cing nang stong par mthong ba ni ngan par bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid chag cing nang stong par mthong ba ni ngan par bshad do //
translated: But if one sees it broken and empty inside, it is explained as bad.

original: de ltar gong gi mtshan ma ngan pa de dag mthong na ni dor zhing spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gong gi mtshan ma ngan pa de dag mthong na ni dor zhing spang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, if one sees those inauspicious signs above, one should abandon and avoid them.

original: sman pa lam du 'gro ba'i tshe 'am /
analyzed: sman pa lam du 'gro ba'i tshe 'am /
translated: When a physician is traveling on the road,

original: nad pa'i khyim du 'jug khar zho ma nyams pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba 'di dag mthong na bkra shis par gzung ste /
analyzed: nad pa'i khyim du 'jug khar zho ma nyams pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba 'di dag mthong na bkra shis par gzung ste /
translated: When entering the home of a sick person, if one sees these things that will occur later, such as undamaged yogurt, it is taken as an auspicious sign.

original: snying rje'i bsam pa nye bar bzhag nas 'bad pa byas pas gso bar bya'o ;
analyzed: snying rje'i bsam pa nye bar bzhag nas 'bad pa byas pas gso bar bya'o ;
translated: With a compassionate attitude, one should make an effort to treat the patient.

original: / de yang zho ma nyams pa la sogs pa mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / reg pa ni mi 'chi ba'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: / de yang zho ma nyams pa la sogs pa mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / reg pa ni mi 'chi ba'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: Seeing, hearing, or touching undamaged yogurt and so on are signs of not dying.

original: gzhan 'bras dang / khre dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar dang / sen rtsi dang / dngul rdo dang / bum pa dang / dril bu dang / mar me dang / padma dang / rtsva d'ur ba dang ; sha rlon pa dang / nya dang /
analyzed: gzhan 'bras dang / khre dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar dang / sen rtsi dang / dngul rdo dang / bum pa dang / dril bu dang / mar me dang / padma dang / rtsva d'ur ba dang ; sha rlon pa dang / nya dang /
translated: Other signs are seeing or hearing the results of barley, wheat, honey, butter, lac, silver ore, a pot, a bell, a lamp, a lotus, durva grass, fresh meat, fish,

original: 'bras yos dang / 'bras bu dang / g-yos sna tshogs sbyar ba dang / rin po che dang / glang po che dang / bum pa gang ba dang / bud med gzhon nu dang / rgyal pos go 'phang bstod cing thabs dam pa rtsal ba'i mi dang 'phrad pa dang /
analyzed: 'bras yos dang / 'bras bu dang / g-yos sna tshogs sbyar ba dang / rin po che dang / glang po che dang / bum pa gang ba dang / bud med gzhon nu dang / rgyal pos go 'phang bstod cing thabs dam pa rtsal ba'i mi dang 'phrad pa dang /
translated: rice, fruit, various kinds of cooked food, jewels, elephants, full vases, young women, and meeting a person who praises the royal position and offers a high position.

original: lha rnams mthong ba dang / rgyal po mthong ba dang / me tog su ma na dkar po dang / gos shin tu dkar ba dang / rnga yab dkar po dang / rta dang / dung dang / skyes bu dam pa dang / bram ze dang /
analyzed: lha rnams mthong ba dang / rgyal po mthong ba dang / me tog su ma na dkar po dang / gos shin tu dkar ba dang / rnga yab dkar po dang / rta dang / dung dang / skyes bu dam pa dang / bram ze dang /
translated: Seeing gods, seeing a king, white jasmine flowers, very white clothes, white yak-tail fans, horses, conches, holy men, brahmins,

original: cod pan can dang / rta babs dang / g-yung drung dang / sa phyogs mthon po dang / @91b me 'bar ba dang / bza' btung yid du 'ong ba dang / shing rta gang ba dang / ba drus ma be'u dang bcas pa gsum dang /
analyzed: cod pan can dang / rta babs dang / g-yung drung dang / sa phyogs mthon po dang / @91b me 'bar ba dang / bza' btung yid du 'ong ba dang / shing rta gang ba dang / ba drus ma be'u dang bcas pa gsum dang /
translated: crown ornaments, archways, swastikas, high places, blazing fires, delicious food and drink, full carts, and three mother cows with calves.

original: rgod ma rte'u dang bcas pa gsum dang / bud med bu dang bcas pa mthong ba dang / shang shang te'u dang / ri dvags dang / bzhad dang / khu byug dang / ngang pa dang / rma bya dang / phyugs gcig btags pa mthong ba dang /🔽gdu bu dang / me long dang / yungs kar dang / gi'u wang dang / 'di rnams mthong ba dang / bdug pa'i dri dang / byug pas byugs pa dang / dkar ba dang dmar ba'i khu bcud dang / khyu mchog dang mthun pa'i skad snyan pa sgrogs pa dang /
analyzed: rgod ma rte'u dang bcas pa gsum dang / bud med bu dang bcas pa mthong ba dang / shang shang te'u dang / ri dvags dang / bzhad dang / khu byug dang / ngang pa dang / rma bya dang / phyugs gcig btags pa mthong ba dang / gdu bu dang / me long dang / yungs kar dang / gi'u wang dang / 'di rnams mthong ba dang / bdug pa'i dri dang / byug pas byugs pa dang / dkar ba dang dmar ba'i khu bcud dang / khyu mchog dang mthun pa'i skad snyan pa sgrogs pa dang /
translated: seeing a mare and her foal, a woman and her son, a partridge, a deer, a peacock, a cuckoo, a goose, a peacock, and a cow tied together;🔽seeing bracelets, mirrors, white mustard seeds, vermillion, and these; the smell of incense, being anointed with ointments, white and red nutritious substances, and the sound of a bull;

original: ri dags dang / bya dang / mi rnams kyi skad snyan pa dang / de bzhin du gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgrengs pa mthong ba dang / rgyal ba dang / bkra shis par gyur cig pa'i skad snyan pa thos pa dang /
analyzed: ri dags dang / bya dang / mi rnams kyi skad snyan pa dang / de bzhin du gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgrengs pa mthong ba dang / rgyal ba dang / bkra shis par gyur cig pa'i skad snyan pa thos pa dang /
translated: the pleasant sounds of the voices of deer, birds, and humans; likewise, seeing raised parasols, victory banners, and flags; and hearing the pleasant sounds of “victory” and “may there be auspiciousness.”

original: rdza rnga dang / rnga bo che dang / dung dang / bsod nams dang ldan pa'i longs spyod kyi sgra rnams snyan pa thos pa dang / rig byed 'don pa'i sgra dang / bde ba 'am mthun pa'i rlung gis g-yon logs nas g-yas su bskor ba dang /
analyzed: rdza rnga dang / rnga bo che dang / dung dang / bsod nams dang ldan pa'i longs spyod kyi sgra rnams snyan pa thos pa dang / rig byed 'don pa'i sgra dang / bde ba 'am mthun pa'i rlung gis g-yon logs nas g-yas su bskor ba dang /
translated: The sounds of a clay drum, a large drum, a conch, and the sound of the enjoyment of merit, the sound of reciting the Vedas, and a pleasant or favorable wind blowing from the left to the right.

original: mdor na sman pa lam du 'gro ba dang / nad pa'i khyim du phyin pa'i tshe gong du bstan pa de dag gi sgra thos pa dang / mthong ba dang / rig par byed pa na las rtsom pa nges par 'grub par 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: mdor na sman pa lam du 'gro ba dang / nad pa'i khyim du phyin pa'i tshe gong du bstan pa de dag gi sgra thos pa dang / mthong ba dang / rig par byed pa na las rtsom pa nges par 'grub par 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: In brief, when a physician goes on a journey and arrives at the house of a patient, if he hears, sees, or knows the sounds mentioned above, it indicates that the undertaking of the procedure will definitely be successful.

original: de ltar 'phrin pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'phrin pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of messengers, virtue, and non-virtue in that way,

original: da ni rmi lam gyi mtshan ma'i 'chi ltas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rmi lam gyi mtshan ma'i 'chi ltas bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the signs of death in dreams will be explained.

original: skyes bu gang gi rmi lam gyi nang du shi ba'i mi dang chang lhan cig 'thungs nas khyis drud par rmis na de ni 'chi bdag rims kyi gzugs can gyis myur du khyer bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gi rmi lam gyi nang du shi ba'i mi dang chang lhan cig 'thungs nas khyis drud par rmis na de ni 'chi bdag rims kyi gzugs can gyis myur du khyer bar byed pa yin no //
translated: If a person dreams that he drinks alcohol together with a dead person and is dragged by a dog, he will be quickly carried off by the Lord of Death in the form of a plague.

original: me tog gi phreng ba dmar pos lus brgyan pa dang / lus dmar por mthong ba dang / gos dmar po gyon pa dang / bud med rgod bag can gyis khyer bar rmis na /
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba dmar pos lus brgyan pa dang / lus dmar por mthong ba dang / gos dmar po gyon pa dang / bud med rgod bag can gyis khyer bar rmis na /
translated: If he dreams that he is adorned with a red garland, sees his body as red, wears red clothes, or is carried off by a lustful woman,

original: de ni 'chi bdag khrag mkhris kyi gzugs can gyis khyer ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'chi bdag khrag mkhris kyi gzugs can gyis khyer ba yin no //
translated: he will be carried off by the Lord of Death in the form of blood and bile.

original: ma he dang / rta dang / phag dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu rnams la bdag nyid zhon te /
analyzed: ma he dang / rta dang / phag dang / rnga mo dang / bong bu rnams la bdag nyid zhon te /
translated: If he dreams that he rides a buffalo, horse, pig, camel, or donkey

original: lho phyogs su 'gro bar rmi na gcong chen po'i gzugs can gyi 'chi bdag gis zin pa yin no //
analyzed: lho phyogs su 'gro bar rmi na gcong chen po'i gzugs can gyi 'chi bdag gis zin pa yin no //
translated: and goes south, he is seized by the Lord of Death in the form of a great tumor.

original: @92a * // shing char ma can gyi lcug ma dang / 'od ma gang yang rung ba mgo bo 'am snying ga nas byung ba rmis na /
analyzed: @92a * // shing char ma can gyi lcug ma dang / 'od ma gang yang rung ba mgo bo 'am snying ga nas byung ba rmis na /
translated: If he dreams that a branch of a rain tree or any kind of reed grows from his head or heart,

original: de ni 'chi bdag skran gyi gzugs can gyis khyer ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'chi bdag skran gyi gzugs can gyis khyer ba yin no //
translated: This is being carried off by the form of the Lord of Death, Cancer.

original: skyes bu gang me mi 'bar ba'i mdag  ma la sbyin sreg byed pa rmi ba dang / mar gyis lus bskus shing gcer bur 'dug pa dang / snying gar padma byung ba rmis na de ni 'chi bdag mdze'i gzugs can gyis bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gang me mi 'bar ba'i mdag  ma la sbyin sreg byed pa rmi ba dang / mar gyis lus bskus shing gcer bur 'dug pa dang / snying gar padma byung ba rmis na de ni 'chi bdag mdze'i gzugs can gyis bzung ba yin no //
translated: If one dreams that one is making a fire offering in burning coals that are not burning, that one’s body is smeared with butter and sitting naked, and that a lotus appears in one’s heart, this is being seized by the form of the Lord of Death, Smallpox.

original: til mar gyi chogs rigs ngan dang lhan cig 'thung bar rmis na /
analyzed: til mar gyi chogs rigs ngan dang lhan cig 'thung bar rmis na /
translated: If one dreams that one drinks a mixture of sesame oil together with an outcaste,

original: de ni 'chi bdag gcin nad kyi gzugs can gyis blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'chi bdag gcin nad kyi gzugs can gyis blangs pa yin no //
translated: this is being seized by the form of the Lord of Death, Urinary Disease.

original: srin po kun dang / lhan cig bro gar byed cing chu la 'byid ba rmis na /
analyzed: srin po kun dang / lhan cig bro gar byed cing chu la 'byid ba rmis na /
translated: If one dreams that one dances and plays in the water together with all rākṣasas,

original: de ni 'chi bdag smyo byed kyi gzugs can gyis zin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'chi bdag smyo byed kyi gzugs can gyis zin pa yin no //
translated: this is being seized by the form of the Lord of Death, Insanity.

original: mi shi ba dang lhan cig chang 'thung zhing ra ro la gar byed par rmis na /
analyzed: mi shi ba dang lhan cig chang 'thung zhing ra ro la gar byed par rmis na /
translated: If one dreams that one drinks beer and dances wildly together with a dead person,

original: de ni 'chi bdag brjed byed kyi gzugs can gyis 'chos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'chi bdag brjed byed kyi gzugs can gyis 'chos pa yin no //
translated: this is being seized by the form of the Lord of Death, Epilepsy.

original: bong bu dang / rnga mo dang / byi pa dang / spre'u dang / ser ge dang / phag dang / wa dang / ro la zhon par rmis na /
analyzed: bong bu dang / rnga mo dang / byi pa dang / spre'u dang / ser ge dang / phag dang / wa dang / ro la zhon par rmis na /
translated: If one dreams of riding a donkey, a camel, a dog, a monkey, a tiger, a pig, a fox, or a corpse,

original: de ni 'chi bdag gi khar son pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'chi bdag gi khar son pa yin no //
translated: one has arrived at the jaws of death.

original: snum khur dang / sha ku li rmi lam gyi nang du zos par rmis la sad ma thag tu de bzhin slon par byed na /
analyzed: snum khur dang / sha ku li rmi lam gyi nang du zos par rmis la sad ma thag tu de bzhin slon par byed na /
translated: If one dreams of eating oil or meat, and immediately upon awakening one eats it,

original: de ni 'tsho ba'i srog spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'tsho ba'i srog spangs pa yin no //
translated: one has abandoned the life of living.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma gzas zin pa rmis na /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma gzas zin pa rmis na /
translated: If one dreams of the sun and moon being eclipsed,

original: de ni mig nad skyed par byed pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: de ni mig nad skyed par byed pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: this is a sign of the arising of an eye disease.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma lhung bar rmis na /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma lhung bar rmis na /
translated: If one dreams of the sun and moon falling,

original: mig gi mthong ba nyams pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: mig gi mthong ba nyams pa'i rtags so //
translated: this is a sign of the loss of eye sight.

original: spyi bo nas 'od ma'i lcug ma skyes par rmis pa dang / spyi bo la bya rog gi tshang 'cha' ba dang / mgo bo chad par rmis na 'tsho ba spang bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi bo nas 'od ma'i lcug ma skyes par rmis pa dang / spyi bo la bya rog gi tshang 'cha' ba dang / mgo bo chad par rmis na 'tsho ba spang bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If one dreams of a sprout of bamboo growing from the crown of one's head, a crow's nest on one's head, or one's head being cut off, one should understand that one has abandoned life.

original: bya rgod dang / 'ug pa dang / bya rog la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba dang / de bzhin du yi dags dang / sha za mo dang / tra pa ti dang / aan tra'i yul gyi mi ltar sha gnag pa dang / rigs ngan sha mdog ngan pa'i mi rnams kyis bskor bar rmis na 'chi ba'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: bya rgod dang / 'ug pa dang / bya rog la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba dang / de bzhin du yi dags dang / sha za mo dang / tra pa ti dang / aan tra'i yul gyi mi ltar sha gnag pa dang / rigs ngan sha mdog ngan pa'i mi rnams kyis bskor bar rmis na 'chi ba'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: If one dreams that one is surrounded by vultures, owls, crows, and so forth, or that one is surrounded by hungry ghosts, female flesh-eaters, and people from the Trapuṣa and Aṇtara countries, who are dark-skinned and of low caste and complexion, this is a sign of death.

original: spa'i tshal dang / 'od ma'i tshal dang / tsher ma'i tshal dang / rtsva'i nags stug po'i nang du 'gro zhing nyam thag pa rmis na 'chi ba'i rtags su bstan to //
analyzed: spa'i tshal dang / 'od ma'i tshal dang / tsher ma'i tshal dang / rtsva'i nags stug po'i nang du 'gro zhing nyam thag pa rmis na 'chi ba'i rtags su bstan to //
translated: If one dreams of going into a forest of reeds, a forest of bamboo, a forest of thorns, or a dense forest of grass, and of being distressed, this is said to be a sign of death.

original: g-yang sar lhung ba dang / dur khrod dang / rdul dang / @92b thal ba'i nang du nyal ba rmis na 'chi ba'i rtags su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yang sar lhung ba dang / dur khrod dang / rdul dang / @92b thal ba'i nang du nyal ba rmis na 'chi ba'i rtags su rig par bya'o //
translated: If one dreams of falling into an abyss, a charnel ground, or of lying in dust and ashes, one should know that this is a sign of death.

original: chu dang 'dam gyi nang du lus bying zhing snying gnas chu'i rgyun 'byung bar rmis na gshin rje'i khyim na gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: chu dang 'dam gyi nang du lus bying zhing snying gnas chu'i rgyun 'byung bar rmis na gshin rje'i khyim na gnas pa yin no //
translated: If one dreams of one's body sinking in water or mud, or of a stream of water flowing from one's heart, one is dwelling in the house of Yama.

original: glu dang / gar dang / rol mo byed cing me tog gi phreng ba dmar po dang / gos dmar po 'chang zhing gyon par rmis na mi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: glu dang / gar dang / rol mo byed cing me tog gi phreng ba dmar po dang / gos dmar po 'chang zhing gyon par rmis na mi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: If one dreams of singing, dancing, and playing music, and of wearing and putting on red garlands and red clothes, this is not desirable.

original: bdag gi lus rgas par rmi ba dang / lus 'phel bar rmi ba dang / bsku byug byed pa rmi ba dang bag ma btang bar rmi ba dang / spu 'dreg par rmis na 'di yang mi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi lus rgas par rmi ba dang / lus 'phel bar rmi ba dang / bsku byug byed pa rmi ba dang bag ma btang bar rmi ba dang / spu 'dreg par rmis na 'di yang mi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: If one dreams of one's body aging, of one's body growing, of anointing, of giving away a daughter, and of shaving hair, this also is not desirable.

original: btsos pa'i zas dang / snum dang / chang la brkam pa dang / skyugs pa dang / 'khru ba rmis na mi 'dod pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: btsos pa'i zas dang / snum dang / chang la brkam pa dang / skyugs pa dang / 'khru ba rmis na mi 'dod pa'i rtags so //
translated: If one dreams of craving cooked food, oil, and beer, of vomiting, and of washing, this is a sign of the undesirable.

original: gser la sogs pa'i lcags drug rnyed par rmis pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / bdag pham par rmis na de yang 'chi ba'i mngon rtags so //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa'i lcags drug rnyed par rmis pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / bdag pham par rmis na de yang 'chi ba'i mngon rtags so //
translated: If one dreams of finding the six metals such as gold, of disputes, of being bound, and of one's own defeat, this also is a sign of death.

original: rkang pa'i pags pa g-yang du lhung ba dang / mchil lhvam gnyis stor ba rmis pa dang / skyes bu gang yang pha mes shi ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ngag rtsub pos bdag nyid spyos te lus spu zing zhes byed cing 'jigs par rmis pa dang /
analyzed: rkang pa'i pags pa g-yang du lhung ba dang / mchil lhvam gnyis stor ba rmis pa dang / skyes bu gang yang pha mes shi ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ngag rtsub pos bdag nyid spyos te lus spu zing zhes byed cing 'jigs par rmis pa dang /
translated: If one dreams of the skin of one’s feet falling off, or of losing one’s two lips, or of being scolded with harsh words by one’s father, mother, or the dead, and so forth, and one’s body hair standing on end in fear,

original: gzhan yang brag ral ba dang / skar mda' dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / so dang / lham dang / mig dang 'di rnams lhung ba dang / zhig par rmis na de yang mi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang brag ral ba dang / skar mda' dang / gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / so dang / lham dang / mig dang 'di rnams lhung ba dang / zhig par rmis na de yang mi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: or if one dreams of a mountain peak, a meteor, a planet, a constellation, a tooth, a shoe, or an eye falling or breaking, that is also undesirable.

original: nags tshal stug po'i nang du 'gro ba dang / me tog dmar pos brgyan pa dang / sdig can gyi khyim du 'jug pa dang / mi ro bsregs pa'i shing gi nang du bdag nyid zhugs par rmi ba dang / 'jigs su rung ba'i gnas su 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: nags tshal stug po'i nang du 'gro ba dang / me tog dmar pos brgyan pa dang / sdig can gyi khyim du 'jug pa dang / mi ro bsregs pa'i shing gi nang du bdag nyid zhugs par rmi ba dang / 'jigs su rung ba'i gnas su 'gro ba dang /
translated: If one dreams of entering a dense forest, being adorned with red flowers, entering the house of a sinner, entering oneself into a tree for burning a human corpse, going to a terrifying place,

original: ma'i mngal du slar 'jug par rmis na srog dang bral ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du slar 'jug par rmis na srog dang bral ba'i rtags so //
translated: or re-entering one’s mother’s womb, that is a sign of losing one’s life.

original: khang bzangs dang / brag mthon po dang / ri chen po nas lhung bar rmis na 'chi ba'i mngon rtags so //
analyzed: khang bzangs dang / brag mthon po dang / ri chen po nas lhung bar rmis na 'chi ba'i mngon rtags so //
translated: If one dreams of falling from a house, a high cliff, or a great mountain, this is a sign of death.

original: de bzhin du nyas mid par rmis na de ltar ba lta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyas mid par rmis na de ltar ba lta'o //
translated: Similarly, if one dreams of being swallowed by a fish, it is as explained above.

original: skyes bu gang chos gos gon pa dang / cha lugs ngan pa 'chang ba dang / gcar bu rnams dang / lag na dbyug pa thogs pa dang / mig dmar po dang / lus nag po'i skyes bu mthong ba rmis na bsngags pa ma yin te nyes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gang chos gos gon pa dang / cha lugs ngan pa 'chang ba dang / gcar bu rnams dang / lag na dbyug pa thogs pa dang / mig dmar po dang / lus nag po'i skyes bu mthong ba rmis na bsngags pa ma yin te nyes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: If one dreams of seeing people wearing Dharma robes, wearing bad clothes, being naked, carrying sticks in their hands, having red eyes, or having a dark body, it is a bad omen with faults.

original: bud med nag mo sdig pa can gyi gdong dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bud med nag mo sdig pa can gyi gdong dang ldan pa /
translated: If one dreams of a black woman with a sinful face,

original: skra dang / sen mo dang / nu ma ring ba dang / @93a * //
analyzed: skra dang / sen mo dang / nu ma ring ba dang / @93a * //
translated: long hair, nails, and breasts,

original: gos dang / phreng ba rnyings shing dri ma dang bcas pa gyon zhing 'ongs pa rmis na nges par 'chi ba'i mngon rtags so //
analyzed: gos dang / phreng ba rnyings shing dri ma dang bcas pa gyon zhing 'ongs pa rmis na nges par 'chi ba'i mngon rtags so //
translated: wearing dirty clothes and garlands, it is a definite sign of death.

original: gong du rmi lam sna tshogs kyi mtshan mar bstan pa de dag 'dir rmi lam du ji ltar 'byung zhing mthong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gong du rmi lam sna tshogs kyi mtshan mar bstan pa de dag 'dir rmi lam du ji ltar 'byung zhing mthong ba yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “How do the various signs of dreams arise and appear in dreams?”

original: gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su dri ma gsum shas cher 'khrugs pas dbang po'i rgyun kun tu khyab ste gnas pa las yid ni mi 'gag pa'i bdag nyid yin pas dbang po'i rgyun thams cad kyi rjes su gcod pa'i bye brag las rmi ltas su snang ste /
analyzed: gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su dri ma gsum shas cher 'khrugs pas dbang po'i rgyun kun tu khyab ste gnas pa las yid ni mi 'gag pa'i bdag nyid yin pas dbang po'i rgyun thams cad kyi rjes su gcod pa'i bye brag las rmi ltas su snang ste /
translated: In the situation of sleep, the three stains are greatly disturbed and pervade the continuity of the sense organs. From that, the mind, which has the nature of not ceasing, follows the continuity of all the sense organs and, from that, the various dream signs appear.

original: de yang mig gi dbang po'i skyon dang bcas pa'i rgyun la yid gcod pa'i dus na ni gzugs sna tshogs mthong ba la sogs pa'i rmi lam 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de yang mig gi dbang po'i skyon dang bcas pa'i rgyun la yid gcod pa'i dus na ni gzugs sna tshogs mthong ba la sogs pa'i rmi lam 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, when the mind follows the continuity of the sense organ of the eye, which has faults, dreams such as seeing various forms arise.

original: de bzhin du dbang po'i rgyun thams cad la yang de ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po'i rgyun thams cad la yang de ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: That should be applied in the same way to all the continuities of the sense organs.

original: 'on kyang skyon dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i rgyun las yid kyi bcas pa las rmi lam mi bzad pa sna tshogs 'byung ba yin pas na 'chi bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang skyon dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i rgyun las yid kyi bcas pa las rmi lam mi bzad pa sna tshogs 'byung ba yin pas na 'chi bar 'gyur la /
translated: But when the continuum of the sense faculties is impaired, various unbearable dreams occur due to mental activity.

original: mi na ba ni nad kyis 'debs shing 'tsho ba the tshom dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi na ba ni nad kyis 'debs shing 'tsho ba the tshom dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is not sick becomes sick, and life becomes uncertain.

original: de la rmi lam rmi bar byed pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de la rmi lam rmi bar byed pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are seven causes of dreaming:

original: sngar mig gis gzugs kyi bye brag mthong ba dang / myong ba dang / rna bas thos pa dang / yid la gang 'dod pa'i dngos po dang / brtag pa dang / bsgom pa dang / nad kyi gzhi las byung ba ste bdun po de dag go //
analyzed: sngar mig gis gzugs kyi bye brag mthong ba dang / myong ba dang / rna bas thos pa dang / yid la gang 'dod pa'i dngos po dang / brtag pa dang / bsgom pa dang / nad kyi gzhi las byung ba ste bdun po de dag go //
translated: seeing, experiencing, hearing, desiring, investigating, meditating, and arising from a basis of illness.

original: de dag las mthong ba dang / myong ba dang / thos pa dang / 'dod pa dang / brtag pa las rmi lam 'byung ba 'di don med pa yin no ;
analyzed: de dag las mthong ba dang / myong ba dang / thos pa dang / 'dod pa dang / brtag pa las rmi lam 'byung ba 'di don med pa yin no ;
translated: Among these, dreams arising from seeing, experiencing, hearing, desiring, and investigating are meaningless.

original: / de la nad gzhi gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi rmi lam nam mkha' la 'phur ba dang / me mthong ba dang / chu mthong ba dang / de dag kyang don med pa yin no //
analyzed: / de la nad gzhi gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi rmi lam nam mkha' la 'phur ba dang / me mthong ba dang / chu mthong ba dang / de dag kyang don med pa yin no //
translated: The dream of flying in the sky, seeing fire, or seeing water, which are the nature of the three humors, are also meaningless.

original: gzhan yang sngar rmi lam gsal ba las phyis brjed cing mi dran pa dang / rmi lam mang po yun ring du rmi pa dang / yun thung bar rma ba dang / 'di dag kyang don med pa'i rmi lam mo //
analyzed: gzhan yang sngar rmi lam gsal ba las phyis brjed cing mi dran pa dang / rmi lam mang po yun ring du rmi pa dang / yun thung bar rma ba dang / 'di dag kyang don med pa'i rmi lam mo //
translated: Moreover, forgetting and not remembering a dream that was previously clear, dreaming many dreams for a long time, or dreaming for a short time, these are also meaningless dreams.

original: gzhan du nam gyi cha stod la rmi lam rmis pa ni 'bras bu yun ring par ston pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan du nam gyi cha stod la rmi lam rmis pa ni 'bras bu yun ring par ston pa 'am /
translated: Otherwise, if a dream is dreamt in the first part of the night, it indicates a result that will be shown in the long term,

original: chung ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: chung ba'i rtags so //
translated: or it is a sign of a small result.

original: nang par ba lang bzas la gtong ba'i dus su rmi lam rmi ba ni 'phral 'bras bu chen po ston pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: nang par ba lang bzas la gtong ba'i dus su rmi lam rmi ba ni 'phral 'bras bu chen po ston pa'i rtags so //
translated: If a dream is dreamt at the time of giving food to the cows in the morning, it is a sign of indicating a great result immediately.

original: @93b rmi lam bzang po rmis na rmi lam gzhan gyis bar mi chod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: @93b rmi lam bzang po rmis na rmi lam gzhan gyis bar mi chod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If a good dream is dreamt, in order to prevent other dreams from interrupting it,

original: gnyid log par mi bya ste 'bel ba'i gtam bya'o //
analyzed: gnyid log par mi bya ste 'bel ba'i gtam bya'o //
translated: one should not go to sleep but engage in conversation.

original: gal te sdig pa'i rmi lam rmi na ni zhi ba'i sbyin sreg dang / sbyin pa dang / bzlas brjod dang / bsgom pa dang / bkra shis mang po yang bya'o ;
analyzed: gal te sdig pa'i rmi lam rmi na ni zhi ba'i sbyin sreg dang / sbyin pa dang / bzlas brjod dang / bsgom pa dang / bkra shis mang po yang bya'o ;
translated: If one dreams of sinful dreams, one should perform a pacifying fire sacrifice, give gifts, recite [mantras], meditate, and perform many benedictions.

original: / ci ste mi dge ba rmi lam gyi nang du mthong na /
analyzed: / ci ste mi dge ba rmi lam gyi nang du mthong na /
translated: If one sees non-virtue in a dream,

original: de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir yang gnyid log par bya ste /
analyzed: de zhi bar bya ba'i phyir yang gnyid log par bya ste /
translated: one should go to sleep again in order to pacify it.

original: rmi lam bzang po phyis byung na snga ma don med pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam bzang po phyis byung na snga ma don med pa yin no //
translated: If a good dream occurs later, the former [dream] is meaningless.

original: gzhan yang 'og nas 'byung ba 'di dag rmi na tshe ring ba la sogs pa'i yon tan 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'og nas 'byung ba 'di dag rmi na tshe ring ba la sogs pa'i yon tan 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, if one dreams of these [things] that will occur later, qualities such as a long life will arise.

original: de yang lha dang / bram ze dang / khyu mchog dang / grogs po gson po dang / rgyal po dang / skyes bu dam pa dang / snyan par grags pa'i mi dang / me 'bar ba dang / grub pa dang / mtsho shin tu dangs pa dang /
analyzed: de yang lha dang / bram ze dang / khyu mchog dang / grogs po gson po dang / rgyal po dang / skyes bu dam pa dang / snyan par grags pa'i mi dang / me 'bar ba dang / grub pa dang / mtsho shin tu dangs pa dang /
translated: [They are:] a god, a brahmin, a bull, a living friend, a king, a holy man, a famous person, a blazing fire, a siddha, a very clear lake,

original: khye'u dang / bu mo lus mdog dkar la cung zad dmar ba dang / gos dkar la shin tu 'tsher ba dang / mi'i sha za ba dang / lus la me 'bar ba dang / lus thams cad khrag gis byugs par rmis pa dang / mdor na rmi ltas kyi mtshan ma bzang po de dag mthong na /
analyzed: khye'u dang / bu mo lus mdog dkar la cung zad dmar ba dang / gos dkar la shin tu 'tsher ba dang / mi'i sha za ba dang / lus la me 'bar ba dang / lus thams cad khrag gis byugs par rmis pa dang / mdor na rmi ltas kyi mtshan ma bzang po de dag mthong na /
translated: In short, if one sees these good signs in a dream,

original: tshe ring ba dang / nad nyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe ring ba dang / nad nyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will have a long life and few illnesses.

original: gzhan du na gdugs dang / me long dang / dug dang / sha rlon pa dang / sna ma'i me tog dkar po dang / gos dang / mi gtsang bas lus byugs pa'i mi dang / shing tog aa mra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnyed par rmis na mchog tu bzang ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na gdugs dang / me long dang / dug dang / sha rlon pa dang / sna ma'i me tog dkar po dang / gos dang / mi gtsang bas lus byugs pa'i mi dang / shing tog aa mra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnyed par rmis na mchog tu bzang ba yin no //
translated: Otherwise, if one dreams of finding an umbrella, a mirror, poison, fresh meat, white jasmine flowers, clothes, a person smeared with filth on the body, fruits such as mangoes, it is extremely good.

original: ri mthon po dang / khang bzangs kyi steng dang / shing 'bras bu can dang 'di rnams la 'dzeg pa dang / seng ge dang / mi dang / glang po che dang / rta 'am ba lang gis drangs pa'i shing rta dang / 'di dag la zhon par rmis na de ni bde ba sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: ri mthon po dang / khang bzangs kyi steng dang / shing 'bras bu can dang 'di rnams la 'dzeg pa dang / seng ge dang / mi dang / glang po che dang / rta 'am ba lang gis drangs pa'i shing rta dang / 'di dag la zhon par rmis na de ni bde ba sbyin par byed do //
translated: If one dreams of climbing high mountains, the top of a mansion, or a fruit tree, or of riding lions, humans, elephants, horses, or a chariot drawn by oxen, this is a dream that grants happiness.

original: chu bo chen po dang / mtsho bran dang / rgya mtsho chen po gang yang rung ba shar phyogs nas byang phyogs su rgal bar rmis na 'di yang bde ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: chu bo chen po dang / mtsho bran dang / rgya mtsho chen po gang yang rung ba shar phyogs nas byang phyogs su rgal bar rmis na 'di yang bde ba skyed par byed do //
translated: If one dreams of crossing any great river, lake, or ocean from east to north, this also generates happiness.

original: rigs nga na dang 'grogs pa dang / bdag nyid shi bar rmis na yang tshe ring ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dge ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs nga na dang 'grogs pa dang / bdag nyid shi bar rmis na yang tshe ring ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dge ba yin no //
translated: If one dreams of being in a low caste, associating with them, or dying oneself, this is a virtuous sign of longevity, and so forth.

original: lam nyam nga ba nas 'byung ba dang / lha rnams dang / pha ma la mchod @94a * //
analyzed: lam nyam nga ba nas 'byung ba dang / lha rnams dang / pha ma la mchod @94a * //
translated: If one dreams of emerging from a dangerous path, or of worshipping gods, parents, or gurus, or of seeing a stupa, this is a dream that grants happiness.

original: par rmis pa dang / bdag nyid du ba dang / rdeg 'chos pa las ldang ba dang / dgra pham par byas pa dang / skyes bu gang gis de ltar rmis na /
analyzed: par rmis pa dang / bdag nyid du ba dang / rdeg 'chos pa las ldang ba dang / dgra pham par byas pa dang / skyes bu gang gis de ltar rmis na /
translated: If one dreams of a fire, smoke, or a beating, and then gets up, or if one defeats an enemy, or if a person dreams like that,

original: tshe ring ba dang / nad med pa dang / nor mang po rnyed pa la sogs pa thob pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: tshe ring ba dang / nad med pa dang / nor mang po rnyed pa la sogs pa thob pa'i rtags so //
translated: it is a sign of obtaining a long life, good health, much wealth, and so forth.

original: gzhan yang nad pa'i yon tan khyim du bkra shis shing dam pa rnams kyi spyod tshul dang ldan pa dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / nye du dang / g-yog 'khor dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang nad pa'i yon tan khyim du bkra shis shing dam pa rnams kyi spyod tshul dang ldan pa dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / nye du dang / g-yog 'khor dang ldan zhing /
translated: Moreover, the qualities of a patient are that his house is auspicious and he has the conduct of holy people, and he has a wife, sons, daughters, relatives, and attendants.

original: de yang snying nye zhing mthun par 'jug pa dang / sman la yid ches pa dang / sman mang po 'chang ba dang / snying stobs che ba dang / pho nya dang ldan pa dang / gtsang sbra che ba dang / sman pa dang / bram ze la gus pa dang /
analyzed: de yang snying nye zhing mthun par 'jug pa dang / sman la yid ches pa dang / sman mang po 'chang ba dang / snying stobs che ba dang / pho nya dang ldan pa dang / gtsang sbra che ba dang / sman pa dang / bram ze la gus pa dang /
translated: He is also affectionate and agreeable, has confidence in medicine, keeps a lot of medicine, is courageous, has a messenger, is very clean, and is respectful to doctors and brahmans.

original: nad pa dang nad g-yog gnyis kyang sman dpyad kyi gso ba la sems skyo ba med pa dang / mdor na gong du smos pa'i bkra shis pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'di dag dang ldan pa'i nad pa ni bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: nad pa dang nad g-yog gnyis kyang sman dpyad kyi gso ba la sems skyo ba med pa dang / mdor na gong du smos pa'i bkra shis pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'di dag dang ldan pa'i nad pa ni bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma yin no //
translated: In brief, the patient who has these qualities, such as the auspicious signs mentioned above, is a sign of attaining happiness.

original: de la lus kyi gnas zhes bya ba 'di skye ba dang 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin pas lus kyi gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyi gnas zhes bya ba 'di skye ba dang 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin pas lus kyi gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the so-called bodily location is called that because it teaches the characteristics of birth and death.

original: lus kyi gnas las 'phrin pa'i mtshan ma las 'chi ltas su bstan pa'i le'u tha ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas las 'phrin pa'i mtshan ma las 'chi ltas su bstan pa'i le'u tha ma rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the signs of death taught from the signs arising from the bodily location is completed.

original: nad kyi dbyibs tshul ci 'dra ba dang / nad dmigs kyi nad kyi bye brag gsal bar mngon pa dang / nad kyi rtags dang / nad kyi mtshan nyid dang / nad kyi mtshan ma ci yin pa bye brag phyed par shes pa'o //

translated: This is called “understanding the nature of a disease.” It means understanding the nature of the disease, the specific basis of the disease’s presence, the signs of the disease, the characteristics of the disease, and the symptoms of the disease.

analyzed: dbyar gyi tshe ni rlung nad kyi nad bslangs nas mkhris pa dang bad kan du ldan pa dang rims nad du 'gyur ro //
translated: In summer, it is triggered by wind disorders and becomes a fever associated with bile and phlegm.

original: ston ni mkhris pa'i nad slong ste de'i grogs bad kan gyis byas pas rims nad du 'gyur te de lta bu la kha zas smyung bar byas kyang /
analyzed: ston ni mkhris pa'i nad slong ste de'i grogs bad kan gyis byas pas rims nad du 'gyur te de lta bu la kha zas smyung bar byas kyang /
translated: In autumn, it is triggered by bile disorders and becomes a fever caused by phlegm acting as its companion. Even if one fasts on such a day,

analyzed: ston nyams mthu skye ba'i dus yin pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //

original: dpyid ka ni bad kan las nad du 'gyur ba'i dus yin te /
analyzed: dpyid ka ni bad kan las nad du 'gyur ba'i dus yin te /

analyzed: bad kan gyi rims nad langs pa'i zla la rlung dang mkhris pa'i nad kyang de'i rjes la 'byung ngo //
translated: In the month when the phlegm fever arises, wind and bile disorders also occur after that.

original: mi nyams 'tshag che ba zhig la rims nad tsha bas chung du zhig gis sngar btab la phyi nas nad de ma yin pa gnod pa'i nad bla brnan gzhan lta bus btab pa yang med na rims nad de lta bu ni gso sla ba zhes bya'o //

translated: If a person with a strong constitution is afflicted by a mild fever, and if there is no other illness that is superimposed on the previous fever, such as a different type of hot fever, then such a fever is said to be easy to treat.

original: yang nad pa'o cog gi nad gso ba la /
analyzed: yang nad pa'o cog gi nad gso ba la /
translated: Furthermore, in the treatment of all illnesses,

analyzed: 'tsho'am mi 'tsho dka' sla ci 'dra ba brtag pa ni nad pa'i kha gdong la sogs pa ji ltar gyur pa'i tshul dang lta ba dang mtshan ma shes par bya ba'i dmigs bshad pa dang sbyor la /
translated: the prognosis of whether the patient will live or die, and the difficulty of the treatment, should be determined by the condition of the patient’s face and so forth, and by the knowledge of the signs and indications, as explained in the section on the examination.

analyzed: rims nad rnam pa lnga car yang phal cher ni 'dus pa'i rims nad du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la rgyun gyi rims ni lus kyi srog zungs bdun dang / bshad gci dang / rtsa kun la rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gyi rims nad kyis khyab par byas nas lus kun tsha bar gyur te /

original: rkang lag rengs bag tu 'dug ste /
analyzed: rkang lag rengs bag tu 'dug ste /

analyzed: de'i tshe rgyun gyi rims de ni dmigs kyis lus kyi nang na bcud dangs ma zhes bya ba la brten cing 'dug ste /
translated: At that time, the chronic fever is based on and resides in what is called the pure essence within the body.

original: rims nad de la sogs pa'i dpyad kyang dka' la /
analyzed: rims nad de la sogs pa'i dpyad kyang dka' la /
translated: It is difficult to diagnose fevers such as these.

original: bzod par yang rab tu dka'o //
analyzed: bzod par yang rab tu dka'o //

original: rims nad de lta bus khong pa'i nang gi bshang gci dri ma la bab ste /
analyzed: rims nad de lta bus khong pa'i nang gi bshang gci dri ma la bab ste /
translated: If such a fever falls on the feces and urine in the stomach,

analyzed: gal te nad lus kyi srog zungs bdun pa la bab ste rims nad tshabs che ba des myur du @102a * //
translated: If the fever falls on the seventh life-force of the body and the powerful fever quickly

analyzed: smin cing tsha bas gdung bar byed na ni gso dka' ste mi rung ngo //

analyzed: 'dus pa'i rims nad rgyun ces bya ba de rlung las gyur pa'i rims nad yin na ni zhag bdun du gnas te /
translated: If the so-called continuous fever is a fever arising from wind, it lasts for seven days.

original: de yang gal te rlung ngam /
analyzed: de yang gal te rlung ngam /
translated: If it falls on wind,

analyzed: mkhris pa'am / bad kan nyid las bab ste nad nyid la gdung zhing smin par byed pa ni rims 'byang du rung ba zhes bya ste zhag bdun gyis 'tsho'o //
translated: bile, or phlegm, and the fever itself burns and ripens the disease, it is called “suitable for curing the fever,” and one lives for seven days.

original: srog zungs bdun po nyid khrag la sogs pa dang lus kyi dri ma bshang gci la bab ste /
analyzed: srog zungs bdun po nyid khrag la sogs pa dang lus kyi dri ma bshang gci la bab ste /
translated: If the fever falls on the blood and so forth of the seven life-forces and the body’s impurities of feces and urine,

analyzed: rims tsha ba des gdung zhing tshos par byed na ni rims 'byang du mi rung ba zhes bya ste zhag bdun gyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the fever torments and burns, it is called 'unsuitable for recovery' and one will die after seven days.

original: tshul de dang 'dra bar mkhris pa'i nad ni zhag bcus bye brag dbye'o //
analyzed: tshul de dang 'dra bar mkhris pa'i nad ni zhag bcus bye brag dbye'o //
translated: Similarly, bile diseases are distinguished by ten days.

original: bad kan gyi nad gzhi bcu gnyis kyi bye brag dbye'o //
analyzed: bad kan gyi nad gzhi bcu gnyis kyi bye brag dbye'o //
translated: Phlegm diseases are distinguished by twelve days.

analyzed: de ltar 'dus pa'i rims nad rgyun zhes bya ba'i rims de 'tsho ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i bye brag ni de ltar blta'o //

analyzed: zhes gna'i drang srong me bzhin 'jug de skad 'chad do //
translated: The ancient sage Agnivesha explained it thus.

translated: Again, the son of the sage Haritaki said that a fever arising from wind is distinguished by seven days, and that a specific distinction between living and dying is made by fourteen days.

analyzed: mkhris pa'i rims nad zhag dgus bye brag dbye zhes bya ba ni zhag bco brgyad kyis 'tsho 'chi'i bye brag dbye'o //
translated: A fever arising from bile is distinguished by nine days, and a specific distinction between living and dying is made by eighteen days.

analyzed: bad kan gyi rims nad zhag bcu gcig gis bye brag dbye zhes bya ba ni zhag nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis bye brag dbye'o //

original: de ltar rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gsum gyi rims nad 'dus pa'i rgyun zhes bya bas btab pa 'tsho 'chi'i bye brag gi tshigs ni de ltar ba lta zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: de ltar rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gsum gyi rims nad 'dus pa'i rgyun zhes bya bas btab pa 'tsho 'chi'i bye brag gi tshigs ni de ltar ba lta zhes 'chad do //
translated: Thus, it is explained that the continuous fever of the three humors wind, bile, and phlegm is a condition that is distinguished by the number of days, which is a specific of life and death.

original: rims nad grangs so sor bstan mod kyi 'on kyang nad pa nad rtse zhil na nyam chung ste rid pa /
analyzed: rims nad grangs so sor bstan mod kyi 'on kyang nad pa nad rtse zhil na nyam chung ste rid pa /
translated: Although the number of fevers is taught individually, nevertheless, when a patient is at the peak of the illness, he is weak and emaciated.

translated: If he does something harmful, such as eating or relying on something that is not suitable food, or engaging in activities, then even if the illness is slight, the seven life-forces harm the flesh and blood, and the illness grows in strength and the fever lasts for a long time, becoming an illness for which there is no remedy.🔽Sometimes it is severe.

original: res 'ga' ni tshabs chung ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni tshabs chung ste /
translated: Sometimes it is slight.

analyzed: rims nad de rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan rang rang gi dus @102b kyi che nad kyi stobs skyes /
translated: The fever grows in strength during the respective seasons of wind, bile, and phlegm.

original: nad la bar chad byed do //
analyzed: nad la bar chad byed do //
translated: It obstructs the treatment of the disease.

original: de ltar rims rgyun ring du gyur pa la yang sman dpyad kyi mthu skyed na ni rims nad phyin to //
analyzed: de ltar rims rgyun ring du gyur pa la yang sman dpyad kyi mthu skyed na ni rims nad phyin to //
translated: Thus, even in a long-lasting fever, if the power of medical treatment is generated, the fever is cured.

original: sman dpyad kyi mthu chung na ni rims nad mi phyin to //
analyzed: sman dpyad kyi mthu chung na ni rims nad mi phyin to //
translated: If the power of medical treatment is weak, the fever is not cured.

original: rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gyi nad dmigs zad /
analyzed: rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan gyi nad dmigs zad /
translated: When the diseases of wind, bile, and phlegm are exhausted,

analyzed: rims ni chung la phra bar gyur pa'i tshe na rims nad de pho ba'i nang gi bcud dangs ma'i nang na 'dug go //
translated: the fever becomes small and subtle. At that time, the fever resides within the pure essence of the digestive juices in the stomach.

original: de ltar rims de bcud dangs ma'i nang na 'dug par gyur na lus rid cing skem /
analyzed: de ltar rims de bcud dangs ma'i nang na 'dug par gyur na lus rid cing skem /

original: bzhin dang kha dog ngan /
analyzed: bzhin dang kha dog ngan /

analyzed: rmongs bag tu 'dug / khong snyom /
translated: One sits in a daze, with a feeling of fullness in the stomach.

original: kha zas yi gar mi 'ong ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha zas yi gar mi 'ong ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Food and so forth are not appealing.

original: de ltar bcud dangs ma dang rims su 'dres te pho ba na 'dug pa'i rtsa thams cad kyi sgo yang de na kha bye zhing 'dus pas rtsa sgo kun gyi nang na bcud dangs ma rims dang 'dres pa der song na lus thams cad la rgyun gyi rims
analyzed: de ltar bcud dangs ma dang rims su 'dres te pho ba na 'dug pa'i rtsa thams cad kyi sgo yang de na kha bye zhing 'dus pas rtsa sgo kun gyi nang na bcud dangs ma rims dang 'dres pa der song na lus thams cad la rgyun gyi rims
translated: Thus, the pure essence of the nutrient fluid mixes with the contagious disease and remains in the stomach. Since the openings of all the channels are open and gathered there, if the pure essence of the nutrient fluid mixed with the contagious disease enters the openings of all the channels, the contagious disease spreads throughout the body.

original: nad des myur du khyab ste na bar byed do //
analyzed: nad des myur du khyab ste na bar byed do //
translated: That disease quickly spreads and makes one ill.

translated: The so-called chronic contagious disease is a different mode of the so-called continuous contagious disease. All the diseases are also different.

analyzed: ji lta zhe na rgyun gyi rims de ni nyin zhag du ma zhig tu nyin mtshan rgyun du na'o //

analyzed: rtag pa'i rims 'di ni nyin par lan gnyis nad ldang / mtshan mo lan gnyis nad ldang zhing na bas de'i phyir mi 'dra'o //

analyzed: nad ldang ba'i dus kyang ma nges te res 'ga' snga dro /

analyzed: res 'ga' phyi dro /

original: res 'ga' nyi ma gung la na /
analyzed: res 'ga' nyi ma gung la na /

analyzed: rtag pa'i rims 'di nyid ni khrag la phal cher brten cing 'dug pa de ni rtag pa'i rims zhes bya'o //

analyzed: kha cig na re rtag pa'i rims de ni nyin lan gnyis na zhing mtshan lan gnyis na zhes kyang 'chad do //

analyzed: nyin gcig pa'i rims 'di ni rims kyi nang na nad tshabs mi che ba yin te gso sla'o //

analyzed: de la nyin gsum pa'i rims zhes bya ba ni nyin gcig @103a * //
translated: As for the three-day fever, on the first day

analyzed: dang po rims kyis btab la de'i phyi de nyin ni mi na'o //
translated: one is struck by the fever, and on the following day one is not feverish.

original: de'i yang phyi de nyin na bar byed pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i yang phyi de nyin na bar byed pa de lta bu'o //
translated: The next day after that, it makes one sick.

original: rims 'di ni tshil gyi rtsa ba'i nang na zhen cing 'dug pa yin te /
analyzed: rims 'di ni tshil gyi rtsa ba'i nang na zhen cing 'dug pa yin te /
translated: This fever is attached and lodged in the root of the fat.

original: mkhris pa dang rlung gnyis glad pa'i spyi bor zhugs shing zhen na glad pa'i spyi bo na'o ;
analyzed: mkhris pa dang rlung gnyis glad pa'i spyi bor zhugs shing zhen na glad pa'i spyi bo na'o ;
translated: If the bile and wind enter and attach to the top of the brain, it is in the top of the brain.

original: / rkang pa man chad dku dor na na bad kan dang mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad yin no //

analyzed: rkang ngam / rus pa'i nang na 'dug pa yin no //
